author: {'steamid': '76561198128420789', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1578536608}
review: I dont know if it's just my computer but this game is ass. Like the concept is cute and very unique but I cant get the game to play properly. It runs slower than a fat grandma. There isnt a legitimate setting menu any where and even with an "adjusted" controller setup it's still confusing to figure out. I dont want a refund, I just want this game fixed. If I could get it running like it's suppose to I would change my review instantly

author: {'steamid': '76561198418390686', 'num_games_owned': 2661, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 8490, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 349, 'last_played': 1575762237}
review: If it were not for the baffling almost non existent controller support, and terrible menus, I would whole-heartedly recommend this game based on the sprites alone. But basic features like the ability to quit a match(which requires holding 4 buttons+start) are missing. Selecting a character is confusing, there is no option for a rematch in VERSUS, and to quit to the desktop you have to alt+f4. Features common in even the most trash fighting games are absent or barely function here. You wont believe how needlessly complicated this game is. I had this game running on an arcade cabinet, which is why i have so many hours on it, but every time someone would try to play they would get stuck in menus. You also are able to control the desktop and mouse in the background so sometimes my friends would open other programs on the desktop while the game was running fullscreen, it was ridiculous. I wanted to love this game I uninstalled this game from my arcade cab just so i wouldn't have to subject anyone else to this confusing mess. Don't be a scrub like me and avoid this game at all costs.save your money to buy a dlc character or costume on a more well polished game that deserves your support more than this.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987292682', 'num_games_owned': 945, 'num_reviews': 320, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1586932377}
review:
[h1] Almost two years since I reported this being broken on linux and still no fix, stay away if you are using Linux[/h1]

The game is ok, if you like fighting games and lolis.

But it's advertised as supporting Linux and it doesn't, game won't even launch.

I've contacted the developers with logs entries and bug reports and they failed to fix my problem. I've tried to run the game in different computers with ubuntu 16.04 and 18.04 but the problem persist.

So, don't get it if you are running linux until it's fixed.

review: Vanguard Princess is a classic 2D Fighting Game that features an all-female cast each with their own unique Fighting Style. Choose from ten girls with unique Fighting Skills and pair them with a Powerful Partner to form an unstoppable Team.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972297308', 'num_games_owned': 4482, 'num_reviews': 203, 'playtime_forever': 124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1542545593}
review:
I just couldn't get into it.

The characters are cute, the voice acting seems decent (the little I heard of it), however I didn't enjoy the gameplay.

The game is poorly optimized, giving you basically no options at all as far as changing the resolution, graphics, sounds, etc.

Having to play a practice match which requires you to beat an AI opponent that does not move/attack at all five times(!) [i]every time[/i] you want to play story mode just seems stupid.

I didn't play the game for very long, and it might get better if you put more time into it and if you're actually able to find someone to play it with, however as it stands right now I can't recommend Vanguard Princess.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031313794', 'num_games_owned': 8531, 'num_reviews': 3393, 'playtime_forever': 358, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 358, 'last_played': 1539076646}
review:
[h1]Описание:[/h1]
То чувство, когда купился на тысячи хвалебных отзывов и взял не играя сразу и игру и все длс... Файтинг с тянками... Звучит круто, только если это не сделано на подобии какого-то RPG Maker. Разршение экрана 640x400? Серьезно? Да тянки дерутся, да куча эффектов, да красиво, но играть на одну двадцатую монитора? Это файтинг блин, а не рпг история, где пофиг какое разрешение. Обидно даже, что ключами брал, брал бы в стиме - сделал бы возврат. 

[h1]Оценка эпизода: 2/10[/h1]

[h1]Послесловие:[/h1]
Если вам понравился этот обзор добро пожаловать в группу
http://steamcommunity.com/groups/uojer - тут вы сможете увидеть рекомендованные мною игры, другие обзоры, а также просто пообщаться в хорошей компании.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11196, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1537772539}
review:
Vanguard Princess is a manga themed arcade fighter game where anime princesses fight with each other.

Resolution is fixed and aspect ratio is 4:3.   There's just too many shortcomings to recommend this.  Who's making 4:3 aspect ratios in 2014?  These guys apparently.

My guess is anyone still using a 4:3 CRT monitor in 2018 can't afford the $5 price tag for this anyway.

author: {'steamid': '76561198358007280', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1586731838}
review:
it does live up to its trailer. it has stunning visuals and a smooth gameplay. i also like how the graphics are pixelated like an old style nintendo game. that is a really nice touch. it says it has a story mode even though it doesnt really have a story and all you do is play as a sexy goddess fighting a cute adorable loli or another sexy goddess. and you can get used to the controls if you have the capacity. overall splendid work done on this game. i got the dlc and everything and i totally recommend it. the grades are:

out of 10

Visuals: 9/10
Graphics: 10/10
Characters: BLAND
Gameplay: 6/10
overall grade: C+

author: {'steamid': '76561198004708622', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 761, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 413, 'last_played': 1618147381}
review:
I normaly don't give reviews since I believe the liking in games is subjective, but people giving negatives
to this game just because they couldn't find out the full screen mode is enough to me to step in.

Ladies and Gentlemen, the game is fun and that's the main purpose, does it has some flaws?
yes it does, as many Triple A games do too, for those that are commenting this game has no 
full screeen mode I invite you to press F4 key when you load your game to change it to full screen.

I've got this game and believe guys has changed a lot since its first releases and I'm not talking about just
the steam realase this game was free to play on its first installments and I was so happy to see it made it to 
steam I still have my free copy of the game and yes I do own it now on steam. Why? because I think this is 
the kind of independant work that should be supported.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027267313', 'num_games_owned': 1838, 'num_reviews': 4460, 'playtime_forever': 176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 176, 'last_played': 1532945607}
review:
Tags: Tournament Combat
Additional Tags: Delete Local Content & Remove from Library

TLDR: The tagteam system is a bit iffy to get used to. Character balance is odd. Cool animations and sprites but the engine is poorly supported. Did not fullscreen or recognize inputs correctly anymore.

I tried firing this up again for comparison with newer Bandai or a more recent guilty gear but the menu and selection would randomly accept or refuse to accept inputs. I could not seem to fullscreen. Assets appeared stretched unpleasantly on-screen. 

I remember it being very janky back when it worked and I tried it years ago. The gal with the gun is useless when she runs out of ammo for example. All in all not a bad showing but just did not hold the test of time and ultimately you are better off archiving it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123450052', 'num_games_owned': 76, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 750, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 497, 'last_played': 1702478845}
review:
这款独立制作游戏已经算很良心的了，发布了这么多年至少年年有更新。
先说一下缺点，对新人不是很友好，我这种格斗游戏一上手就是这款游戏的一开始简直不知道要怎么玩，这游戏也没有什么新手教程，就是打剧情模式的时候一开始让你上手5回合，还给你个出招表。
优点就是这都是萌妹子啊，还有胖次给你看，嘿嘿嘿。
dlc除了新出的电子版漫画其余的都入手了，那个画风个人实在是接受不了。
隔一段时间就玩一会，慢慢研究华丽的连招技吧。

author: {'steamid': '76561197962318796', 'num_games_owned': 1334, 'num_reviews': 429, 'playtime_forever': 245, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 245, 'last_played': 1531379467}
review:
VP is an all-girl cast fighting game with some fanservice. Standard Light/Medium/Heavy attacks with support characters and meters. The move list is very limited, and it’s mostly based around quarter circles. It's very bare bones; VS mode and story mode. No training mode or anything else you might want out of a game like this. 

The most unfortunate thing about VP though is that it runs in a 640x480 (4:3) window which you need to scale manually. You can go into full screen with alt+tab but that will turn your monitor resolution down to 480p rather than upscale the game. 

Pantsu can fix many things, but not broken games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130854300', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1580783525}
review:
sim e um jogo indie e mediucre.
mas covenhamos ele custa apenas 8,49 e em promoção 2 ,54
esse jogo tem um trabalho de pixel art e uma animação linda e doce.
admito que eu so comprei o jogo e so gosto dele pela arte dele ser tão bonita e bela.
chego a dizer que ele e tão caprichado quanto skullgirls.
o sistema de luta dele e bem casual você so tem 3 botão de soco forte meio e fraco, um botão de assistente e um botão de parry.
minha dica se você gosta de anime de meninas fofas e uma arte linda do caralho.
compre e uma otima referencia sem duvidas.
agora se você procura um jogo de luta serio para jogar com amigos vai para outro.

author: {'steamid': '76561198153840515', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1625112286}
review:
Pains me to leave a negative review (especially for a visually stunning game such as this), but I wouldn't be doing my part to help the community if I'd sit idle.  The game is quite frankely, broken.  Fullscreen doesn't work unless you use a 3rd party borderless app for modern OSs, and controls tend to bug out (interesting is the case when one or more of your inputs randomly brings up the help screen, even if the assingment is not in any way mapped to it), which are the biggest offenders.  There's also no netplay, so unless you have a scene in your area for local matches, you won't be getting much out of this one.  Considering how bad the former issues are, it wouldn't succeed in an online environment anyways.  I really, really, REALLY wanted to like this game and it could have been an instant favorite, but the flaws destroys any potential the game had and believe me, it looked like it had a lot of it.

Unless something changes and the game gets fixed in a patch, I cannot recommend Vanguard Princess.  At all.  Forget about this one.  Save your cash and grab Blazeblue or Skullgirls, which are infinitely better games anyway.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111306565', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 103, 'last_played': 1585744413}
review:
Update, 4/1/2020: purchased the Online Deluxe update, and it appears to have made things worse.  Cannot use my controller at all, and game crashes.  Cannot recommend anymore until the game is fixed.  Please fix it dev's.  

This game is fun, especially for the price.  The only gripe is the controller issues.  It was a pain figuring out how to get my DS4 to work, and after I was unable to asign my buttons.  Also, in vs. mode I could not figure out how to only control my character.  The game registered my inputs as applicable to both 1st and 2nd player, making practicing impossible.  If you have a fix share it!  Aside from that, the game is good.  Recommend it.  Go indie!

author: {'steamid': '76561198083715392', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1527319512}
review:
oddly no full screen option. so ya gotta play it in max sized window mode. beyond that. its real good. 
the plot nothing special. each of the all girl cast (common anime trope) has her own story, set of moves and combos.
the oddest thing is your team mate. its a 2 on 2 fighting game. for some reason your partner never takes over, (just as well she looks tiny.) also TRIGGER WARNING. all loli girls. that said. this is so tame. 
while the outfits are beyond weird, and a bit on the sexy side. thats about as far as the astetic goes. while id love to see this cosplayed at comicon, its not likely cause these girls are, kinda forgetable. not many will stand out to you, but you will have a favorite.  they look good. but you can tell this game had a small team working on it. 
the game itself is, well chaotic. as a 2d fighter goes, the back grounds and the characters blend too well. you will have a hard time at first telling the difference between the foreground and the back ground, and using your extra fighter is kinda akward. but its fast paced and fun once you find the grove. i solidily recommend this. especially if your in it for the cheesecake.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059551616', 'num_games_owned': 360, 'num_reviews': 132, 'playtime_forever': 553, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 553, 'last_played': 1526951837}
review:
Vanguard Princess fue originalmente desarrollado por Suge9 utilizando el motor "2D Fighter Maker 2nd" y se encuentra disponible como freeware.

Ahora seguro viene la pregunta: ¿por qué lo compraste?

En un principio compré este juego para agradecer a Tomoaki Sugeno por la gran cantidad de horas que pasé jugando la versión gratuita (mas tarde se sumaría una donación para los afectados del terremoto/tsunami que aconteció en Japón durante el 2011) y porque estaba disponible en inglés.

Esta versión distribuida por eigoMANGA funcionaba perfecto en sus inicios pero las mejoras y los diferentes DLC fueron rompiendo el producto.
Los controles no siempre funcionan, agregaron una práctica de 5 rondas no cancelable al inicio del modo historia y la dificultad no se puede cambiar.

A pesar de tener un precio bajo, voy a tener que desaconsejarlo por sus diversos problemas técnicos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067359292', 'num_games_owned': 474, 'num_reviews': 308, 'playtime_forever': 209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1448177996}
review:
Don't let my small number of hours deceive you, I have played this game from long ago and for a long time, before it was added to steam it was basically a free PC game.

Its a solid fighting game, if you know the story about it, this game was originally free and a passion project from Tomoaki Sugeno, its impressive for a single man project and incedibly well animated and balanced as a fighting game, I personally payed for it on steam mostly as a thanks for the developer for making it originally free and still offer a quality game.

The one gripe I have with this game is the boss, which in true KOF fashion is overpowered and cheap, and which you will likely need to cheese in order to defeat. Other than that is an impressive game and gives enjoyable fighting experience, its visually stunning and it has changed over time to become more spectacular (for example, the additions of animation clips for the special moves)

Would definetly recommed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010277861', 'num_games_owned': 792, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1580855514}

author: {'steamid': '76561198017853075', 'num_games_owned': 577, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 140, 'last_played': 1526758059}
review:
Kupiłem tą grę, gdyż urzekła mnie kreska ze screenów. Na szczęście gra była w promocji. 
Dwa tryby i nic poza tym. Z tym, że tryb Story, nawet na poziomie "easy", dosyć wymagający.
Gra stworzona tylko i wyłącznie dla miłośników mang i anime, którzy lubią walczące laski w 2D.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081016925', 'num_games_owned': 1576, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1414662713}
review:
I know what people may be thinking when they see this "OMG! Vanguard Princess on steam, MUST GET!" but please resist the impulse as what you're getting isn't what you'd expect.

What one'd expect: fully compatible with recent windows OS/steam support/actual rebalances

What you get: The last real rev of the game (made however long ago) with some publisher made stuff as DLCs (as to try to get some life out of it)

So do yourself a favor and don't go for this.... well at least not without a big discount or bundle on it if you're that curious.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075883037', 'num_games_owned': 4310, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 177, 'last_played': 1523001549}
review:
I purchased this game a while ago in a bundle and just recently gave it a try. I have over 2 hours playtime and I honestly couldn't find any enjoyment in this fighting game. Honestly, it feels like the developer gave up less than half way through the development process and hurried to put it up for sale as fast as they could. The UI is basically stock from whatever Fighter Maker Development software that was used and it has barely any functionality. The default resolution is extremely tiny and 480p is the maximum resolution for the game and on top of it there's no Steam overlay support. The controls for this, both keyboard and the Xbox 360 controller. There's no tutorial and only 3 modes and 2 of them feel almost exactly the same. Character development is and balancing is almost non existent as I don't believe I saw one update mentioning character balance which is sorely needed. Some characters are extremely OP while others suffer with poor damage and bad skills/powers/attacks. Almost every "update" since launch has been about sales and very little about making the game better. This is an extremely easy "Don't Recommend".

TL;DR It feels like a poorly put together M.U.G.E.N. game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073640466', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 572, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 227, 'last_played': 1710730546}
review:
Tenía mis reservas frente a este juego por las reseñas que leí. El juego es sencillamente hermoso desde el punto de vista estético y tiene una banda sonora genial. Tiene un nivel de dificultad elevado, lo cual le agrega más emoción al juego. Dentro de las pocas cosas malas que le veo es la falta de cinemáticas, una historia muy mediocre y no tener la posibilidad de jugarlo con otras personas por Internet. Lo otro es que no me gusta eso del fanservice -pero sí lo de anime-, aunque se que hay gente que si le gusta. Lo recomiendo en rebaja.

Quería comprar este juego porque es de los pocos juegos de pelea en Linux, además de tener estilo anime. El juego no corre nativamente, sino a través de una botella de Crossover. Despues de instalarlo no se puede iniciar, por lo que toca hacer lo siguiente:

Ir a terminal y hacer un enlace simbólico del archivo libsteam_api.so de la carpeta del juego en el directorio /usr/lib

sudo ln -s /home/tu_nombre_de_usuario/.local/share/Steam/steamapps/common/vanguard-princess/libsteam_api.so /usr/lib/libsteam_api.so

El juego debería mostrar una ventana que dice que se está creando una botella de Crossover. Luego de eso inicia el juego.

Como otro dato curioso es que es plenamente compatible con los gamepad Logitech que tienen una buena relación calidad-precio.

En fin, compra recomendada.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053560912', 'num_games_owned': 585, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1518768470}
review:
Honestly, this game is only worth $1
Free if it has to. It only has Singleplayer and local multiplayer (same computer using different controls).
I recommend this game to those who have a windows xp or old operating systems that can't run high end games.

Other than that, I would have rated this down. Full screen is a bit messed up, move-set on some characters are so darn crazy that attempting to do it will burn out your thumb, and overall the game is pretty short after playing about 20 minutes of it. Please don't use keyboard- use a Xbox controller.
A game similar to this, is called: Skullgirls - and it way better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128285760', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 146, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1558813979}
review:
A really fun little gem of a fighting game, with impressive smooth sprites, cool roster full of anime girls [strike] that flash their panties [/strike] and fast paced gameplay and what makes the whole package more impressive is that it's basicaly a one-man project. It still feels a bit of a niche product with limited graphics options and restricted to local multiplayer but if you want to have some quick fun with your friends this is not a bad choice.

A nice little passion project! 

[i] my steam playtime does not reflect the actual time i spent with the game because i used to play an older pre-Steam version that was available in the past for free. [/i]

review: Game does not boot on Linux without a "workaround" that involves temporarily breaking all other steam games. Windows version runs smoothly, but has no fullscreen options and has limited gamepad support (does not detect input of my DS4 over bluetooth). Game looks great, and plays well if you can get it to boot, but I probably wouldn't have bought it had I known these issues.

author: {'steamid': '76561198375425696', 'num_games_owned': 84, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1515276346}
review: I typically love fighting games especially challenging ones, I however don't consider AI spamming the same juggling attack and ranged attack a challenge but instead a poor development choice. I also bought all dlc, the character dlc is fine since it... well adds an additional character. as for the art is very dissapointing with 21 portraits several being repeat art work, none of which is integrated into the game but instead in its own folder which is okay I guess but there's no option for practice mode instead you have to go at it in a very round about way, and it's okay since the game's easy as far as combos go since the only real challenge is spammed attacks especially by the final boss so pass this game up unless you are a die hard fighting game lover of all types because the lacklust menu opts and lack of content made me regret the purchase.

author: {'steamid': '76561198361796286', 'num_games_owned': 3797, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 468, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 462, 'last_played': 1510893639}
review:
这是真正意义上我玩的第一款日呆格斗。
认识它纯粹是因为它进了包...
作为一个比较早期的FTG游戏，它的画面可以说是十分精良的。（2009）
重点是里面人物全是妹子好不好！！
缺点是按键的默认键位反人类，每次都要自己调，还有技能的确太难放了。
摇杆玩家可以试试360，反正键盘玩家是欲哭无泪。
百度了一下发现这游戏还是09年度最华丽同人格斗游戏。
[url=]https://rc.mbd.baidu.com/tzhzerq[/url]
总而言之这个价格完全值得，想玩FTG和想看妹子的小伙伴们都可以来试一试哟。

author: {'steamid': '76561198123058089', 'num_games_owned': 278, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 310, 'last_played': 1514442191}
review:
[h1] ENTRETENIDO PERO OLVIDABLE [/h1]
Este es uno de esos juegos que agregas a tu biblioteca nada más por chicas/anime/tetonas/que enseñan… Luego piensas ¿si con ese dinero pudiste comprar algo mejor?

[b] Gráficos: [/b]
Están lindos… Si, solo eso. No son nada espectaculares pero cumplen con su trabajo. Los diseños de los personajes es su punto fuerte, ya que hay muchos interesante y uno que otro que te sonara a verlo visto en otro lado.

[b] Interface:[/b]
Le falta mucho. [strike]El que sea un juego indie o de pequeña producción no lo exonera de que faltan algunas cosas que cualquier juego peleas debe de tener[/strike]. Es muy confuso navegar por el juego, no sabes dónde están las configuraciones ni como entrar en la lista de movimientos de los personaje. Por cierto la lista de movimientos esta pésimamente elaborada. Algunos movimientos especiales ni siquiera están contemplados. y  ni hablar de los movimientos de tu acompáñate. muchas veces te preguntaras como le hago para que saque ese movimiento que la maquina si puede sacar. Otro de los puntos en contra es que solo podrás jugar de manera local... así es nada de partirte la madre con un asiático.

[b] IA:[/b]
Muy fácil. A mí no me dio problemas ni en modo Hard, aunque algunos personajes si son un dolor de cabeza más que nada porque están desbalanceados. Así como algunos asistentes que van de inútiles hasta al otro extremo de hacerte más daño que los golpes del rival. 

[b]Jugabilidad: [/b]
Es algo adictiva pero pierde el encanto rápido, [i][b][u]es bueno para iniciar en los juegos de peleas [/u][/b][/i], algunos personajes son comberos de un solo botón. Los ataques especiales se ejecutan fácil y responden bien. Se usan 4 botones; Fuerte, débil, normal y un botón para activar al asistente. También tienes otro que es para poder ejecutar el ataque super o una especie de parry. La simplicidad de botones hace que te sientas como un experto, pero repito el encanto se va rápido. 

[b] Música:[/b]
Entretenida, pero olvidable.

[h1] Conclusión: [/h1]
[b]Cómpralo en oferta. Es un juego que aunque no es malo pasara rápidamente al olvido de tu colección.[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198370045995', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1530739902}
review:
Подключил PSP как геймпад к компу и горя не знаю )
Игруха хорошая, всё вполне устраивает. 
Плюсы: 
1) Отличная анимешная рисовка, мне понравилась. Хоть отчасти и пиксельная, но для меня это даже плюс, ибо я олдфаг )
2) Игровой процесс весьма увлекательный и интерессный, есть много фишек и комбинаций. Конечно, до Наруто 2 на зызке не дотягивает, но вполне достойная замена.
3) Красивая, мелодичная музыка хорошо вписывается в игру и сюжет, заставляет мечтать (да, там даже есть какой-то сюжет, инглиш на средне-низком уровне).

Минусы: 
1) Я думал что это самостоятельная игра для винды, но видимо это порт. По этому в самом начале придётся растянуть окошко на весь экран (при этом сделать полностью на весь экран не получится, для этого придётся скачать прогу, она есть в обсуждениях, либо в ручную поставить галочку "автоматически скрывать панель задач") и придётся поднастроить управление. То есть стандартные небольшие неудобства, которые можно встретить в портах. 
2) Пиксельная графика это конечно хорошо и мило, но порой, в разгаре боя сложно понять что творится на экране )

Итог: в игре есть много плюсов и несколько не значительных минусов, по этому ставлю 5-

author: {'steamid': '76561198106239384', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1531514309}
review:
[EDIT] the menus are no longer slow for me! All it took was booting up the game a second time after installing the DLC's. No more technical issues for me.

I see a lot of negative reviews that go into depth about why they don't recommend the game, but the positive reviews don't say a lot, so... allow me.

This game is a hidden gem of sorts, I have found. A lot of people are reporting technical issues with the game, which, I myself have experienced, but managed to get the ones I had fixed, so I'll quickly go over what I did to get this game functioning pretty much perfectly. I went into control panel, game controllers, and set the controller I wished to use as my preferred controller; older games use this feature to detect the player 1 controller. After that, the only issue I was having technical-wise was that the menus (both main menu and character select) were somehow lagging (the mode select post-character select is fine though); I have not yet fixed this issue, but it's not a game-ruiner like the controller issue was.

The gameplay itself is fantastic - simple yet satisfying, with good character diversity and a neat little assist system with unique, non-playable, assister characters (kinda like the strikers from KOF I guess, except they have more than one move, and charge up multiple bars to do stronger assists via directional input plus the assist button). Attacks are a fairly standard light-medium-heavy arrangement, with a dedicated button for parrying (when pressed with no directional input, and is also a great mechanic), and then is also your dedicated super button (when using the corresponding directional input). A fun little trick is, if you have your super meter full, is to parry your opponent and go straight into a super - super satisfying!

The "story" mode (basically an arcade mode) scales in difficulty nicely, and the final boss, while I beat it on my first try, definitely had me going for a little bit. There's streak mode, which is basically a survival mode where characters are thrown at you one after another, not regaining health each time, simply seeing how long you can stick it out for. Then, finally, is team mode, which is boggling my mind at the moment, as it pits you with your main character and your assist character against a team of two player characters - this mode will wreck your stuff if you play it straight away, so I recommend playing through the story mode first and finding your most comfortable character.

You will want to play around with the roster and find a character that's best for you (obviously), as the characters are really well diversified (I personally found Eri to be good for me - speedy punchy!)

The music is fun to listen to, and the artstyle is cute (I really like the super/win screen animations). The sound effects and visuals provide good feedback - you know when you've parried someone and you know when you've been thrown, amongst other things as well, of course.

My only real negative complaint is the lack of online multiplayer; if this could be implemented in the future (though I wouldn't hold my breath - this game is fairly old now), that would be super awesome.

Overall, it's worth a shot for the cheap price; not perfect, but definitely a lot of fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053653851', 'num_games_owned': 402, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1510979141}

author: {'steamid': '76561198057787296', 'num_games_owned': 271, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1624161317}
review:
I don't dislike this game. It has heart and passion written all over it (being a one-man doujin project) but unfortunately the amount of shortcomings in the game makes this a hard one to recommend.

Pros:
- [b]The spritework and animation is actually pretty damn good.[/b]
- Mechanics are solid.
- Ummm... Boobs I guess?

Cons:
- 480p is its maximum resolution.
- Sound design is just below passable. Hit and block sounds sound pretty much the same.
- Stages with background characters make the game pretty visually noisy making it hard to track what's happening.
- Assist characters are constantly on screen even if they're not doing anything adding to further visual noise.
- There's no tutorial or practice mode
- Severely lacking in game modes.
- Poor UI design
- Considering it's made with what is essentially the fighting game equivalent of RPGMaker, it feels very much like you're playing on an emulator i.e. settings are clunky and you're playing on a tiny window.
- Boobs I guess? For those who aren't into that.

That being said, it's a cheap enough game so that alleviates some of these cons and I personally got the game for free so...¯\_(ツ)_/¯

review:
[h1][b]Análisis Preliminar (5.5/10.0)[/b][/h1]

Iniciemos … este es un Juego Muy bueno, por eso te invito Agrégalo, ¡¡¡ pero con descuento. !!!

Calma , léelo todo antes de continuar. pues es Costoso para lo que ofrece.


Vanguard Princess es un juego de lucha similar a Street Fighter, Mortal Kombat etc etc , aunque la diferencia más notable en este juego es que todos los luchadores son chicas con poderes ocultos.

El juego parece simple y podría hacerse en minutos si tuviera el arte correcto, pero la atención en detalle a los sprites solo llama su atención ...

El combate es fluido y el Modo Historia solo tiene cambios como encuentros de personajes y post-final.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103185001', 'num_games_owned': 478, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 87, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1646443175}
review:
I'm going to avoid talking /too much/ about the technical issues of the game before saying what I thought about the game itself (I'll only bring it up when they did become a hinderance to the gamplay experience itself), because as long as the game can be run and played comfortably (In addition to being a good game on it's own), I think it can still be recommended despite technical faults.

It's a shame I can't in good faith recommend this game. 

I picked up Vanguard Princess due to it's low price point, and I'm always up to try new 2D fighters, especially those of the anime variety, being a huge Blazblue fan. I did end up doing a little research on the game to see if it would be worth it, and deemed that, at it's price point, it would be worth picking up. Given the game's creator working on games such as KOF: Neo Blood (A GBA KOF game based on KOF 99) I hoped at least for a decent 2D fighter. I didn't exactly get that. 

Vanguard Princess is a mess of a fighting game. With very few options, only a 'Story' (It's an Arcade mode with dialogue after a few set fights, something that was popularized in Arcades in the 90's) and VS. Mode. The game is made in Fighter Maker 2nd, so the options are all on a bar above the actual game screen. And by that, I mean the controller options are there. The only video option is to return the game to it's default resolution, which is rather small. I don't mind that, given the engine, and the game's real initial release date being in 2009. 

The default keyboard option is nearly unplayable (For me at least) though rebinding it does quickly ease that, even if the descriptions of the buttons aren't too useful for those who are new to fighting games, as it lists the buttons as 'Weak, Normal, Heavy, Assist, Special/Parry, and No action.' The No Action bit is likely as it's a five-button fighting game made for an engine designed for six-button ones. Acceptable. Though for new fighting game players, the issue is that the movelist uses A,B,C, and X, rather than W,N,H, and S, with no in game explanation as to what any of the listed letters correspond to. It can be figured out fairly easy, though it's worth noting, since those unfamiliar with fighting game notation may be (However briefly) put off. 

The actual fighting is rather flashy, as you'd expect from an Anime fighter, though unbalanced and unintuitive. I played through the game as Saki, and was able to get through Arcade mode on normal spamming a combo of QCF and immediately following up with a DP, or just repeatedly spamming QCB until I could use my super, aside from one or two instances, which I'll note later. I know this wouldn't work against a real player, but the fact that this can be done at all is a little concerning. The game is also sold as a 2v2 fighting game, which intrigued me. Would it be a KOF style match up, or a MVC Tag Team style match up? Neither. What you have is a second character who follows your main character who can use support attacks. That's it. It's a 1v1 fighting game with a character that follows you around. When your character dies, the fight is over, no lifebar for your support character. The support character did get in my way a couple times, as they follow (or try to) your character. I sometimes would think that my character was moving back without my control, because, hey, something moving on my side of the screen that isn't my enemy or in the background, must be me in a 2D fighter, while my character would end up comboed by my opponent. It only happened a few times, and really, that's more my fault than anything I feel, but I feel it's worth noting in case anyone else plays it and feels the same way.

The dialogue in the story mode seems poorly translated, and the story itself uninteresting, though I could only bring myself to play through with one character due to quickly losing interest in the game due to it's poor mechanics. The music is good (At least the final boss theme is), but it's all purchased from the Nash Music Library, essentially a shutterstock for music. That's not a knock against the game, as I understand it's clearly low budget (If people like Kevin Macleod didn't exist, youtube would be a much different place, for example), though again, worth noting. I can't recommend this game despite it's low pricepoint, which is so low that even with all the DLC, you won't be spending much more than ten bucks, though at that point you could easily purchase Blazblue Calamity Trigger, or the base game for Skullgirls, both of which are far superior packages. It really feels like Vanguard Princess has sold on fanservice alone, and maybe the fact that I have zero interest in that kind of thing skews my opinion, but unless that's something you're really into, don't bother.

As for the technical issues, those running on more modern machines, may need to activate DirectPlay, a legacy Windows feature for the game to even run. There's no fullscreen mode, and even maximizing the window doesn't completely fill the screen, as I was left with a good few collumns of pixels on the left end of screen that the game didn't fill. It didn't seem to be doing this to help aspect ratio either, as the game was somewhat poorly stretched out, not upscaling or anything. Unlike the other faults of the engine I couldn't bring myself to criticize, this was a noticeable issue that dampered my enjoyment of the game.

review:
This game is... tricky. Perhaps it is just because I am unused to fighting games using the keyboard, or maybe it is just my lack of skill overall, but... I keep getting my butt kicked.

Doesn't help that the keyboard controls are a little... cramped.

Anyway, the game is a throwback to those fighting games of yore, only this time the fighting field is filled with young women wearing very little.

Fun for those who like those type of games... and art.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001621886', 'num_games_owned': 299, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1669340170}
review:
You have a good, solid fighting game here with unique mechanics almost like Arcana Heart, but this game is marred by loads of technical issues:

Xbox 360 and Xbox One controllers only work half the time
Full-Screen mode is a joke
A very simplified title screen menu (it only has Story Mode and Vs Mode)
An annoying bug for those running Windows 8 or higher that requires you to download legacy Windows components 

I simply cannot recommend to anyone at its current state, but with all of that aside, since it's on sale until November 1, 2017 for $1.74, it's worth a try, but not for its default price of $5.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130932508', 'num_games_owned': 1226, 'num_reviews': 724, 'playtime_forever': 341, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 341, 'last_played': 1474214779}
review:
[h1]Анимешный файтинг[/h1]

Довольно неплохой кстати!

Игра чисто для любителей файтингов, а если, так уж вышло, любитель файтингов оказался тем еще анимешником - для него Vanguard Princess будет маст баем. Из себя игра представляет обычный 2D-файтинг, бойцы которого являются мимимишными и большегрудыми тянками.  По механике - файтинг как файтинг. Касательно управления - ну такое, не очень удобно по началу, но в итоге можно привыкнуть. Графика - рисовка норм. Цена - приемлимая. Жаль, что игра на английском языке.

А в целом, нормальный файтинг, ни больше, ни меньше.

review:
[b]■俺評価(10段階)[/b]
総合評価 ・・・・・・・4 ☆☆☆☆ 普通
このゲームは買い？ ・・安ければ
サンドボックス化 ・・・〇

[b]■英語が判らない・英語だと辛い前提の評価[/b]
日本語化・・未対応だが、日本語化不要で遊べる。
UI・・・・・未対応だが、直感で操作できる。
字幕・・・・無し

[b]■操作感・グラフィックス[/b]
キーボード＋マウス ・△
ゲームパッド ・・・・◎ ※ゲームパッド推薦。
グラフィックス ・・・PS2チックな2D画

[b]■不具合(気が付いた事)[/b]
・ゲームウインドウメニューの「Settings」－「GameControler」で、
ゲームパッドの十字キーが「？」になっていて無反応かつ変更できない。
更に、ボタンの変更も無反応かつ変更できない。
・xInputゲームパッド(JC-U3613M)が認識しなかった。
対策としてJoytoKeyを使用した。
・最大化すると端が5ピクセルほど右にズレた。
直そうとドラッグすると最小化されてしまい、直せなかった。

[b]■ゲーム評価[/b]
キャラが可愛い、ストII系の2D格闘ゲー。
残念ながらネット対戦機能は無い。ネット対戦機能が
付くと化けるかも。操作もコンシューマゲーと変わらない。
格闘ゲーが好きならアリか。

author: {'steamid': '76561198088171825', 'num_games_owned': 245, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1511482503}
review:
Please take my review with a side of salt

The game's pretty alright and has an alright start; the animations, characters and base-idea of the game is fleshed out. The only gripe(s) I really have with the game is the lack of actual attacks, ability to chain attacks more effectively and the somewhat clunky controls with a controller- what the gameplay seemed most-suited for but showed it seemed it more-used for keyboard players; while the gameplay does make sense in a way, the fact that this gameplay is meant to be fast-paced and satisfying to commit to combos, the controls felt like they were unresponsive at first when I hadn't found out that there were only specific attacks you could do given in the instructions but even then- after I'd found and learnt about the specific gameplay, just trying to pull off one or two of the "special attacks" was hard to get as they seemed to require a miniscule time-frame shorter than the average fighting game with really accurate precision, meaning I was only able to pull off the moves about 15-30% of the time. 


And even then, the combos don't properly link up to each other; in killer instinct and UMVC3, you can pull off a basic attack combo by pressing the light, medium then heavy attack one after another and it would count as a 3-hit combo- in this game, that's not even a thing as the attack lags a bit after hitting and never giving you enough time to actually perform a second attack afterwards to perform a second-hit for a combo, the second or third hit either being a lucky controller-spam or using your ally to perform that second or third hit. I do believe that this game has a lot of potential with the animations and ideas behind it but the gameplay currently is way-too minimalistic as it currently is and requires more fluid combat and combo gameplay for each character to feel more fun and satisfying to play.

As the game is currently at the time that I write this, I'd say buy this game if you feel like you're up for a challenge to try and perform long satisfying combos with one or every character; if this game improves more upon the controls, gameplay and actual number moves each character can perform in the future, I believe it'll become a better experience than it is currently now when I wrote this on the 11/10/2017- that's the 11th of October, 2017

author: {'steamid': '76561198180018346', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 381, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 340, 'last_played': 1510114149}
review:
Vanguard Princess may be considered to be a fabulous eroge, but it sucks as a fighting game.

Lilith's unique grab attack is overpowered.
When I am playing Haede, I can just spam MP(press "B" while standing) and HP(press "X" while standing) without moving(press up, down, left or right) to finish Story Mode in one take. The irony is that I can never achieve that when I play this game seriously.
Eri's typical combo is hard to block and AI really likes to spam it.
Ayane seems able to have her quiver refilled automatically, while Luna has to reload her pistols manually. And the reloading can be interrupted, that's totally unfair.

IMHO, 東方萃夢想 ～ Immaterial and Missing Power is better polished.

[spoiler]Great soundtrack though, with or without DLCs.[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198242404680', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 207, 'playtime_forever': 282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 282, 'last_played': 1506248974}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198282958297', 'num_games_owned': 152, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 794, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 397, 'last_played': 1585739240}
review:
最开始觉得是喜加一游戏
后来无聊下载来玩，玩了几天感觉挺有意思的
接下来是个人的游戏体验:
1.对主战人物的评价:  
YUI:拿着胡萝卜剑挺帅气的(第二次通关是操作的她)，招式也是挺帅，击败对手后会感谢她的剑，最重要的是黑丝啊，prprpr
HARUKA:头上的蝴蝶结居然可以放电，还是一个可爱的马猴烧酒;
LILITH:是个怪力傲娇大小姐(出场时有佣人)，声优的声音也很好听(特别是被击败过后的那句)
LUNA:最丰满，好球！！！拿大枪的时候感觉挺猛
KURUMI:体术高超的萌妹子，可别小看她
SAKI:拿着一把鲜红的刀，第一次通关就是用的SAKI，中间输了好多次，最后还是击败了HILDA，感谢她让我看到了后面的CG
KAEDE:给我的第一印象就是，戴眼镜的有着利爪的学姐，超能撕
NATALIA:拿着一个不知道名字的武器，我以为她也是体术型的，结果和她做对手的时候被爆锤，还能打出爆炸效果(我键盘按不出来)
ERI:拿着双拐的体术类妹子，移动的速度超快
AYANE:带着眼罩的射手妹子，由于是键盘操作，经常按不出技能，她手上拿着弓，就只出脚。不太会操作
HILDA:作为游戏剧情里的boss，她真的很赖皮，不管是我操作还是作为我的对手，都很赖皮，不过幼年体真的好可爱，长大了就成了冷艳了(她的衣服好像没换过，长大了还是这件，难怪遮不住)


2.对辅助人物的评价
KANAE:也是一个可爱的魔法师，召唤的狗也可爱
SHIERA:有着翼装机甲的三无少女(我怀疑她是个机器人)，发出的招式挺炫酷
EKO:也是一个体术类的妹子，不过会放出带电的桃心，作战时可以帮助打断对手技能
JULIET:手拿大链锤的妹子，吊带丝袜加上有点像女仆装的打扮真的是太可爱了
HILDA:幼年体的boss，面无表情，感觉有点高冷的样子，(难怪长大了是冷艳风)，但是也好可爱，棕粉色长发比成年后的短发好看。
HILDA的两个专属辅助人物:蓝色小姐姐的身材更好，恶魔小姐姐的装扮更火辣

3.对游戏整体评价
这款游戏对我来说，10分我打7分，1分扣在游戏的启动上，要改动电脑的某个设置才能打开(见Will0224的测评)，1分扣在不能在游戏里面看已经解锁了的结尾剧情CG,还有1分扣在键盘操作的初始设置特别奇怪，不适应

7分理由:
游戏角色优美，音乐也很带感(入了音乐DLC)，操作还算简单，声优封面很赞(最喜欢LILITH的声音)，辅助作战使操作组合更多样化

挺耐玩的一款游戏，个人不算在喜加一之内了。

author: {'steamid': '76561198085772203', 'num_games_owned': 944, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 287, 'last_played': 1574720492}
review:
===WARNING===

This game has been picked free before it was bundled. And not through Indie Legends 6 Bundle, but the DLCs did.

=================================================================

Vanguard Princess is a INDIE side-by-side fighter, similar to Street Fighter, Mortal Kombat series, and alot of others from the same genre, though the most noticeable difference in this one game, is that all the fighters are girl with hidden powers.

The game looks simple and like it could be made in minutes if you had the right art, but the attention in detail to the sprites just calls your attention, specially with the Director's Cut DLC, if you know what I'm saying ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°).
The combat is fluid, though even on Hard, the game is rather easy once you've mastered the character you're playing, the Story Mode only having changes like character encounters and post-ending.

For a indie game, I'd give it my 10/10, specially with how much fun you can have with couch play. Recommended.

=================================================================

TL;DR

Art: 9/10

Gameplay: 10/10

Story: 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198277209911', 'num_games_owned': 319, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1522501251}

author: {'steamid': '76561198162497415', 'num_games_owned': 1888, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1537620140}
review:
如果从steam里无法启动，或点击游戏文件时出现0xc0000022错误，请到 【控制面板\所有控制面板项\程序和功能】，点左侧的【启用或关闭Windows功能】，找到【旧版组件】，点加号，在【DirectPlay】上点对号，然后等待此功能自动安装完成（需要联网）。

完成后即可开始游戏。

这游戏操作十分蛋疼，应该说是带有像素社保元素的硬核格斗类游戏吧，没有漫威vs卡普空里的简化组合键，每个人物的组合键又不同，用手柄玩起来有点难，键盘的话玩起来就很容易了，因为没有斜角的多余方向需要按。

author: {'steamid': '76561197993336746', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1522038979}
review: Plays in a goofy window, looks like it's running at 256 VGA colors, standard Japanese shovelware jam-one-button-until-you-win, and basically a vehicle for showcasing bouncing boobies.  Why is everyone wearing cotton panties.  Why is one of the standard moves a launching butt smash, for the gratuitous panty shot.  I mean, if ogling cartoon girls is enough to get you into a video game, have at it - I know that segment of the population is out there.  But this title is devoid of content beyond button mashing and jiggling juggums.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999565021', 'num_games_owned': 4426, 'num_reviews': 140, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1504627262}
review:
A la base je pensais que Vanguard Princess etait un jeu moé comme Arcana Heart, dès le lancement du jeu, ça m'a calmé, certes c'est un doujin, mais le jeu tourne sous Fighter Maker, c'est pas un mal, mais le moteur est daté et ne reconnait pas certains controleurs modernes. Seuls solutions : resortir de vieilles manettes usb, sort mon fidel adaptateur manettes ps1 ou alors (hérésie) jouer au clavier. Rien que le fait de tourner sur un moteur de jeu vieillissant avec ces contraintes me donne plus trop envie de jouer.

Bon graphiquement, c'est pas mal meme pour un jeu doujin, bon soyons franc, y'a du contenue smut (avec le dlc director cut), y'a des musiques sympas, mais d'autres jeux doujin sont sortis remasterisés comme Arcana Heart ou l'ancetre Melty Blood.

Donc non je recommande pas Vanguard Princess, qui aurait mérité un portage sur un vrai moteur de jeu et pas Fighter Maker qui est moins performant qu'un Mugen. Si vous cherchez un vs fighting avec du moe, Vanguard Princess n'est vraiment pas le jeu pour vous, et si vous êtes exigeant pour vos vs fighting passez aussi votre chemin. Dommage.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022143876', 'num_games_owned': 2643, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 545, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 481, 'last_played': 1586268880}
review:
Vanguard Princess was formerly a freeware game. It's initial release on Steam was censored, but that has since been fixed with the free directors cut DLC patch. It's now a low cost, content light fighting game with some good artwork and unique mechanics. 

Pros:
-Good Artwork
-Approachable Mechanics
-Works well with all game pads. I have tried some wonkey pads and they all work well
-Top notch local multi. Pick up and play that anyone can enjoy.
-I have read that you can play online with some modding, though I have not tried it. 

Cons:
-Interface is bonkers. Changing the vs. level is done in a drop down menu. Wut?
-Forced Practice Mode Each time you do the story. It can get pretty irritating. 
-AI is pretty brutal. Though this is not as bad as it used to be, local multi is really needed to enjoy this to the fullest.
-The DLC is silly. That stuff should be included.

TL;DR - Good game. Play with a friend for best experience. 


Stay Strong Japan

author: {'steamid': '76561198011611921', 'num_games_owned': 1808, 'num_reviews': 132, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1504480924}
review:
This game seems to have problems. On Windows 10, it requires a workaround to even be able to start. Once the game is running, you don't have a fullscreen mode, so if you just resize the window, it all gets deformed and pixelated. 

The whole thing looks very basic and amateurish.

On the plus side, the character art and especially character design is great. It's a shame that these characters can't shine on another game that's worth playing. Animation is good and there's probably a decent fighting game hidden somewhere under the rough presentation. A shame.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069376148', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1504432546}
review:
このゲームを販売しているeigoMANGAの事細かな問題点は他のレビュアー様が書いてくださっていますが、少しでも問題が明るみになれば。
2D格ツク2ndを使用して設計された証拠がある(game.iniの設定変更による当たり判定の表示、バイナリエディタでの閲覧)にも拘わらずEnterBrainの名前が書かれていない、原作者、大本(日本版)の開発&公開をしているスゲノトモアキ氏と連絡を取っているとパブリッシャーが公言しているにも関わらず全く証拠がない、など...
　スゲノトモアキ氏は自身のブログ「生存確認」にて同ゲームの更新を報告していましたが、2011年8月12日からブログの更新が途絶えています。それに加え、上記の不透明さを踏まえると、Steam版ヴァンガードプリンセスはEnterBrain、並びにスゲノトモアキ氏に連絡を取らず販売し、利益を得ていると言えます。
　ゲーム内容に関しては日本版ヴァンガードプリンセスにプレイヤーキャラとしてのヒルダの追加[DLC]など、幾つかの追加要素がありますが調整はされていません。原作ではボスキャラの立ち位置にあり、そのデータをそのまま流用したと言える内容です(バグが放置されている)。このゲームがSteam上から無くなることを切に願います。
[list]
 [*]動作しない人へ
IMEの変更、win10であればDirectplayを有効にすると動作する様です。
[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561198105926067', 'num_games_owned': 420, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1532545150}
review:
花了20分钟通关,没什么难度.人物挺养眼的.

问题还是老问题,人物招式技能单调,AI无脑,BOSS只是增强了技能效果和出手速度,内容太少,竞技性基本没有.

但是相比于<骷髅女孩>的无脑增加血量和攻击力来说已经好了很多.

毕竟不是所有游戏都能像KOF那样出色.

当我通关骷髅女孩的时候给了它一个差评,认为这简直就是侮辱格斗游戏.靠一个键就能通关[spoiler](这款游戏也一样)[/spoiler]的游戏实在太简单无脑,我甚至给了一个浪费时间的评价.

现在接触的游戏多了,明白是我接触的起点太高,也明白为什么这样的游戏能有这么多好评.感谢我的童年时代相伴的KOF97-2002,那些都是不可多得的经典.

总的来说不要把这个游戏当格斗游戏来玩,当成[strike]galgame[/strike]岂不是美滋滋.看看各种巨乳小姐姐,给个好评不过分~

author: {'steamid': '76561198120123198', 'num_games_owned': 982, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 613, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 607, 'last_played': 1519659540}

author: {'steamid': '76561198116981741', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 379, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 350, 'last_played': 1527203702}
review:
[h1]    看到多半差评心里还是比较虚的，略带迟疑地下载并打开了游戏。[/h1]
----[b]界面[/b]：刚打开就发现只有两个选项，没有发现返回主菜单及退出选项。
----[b]画面[/b]：角色立绘，必杀CG都很好看稍微打消了多半差评带来的担心，游戏中偶有福利[spoiler]只要截图时机精准，你就可以和游戏截图区的那些大佬们一争高下了，绝无开车之意[/spoiler]。
----[b]音乐[/b]：很好，有些特别喜欢，所以入了音乐包。
----[b]剧情[/b]：未发现难度选择。每个角色都有介绍，严肃的剧情和这般的画风看似不称，实际发现很合适。可是剧情模式下对战前的对话极少，结局的文本量也是偏少来着。
----[b]游戏性[/b]：上手简单，招式较少，游戏内附有搓招表，操作更容易，还有格挡、投技键位，外加辅助角色的存在，使得对战十分欢乐[spoiler]360°还是比较难搓[/spoiler]。攻击判定和打击感不错。游戏内可以更改场景，局数，时间，键盘键位，游戏内人物服装的颜色居然不能改，只能游戏内随机变化。
----[b]DLC[/b]：Director's Cut这个DLC翻译过来是“导演剪辑包”对吧，我尝试安装，结果发现游戏文件夹大小并未发生变化，所以完全迷茫这是什么DLC来着；Hilda Rize为BOSS角色，封面画风和其他不同，使用专用的辅助角色，因为激光炮招式的存在使得单机极其极其容易，顺带我还发现了她和其中一个辅助角色很像，该不是萝莉形态吧，哈哈~[u]可是这样御姐的角色竟然没有必杀CG，何等的可惜！[/u]；Lilith也是额外角色，封面及CG突出一个反派，明明是个抱着布偶的萝莉角色？；Kurumi同为额外角色，本人最为中意，因为必杀中和不同的辅助角色合体有着不同的变身形态，也有和辅助角色配合的各种招式，花样很多，非常喜欢；Artwork and Soundtrack是画册及音乐包，游戏的个人资料背景都取自画册，至于音乐包，但凡有中意的BGM,这就是个值得的音乐包，不是么。
----[b]BUG[/b]：可能也是大多数给差评的原因。1.无法正常游戏，这个我倒是没遇到，不然也是给差评的结局。2.进入游戏后为窗口模式，一旦放大或者全屏就会花屏甚至黑屏，之后就会再也无法进行游戏，原来的尺寸更是没法改回，验证完整性无效，只能卸载重新下载才能正常游戏，后面说什么都不敢乱动了。
----徽章，表情这些还不错，可是一套十张说来也是太多，合不起，而且个人资料背景取自画册，穷非就不要想着合卡了。
[h1]----毕竟是09年的游戏，不提BUG,游戏本身还算不错，能不能玩需要靠运气，所以能玩就推荐，不能玩就只能嘿嘿嘿了。[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198159202803', 'num_games_owned': 1316, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 285, 'last_played': 1503594391}
review:
手柄键位没问题，但是完全搓不出招数啊……一开始以为是自己操作有问题，然而换成键盘之后成功率100%……
游戏制作质量很好，最初是免费发布的非steam日文版，我觉得并不比商业作品差。这个steam版除了UI和模式，系统和名称之类的似乎也做了一些修改。
因为手柄的问题，有点犹豫要不要给不推荐，但是考虑到游戏本身的制作确实很用心，还是给推荐吧。

author: {'steamid': '76561197964105236', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1503580211}
review: Picked this up in a bundle beat the story mode in 15 minutes pressing 1 button. Sprite animation is nice, a game developer should pick up these assets and remake the game properly. It could be nice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198200456934', 'num_games_owned': 1843, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1579351605}
review:
这个游戏的全屏方法是打开游戏根目录下的game.ini,把GameScreenMode=0改为=1，我的笔记本电脑N卡全屏游戏屏幕会疯狂的闪，要改成集显启动。键位在这个文件里也可以用ASCII码改，键位1P和2P一定不要设重，不然会出现有时好使有时不好使的玄学现象。win8以上系统有可能会打不开游戏，这时候在Windows功能中选启动或打开Windows功能，在这个界面里把旧版组件中的directplay功能打开就好了。
[spoiler]像我这样一开始只用重攻击和格挡两个键玩这个游戏感觉也是非常吊 [/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198328080703', 'num_games_owned': 793, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1527519718}
review: 游戏虽老，但是经过一番设置。在window10下还是可以流畅运行的，手柄的话Xbox360可以使用。ps的手柄应该更好用。虽然画面现在来看不怎么样，可是bgm很好听，而且出招表就在游戏页面第一页，格斗操作还是很流畅的。（bs包入的，是全dlc版本）不建议全价购入。打折买是十分推荐的。

author: {'steamid': '76561198041372673', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1540845940}
review:
I bought a pack of games for $3 and this was the most interesting of the games to me in that pack so I decided to play it first. It has some strange design choices in my opinion. If there's a fullscreen option, I sure as hell can't find it so it looks like the only way to play it fullscreen is to use borderless gaming, which can be bought off Steam or gotten for free off the creator's github. I just play it in windowed mode though. It's a 2d fighter with some pretty good animation on it. It's graphics are also nice, reminding me of older games from the Sega Genesis era.

Aside from the animation looking nice, how's the gameplay? Well, I'm only really a casual fighing game fan and it seems to me that this game was meant for people who are more hardcore fighting game fans. I only played through 2 fights, but I got my ass handed to me in both fights multiple times before finally beating them. The only fighting game I've played that was this hard was Super Street Fighter II Turbo HD Remix on my PS3. I want to continue to play this game, but it seems like the difficulty will eventually push me away. 

Characters do seem varied in their fighting styles and from the 4 or 5 that I've seen. I personally like Lillith (she's DLC, but I got her along with all the DLC in the bundle I bought. It's on Bundlestars if you want to check it out, It's called the Indie Legends 6 bundle.) because she uses wrestling moves to fight. Like a stunner and things like that. You choose one character to main as out and then choose another character from a different list as a support character and then you're on your way.

I saw some people complain that the game had problems running or using a controller, but that didn't happen for me. It started right up and my Rockcandy Xbox 360 3rd party controller works just fine. Only complaint I have is that opeing the menu isn't start, it's clicking the left stick in. 

If you are really into fighting games, I guess I'd say go ahead and give it a shot. If you're more into casual fighting games, I'd advise you to skip this and check something like Skullgirls out.

Edit: I beat one character's story and the final boss is a real piece of work. She has an attack that has little tell, goes all the way across the map and does a crazy amount of damage plus it has no cool down. It's frankly rediculous that it is even in the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132656456', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1502026065}
review:
The com enemies spam moves you can't avoid or cancel (that apparently get stronger when you try to), controls are shaky at best and many of the moves simply don't get performed by your charakter and deal at best abmysall damage compared to the enemies moves.
I should note that I have for these reasons only managed the pratice stage on easy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040485548', 'num_games_owned': 1073, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1686023842}
review:
There are better fighting games out there. This game just feels unfinished.
This game has really weird controls and an assist button that doesn't work half of the time.
I only had 2 fights into Arcade and still did not understand my characters moveset.

I will give it this though, the visuals are nice. It's a bit more risky than Skullgirls but not to 18+ levels.
The character designs do look good, I just wish I knew more about them, I feel like this is just a game you'd see in the corner of an arcade that nobody touches.

Vanguard Princess doesn't control well, I played with both keyboard and controller and yet still did not understand how my characters moveset was. The assist button felt like it didn't work half of the time. There's also certain attacks that just do a combo for you, it's like the game is playing itself.
There are better fighting games than this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198261419540', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1526959701}
review:
Bought the game on a whim. If i had to be honest, almost $5 is not a good price for a game like this. I got it for $2 during the summer steam sale and still was underwhelmed when i beat it without fully understanding the controlls. Not joking, beat the story mode in one run first try after i just bought it and didn't even geta run down on what buttons to use.

Still it is a easy-ish game for you and your friend to enjoy together.  The characters look nice, the gameplay is decent but performs well, and music is ok.

Get it if you want to

author: {'steamid': '76561198201005674', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1454293086}
review:
Alguns devem conhecer pelo nome. "Vanguard Princess" é um game de luta 2D, do estilo "Street Fighter 2", mas com apenas lutadoras, ou seja, nada de marmanjos no meio. E ainda é com gráficos e animações estilo "animê", o que dá um toque ao gosto principalmente quem curte mangás e animês.

Eu pulo a parte da estória, porque é mais do mesmo, e nem me interessou muito, mas sabe-se que cada lutadora possui sua própria estória e que vai enfrentar a "chefona final" chamada "Hilda". Ah, o jogador escolhe sua personagem e depois sua assistente que pode te ajudar durante as lutas, cada uma com suas características próprias. Para quem curte mulheres nos animês, "Vanguard Princess" é um prato cheio.

O jogo é meio antigo, na época do PS2, mas há a disposição para as plataformas atuais: X-Box 360, PS3, PS4 e Steam. Eu joguei pela Steam mesmo, que é a plataforma que tenho jogado. E apesar do game ser antigo, até recentemente tinha DLCs para baixar, com novas roupas e chefe jogável. Nas partes técnicas, gráficos bons com animações decentes e som bom. Jogar no modo "easy" fica fácil se usar o melhor golpe de cada lutadora até a chefona final, com jogabilidade boa. O maior problema está na acessibilidade do jogo, pelo menos para versão PC. O botão do pause fica no analógico direito, e quando pausa, não aparece um menu para acessar a lista de golpes especiais da lutadora que você está utilizando. Essa lista aparece somente na tela de seleção de jogadoras, se quiser ver os golpes enquanto luta, terá que pausar e acessar uma lista que o jogador terá que procurar na internet, ou "printar" as telas de seleção de golpes para cada lutadora e salvar num outro dispositivo para ver os golpes enquanto joga. E para fechar o jogo, eu só consegui fazendo ALT+TAB e depois fechar o jogo no ícone dele com o botão direito do mouse. Se achar a forma correta acessando algum menu "quit", me avise.

Enfim, como o game estava praticamente de graça na promoção da última Black Friday da Steam, acabei adquirindo-o. Vale a pena pela jogabilidade e pelas personagens femininas do estilo mangá num game de luta na tela do seu PC.

ochogeek.blogspot.com.br

author: {'steamid': '76561198008303595', 'num_games_owned': 893, 'num_reviews': 554, 'playtime_forever': 462, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 462, 'last_played': 1471666010}
review: Vanguard Princess is an interesting little fighting game that relies on a heavy manga aesthetic and includes some great artwork from a very talented art developer in the industry. The game is colorful, fast and includes some great character design and animations. However, the game’s limitations on resolution and display options are a huge bummer and the broken controller support makes the game almost unplayable. Having a fighting game rely on so many meters and things to keep track of distracts from the overall gameplay. The lack of modes hurts the replay value and any chance of gamers considering the game at any competitive level.

review:
- rather spammy gameplay. that might be just me but its difficult to beat the game even on easy. At least I couldnt.
- lots of technical issues. the game plays in 640x480 resolution. yes, you read that correctly. you can maximize window "by hand" but then the aspect ratio will change freely, not to mention the picture will be VERY upscaled on whatever resolution you have.
- greedy publisher is scattering what little this game has to offer over DLCs. which makes the game look even more barebone.

+ yes, it looks nice. 

its difficult for me to thumb down a game that looks that stunning. but frankly my review is rather negative and the game needs improvements.

Don't bother with this, go get Skull Girls if you want an anime fighting game thats actually good. And I give this a 2/10.

review: Es un juego entretenido, me gustan mucho los juegos de pelea, tiene su toque, los personajes son variados y el poder elegir distintos compañeros hace que la forma en la que se manejan los personajes se sienta un poco diferente, los escenarios asi como la musica y los sprites se ven muy bien trabajados. Respecto a la dificultad y a los movimientos, aunque tal vez pueda sentirse algo complicado al principio, es facil acostumbrarse al estilo de los personajes y la dificultad me parece bien pero en lo que respecta al boss final lo he sentido algo facil, aun asi es muy entretenido, seguro seguire jugando hasta terminarlo con todos los personajes :) .

author: {'steamid': '76561198006413390', 'num_games_owned': 3172, 'num_reviews': 214, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1505049252}
review:
This 2D fighting game by Tomoaki Sugeno and eigoMANGA features 10 different Vanguard Princesses and 5 different assist characters with fanservice who obtain exceptional fighting abilities after an Astral Impact was sent out by the first Vanguard Princess Hilda Rize(also playable with 2 of her own assist characters with DLC) while in captivity by The Government. Each Vanguard Princess(including Hilda Rize herself xD) will go to find and fight other Vanguard Princesses and eventually fight Hilda Rize after Hilda Rize came out of her captivity to appear as The Enforcer of Stellar Laws, vowing to destroy all of humanity.

The game has more than 1800 positive reviews at the time of this review, great artwork and soundtracks with a total of 54 soundtracks and 20 songs with vocals with all DLCs. Recommended when game with all DLCs are at discount or in bundle offer, for those who like short 2D arcade fighting games without achievements or have close family members and friends who are able to play the game multiplayer on the same computer.

review: É um jogo de luta divertido pra passar o tempo e com um pouco de ecchi (não espere muita safadeza, são só algumas calcinhas aqui e ali, infelizmente). O cenário fica um pouco poluído algumas vezes por causa de 4 personagens na tela ao mesmo tempo em combate e se você não tiver acostumado pode ficar um pouco confuso no começo. A história também não é nada demais. Mas a animação dos sprites é muito boa, ainda mais pra idade do jogo. Como é baratinho, tá valendo a pena sim.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075867570', 'num_games_owned': 344, 'num_reviews': 130, 'playtime_forever': 162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1521398586}
review:
This has to be [u][b]the worst fighting game[/b][/u] I've ever played. The characters just don't feel fun to play as and it gets pretty annoying pretty fast.

+ Art style is decent, could still use improvement.
+ You get cute loli characters for support? 
- Gets boring fast.
- Combat needs much more polish.
- Controls are not fluid.
- Generic, skippable story.
- Limited battle modes.
- Multiplayer is no better.

This game needs much more work.

[b]Want a good anime fighting game? [/b] Do yourself a favour a buy something like [u]Skullgirls[/u] or [u]BlazBlue[/u]. You will thank me later.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063933731', 'num_games_owned': 310, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1493107567}
review:
This game is, without a trace of doubt in my mind, the best game i have EVER played within my life. The art, gameplay and music is masterfully crafted and blend together perfectly, creating a true masterpiece. Now, what really makes this game stand out to me, and what makes me play it day and night, is the ONE feature. The jiggle physics. I could write a thesis on my love for the jiggle physics, but I'll just say this: If you're looking for true happiness, look no further. I have found it here. But sure, jiggle physics are great and all, but i have to confess something, i lied. The jiggle physics are not what made it for me. It is your partner, your friend and ally in the battle of life and death. The loli. Ah, lolis... The innocence... The cute, skimpy outfit... the small chest... it is all just... so... kawaii! I love them. From the bottom of my heart i tell you, nothing can quelch my thirst for lolis. 

All in all this is a wonderfull game, which i can reccomend for EVERYONE. 
10/10 - this game has given my life meaning again... Thank you...

author: {'steamid': '76561198038291440', 'num_games_owned': 685, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1492689281}
review:
It's bad, it's really bad. The port has only a local vs mode and a "story" mode. There are no real settings to speak of, so even if the game would have an ok artstyle, the resolution is crap. You can't adjust sound levels, so you are basically stuck with the bgm.

I gotta say that the most of the animations are pretty fluid, and the artstyle is surprisingly good. Sure, it's a total boobfest, but credit where credit is due. The game runs well too, so there's that.

But other than that, I feel like it's a total mess. At least a single stage is a complete mess where the characters actually blend into the background so badly that you can't easily figure out who's who and what' s what. The controls are ok, but I've experienced better. The game isn't an airdasher, more like a mix of old school streetfighter and some more anime concepts, like unique resources for each character. There's promise here that's obscured by sloppy design.

I can't give a thumbs up to a game that lacks almost EVERY feature that we've come to expect from modern fighting games. It bare has a movelist and definitely has nothing like frame data, practise mode, tutorial, cutscenes, actual options menu, netplay, stats, customization...well, nothing but single player arcade and vs. 

Save your money, get something else.

author: {'steamid': '76561198220223668', 'num_games_owned': 136, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 238, 'last_played': 1491231094}
review:
This is a weird game to write about, because it has so many contradictions. First of all, it looks great. If you're into anime or don't mind the anime style, the character designs are nice (the support characters are a bit creepy, though) and the super animations look awesome. However, it's hard to get a good look at the visuals, because you can't put the game in proper full screen mode. Huh? You go to all this trouble to make a game that looks cool, and we have to play it in window mode? Strange. Next, the game has some really solid fighting action, and it's really, really cheap. I mean, you can often snag this on sale for less than a couple of bucks. If you're looking for a struggle version of Guilty Gear, you can do worse than Vanguard Princess. But the cheap price comes at a cost: lots of little bugs and plenty of jank. The controls are glitchy and don't always work right, the interface is buggy (the game often kept playing when I paused to look up a special move), and the whole package is just a bit too amateurish. 

Whenever you notice something cool about this game, three flaws pop up right next to that cool thing. I know that the original game was made by one guy for free, which is really great, but not enough work was done to upgrade this into a paid product. I realize that the game is cheap and you may be tempted to check it out, but I just can't recommend this; even if it's cheap, you have better cheap options out there. If you want a great cheap fighting game, go buy one of the early BlazBlue games when they go on sale (I've seen Calamity Trigger go for two or three bucks).

author: {'steamid': '76561198026089591', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 603, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 372, 'last_played': 1491756073}
review:
This isn't a deep game by any means.  It's a relatively simple fighter with some fan service.  Basically three levels of attacks, some specials, etc.  to mess around with and a mechanic of a helper monkey that you can use for special attacks.  First time I played it I didn't think much of it, but having given it a chance over this weekend it's grown on me.  If you ever played Ranma 1/2 for SNES, it reminds me of that.  

It's short and not going to replace Street Fighter 4 or Skullgirls, but it's definitely an enjoyable little fighter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198305191644', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 753, 'last_played': 1609689549}
review:
A simple fighting game and simple mechanics. There's not much info like tutorial and combos in practice mode and practice mode is hidden as well, however it only took me 2 hours to become decent with Yui after watching basic combos online (practical ones, not just for practice mode) to understand the mechanics. The only downside I can think of is that Hilda (last boss) is stupidly cheap with its spammy attacks, so to beat her you need to abuse your character's skills as well.

On the plus side, the characters are all diverse and the assist system makes for interesting combos. The game loading is impressively fast and the visuals are good. The fanservice is actually not that much and hardly noticeable (Shame actually since that's what I was looking for)

For the DLCs, the Lilith is same as the base one but the AIs are a lot harder. 
Kurumi DLC is the most worth it since it adds two modes, Streak(Survival) where you fight different AIs with just one HP bar. A bit buggy though. Other is Team battle where you actually fight two AIs at the same time. It's really fun if you want more challenge if you find hard mode to be not enough

BTW x360ce doesn't work so my generic usb controller needs a bit of configuration, but not much of an issue. (And it's a fighting game so controller is a must)

Overall 8/10 since Im enjoying it a lot. Also it's cheap so why not?

author: {'steamid': '76561198250605438', 'num_games_owned': 1087, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 274, 'last_played': 1511514158}
review:
Рекомендация (положительная, но всё же...): Стоит ли это покупать? - Только если очень хочется и ради карточек, не больше. 

Если смотреть реально, то как файтинг игра слабая, и больше похожая на бит-ен-мап. Здесь нет проработаной боевой системы, только 3 вида удара: рукой, ногой и подсечка + блок, нормальную комбо систему не завезли, а главная особенность боёвки это использование мало полезных помощников. Сюжетная кампания проходится за 15 минут максимум (можно купить пройти сюжетку и вернуть, 100% профит), притом ничего интересного с себя не представляет. Графически игра слабая: играется в небольшом окне, а при переходе в полноэкранный режим заметна пиксилизация и искажение картинки. Игра порезанная на дополнения с персонажами которые стоя дороже самой игры и рассчитаны что вы поведётесь на  няшных 2D тянок. Онлайна в игре нет, только возможность играть вдвоём с одной клавы (между прочем управление с клавиатуры в игре удобное, в основном за счёт простой боёвки) или геймпадов.

Итог: 5/10, игра средняя по всем параметрам. Если хотите годный файтинг то лучше берите DOA 5 LR или Skullgirls  где визуал лучше, контента больше, да и боевые системы на порядок лучше.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028054269', 'num_games_owned': 1296, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 394, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 394, 'last_played': 1486385077}
review:
Nice graphics, but very low resolution for modern systems. At 1:1 resolution the game is only 3" wide on my screen. Making it bigger gets very pixely and doesn't necessarily preserve aspect ratio. The game needs much better resolution upsizing support. (I play plenty of pixel-style games, Starbound particularly, so this isn't inherently a shortcoming of using pixel graphics.)

Vanguard Princess is also clearly meant for controller play more than keyboard. Triggering specials with the keyboard is hard to do consistently, but looks like on a controller, it would just be a quick roll of the joystick. Plus, the default keyboard keys are abysmal.

The keyboard controls being so tricky makes the game get kind of button mashy and my wrists hurt after just a few minutes of frantically trying to trigger specials on most characters, with one GIANT exception. I was able to pull off Kaede's Flying Wall Assault successfully, because that combo doesn't involve any controller rolls/diagonals. More than that, I was able to pull it off -continuously- by just mashing the strong attack and down keys repeatedly and never doing anything else, enabling me to beat the entire game without losing a single battle. Half the time, I won battles without taking any damage in normal and hard mode, most notably the final boss battle -- I beat the boss without getting hit in either round in normal mode, and I took two hits total in hard mode.

Mysteriously, two different moves on Kaede have the same trigger sequence listed. (Thunderclap Claw and Round Moon Kick.)

The game reset to the start screen during a playthrough. It also crashed out twice, once when just idling in the background for trading card drops.

I do like the character designs a lot, and the animations are well done.

The story cut scenes were a little frustrating because I wanted the text to go by faster, but hitting a button just skipped the story entirely. Turns out not to be a great loss. The story is a bit flimsy and the translation/writing isn't that great.

On the bright side, I got my card drops and finished the game's story mode on all difficulty settings, so I marked it as "all done" in my collection and uninstalled.
