author: {'steamid': '76561198348524577', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1637564074}
review:
No está mal, pero tiene algunos aspectos que me dejan con un pequeño vacío, a continuación hago una breve descripción de lo que me ha gustado y lo que no:

[h1] Puntos a favor:	[/h1]

Es un juego relativamente barato, visualmente está muy bien realizado, los efectos de sonido están bien claros y agradables, la música es bastante buena, las voces son muy agradables, los personajes son bastante interesantes; cada una de las princesas tiene movimientos únicos y los sprites encantan. No existen luchadores genéricos (de esos que nadie escoge porque son aburridos, feos y torpes). 
Los controles son moldeables y es fácil de utilizar incluso usando un teclado, el nivel de dificultad es bueno y se mueve con fluidez

[h1] Puntos en contra:	[/h1]
Empezando por la pequeña cantidad de luchadoras a escoger, no está mal, pero igual sería bueno ver un poco más, en ocaciones se activaba la pantalla de movimientos sin haber sido presionada la tecla para solicitarla, los loops de música se terminan, los movimientos y combos con muy muy básicos, en realidad esto no me desagrada, de hecho me gustan los juegos así, pero la mayoría de la gente se ha vuelto más difícil y busca comando complejos y combos espectaculares, las animaciones de game over son inexistentes, de hecho me hace pensar que el juego está hecho en M.U.G.E.N. y no está mal, pero queda un poco básico.

Yo lo recomiendo, aunque es mejor comprarlo de oferta porque es realmente corto, no hay opciones de lucha más que arcade.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117525431', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 83, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1512969861}
review:
The DLC Hilda Rise completely broke the game for me.
Had just started playing and after an hour I saw DLC for $1.99 so I was like "Why the hell not?"

Little did I know...

The boss character you get is good but stage flickering to completely whited out screen occurs every match now, light attack effects remain on screen permanently, assist characters now no longer move or act and then the game crashes.  Tried verifying game cache, uninstalled and reinstalled then tried every possible (although extremely limited) option to try and rectify the issue to no avail.

Bloody shame cuz I love old school fighters regardless of fan service (couldn't care less if it's in there or not).  

TL;DR - Game is broken as f**k, get Skull Girls, KOF, or any other 2D fighter over this.  

Such sad panda :(

author: {'steamid': '76561198011177984', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 341, 'last_played': 1492094108}

author: {'steamid': '76561198048817935', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 137, 'playtime_forever': 182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 182, 'last_played': 1483814372}
review:
Vanguard Princess è un classico picchiaduro alla Street Fighter, Tekken e simili ma con una caratteristica particolare (e se avete guardato gli screenshot, avete già capito quale): solo personaggi femminili e vestiti quanto più sexy possibile.

Il gioco da un lato è ben curato sulle combo, sulle ragazze (eh bhé), ma dall'altra parte...abbiamo un comparto tecnico veramente scarno. Il gioco non ha un'opzione fullscreen, ci sono poche (due) modalità e altre mancanze.

Evidentemente chi ha realizzato il titolo, che tra l'altro, pare che in versione giapponese sia free già da diversi anni, ha puntato molto sull'aspetto sensuale delle protagoniste e sulla complessità dei picchiaduro. Se non siete esperti nei picchiaduro, verrete presi a calci nel sedere dalle varie tipe seminude (ma a qualcuno potrebbe anche piacere) o vi metterete a premere comandi a caso e sperare di vincere, come giocavo io Eddy su Tekken 3 agli inizi.

Detto questo, NON consiglio l'acquisto a prezzo pieno, il gioco in alcuni casi è stato distribuito gratuitamente oppure in tempi di saldi ha un prezzo veramente accessibile (sotto i 2 euro), che quindi almeno secondo me giustificano la pochezza tecnica del titolo. 
A parte ciò, lo consiglio solo se siete veramente fan dei picchiaduro e della "carne" anime.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130866984', 'num_games_owned': 5314, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1485357221}
review:
类mugen格斗游戏，打击感还行，画面质量不错。
游戏风格类似于kof2000-2003，有援助系统，但不同于kof的多人物组队，只有1vs1。
可选参战角色10人+援助5人，援助角色可以消耗援助能量槽（5次，随时间增加）释放援助攻击，参战角色可以消耗能量槽（1次，随攻击填充）释放奥义。
操作方面接近街霸，上下左右+轻中重攻击，额外增添援助攻击和奥义键位。
可以自定义键位设置，但对键盘党来说并不十分友好（360度方向键……），可能的话还是手柄吧。
技能施放难度不大，一个角色一般是5-6个技能，包括奥义在内施放难度等同于升龙（奥义键拯救键盘党，我在键盘上中重攻击同时按根本没反应）

author: {'steamid': '76561198000733468', 'num_games_owned': 349, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1483892302}
review:
Doesn't take much to quickly see that this isn't a very good fighting game. Three button attack input is limited, does not flow well, and each characters have a very small and limited moveset which pretty much makes combos either very linear or impossible.

Not a lot of movement options and a lack of polish is just another show of the old engine this game runs on.

It's a real shame, since the creator's art is absolutely beautiful and the animations are fluid. The sound design and music are satisfactory, and the voices are good, but unfortunately the game just isn't fun. Sugeno should probably just stick to what he's good at, which is producing art assets.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062931577', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1526496865}
review:
I'm not that much into fighting games, but I have to recognize a fighting game I rage quit because I suck, and a fighting game I rage quit because it doesn't work. 

Vanguard Princess looks amazing, the 2D graphics are out of this world, but playing it is a 50/50 chance of being enjoyable or extremelly frustrating. If not by meeting completelly broken characters that spam full screen ranged attacks or the very poor response of controls and motions, it will most likelly piss you off with a glych that makes the move list screen appear in the middle of the fight out of nowhere.

The striker system is also an absolute nuisance, with secondary characters jumping in the fight and getting in front of everyone, making the fight into an absolute mess, making you lose track of the position of both your adversary and yourself.

The astonishing inability of the game menus to have any command to go back in your choices also tells me that whoever made this game had amazing artists but amateur programmers. This game isn't finished in any way imaginable, from character balacing and missing game modes such as multiplayer (this is no era for fighting games with no internet multiplayer support), to basic main menu features. Baffling that such high quality sprites are wasted in such a piece of !@#$%. I'm glad I bought this game with money I got from selling cards, and in a 75% discount.

To whoever made these sprites, voiced the characters and made the music, my whole hearted condolences.
To the programmers, I have nothing to tell you that would be legal.

author: {'steamid': '76561198354552052', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1482986327}
review: For $5 this is a pretty good fighting game with a fun and diverse roster. Gorgeous artwork, I love the tradiging the mechanics and gameplay is easy. The trading cards and emoticons are also nice touches. The soundtrack is awesome and the fighting is very remeniscent of the classic X-Men vs Street Fighter. I should mention that the game also has a parrying system like in Street Fighter Alpha but, unlike Alpha where you pushed forward to parry; Vanguard Princess has it's own dedicated button.  My favorite characters are Saki and Kurumi.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991824207', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1482966591}

author: {'steamid': '76561198354952438', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1482953978}
review:
The price of the game makes sense (even without the Winter Sale), it's still great cheap fighting fun. It has some catchy music, nice range of characters and assists, great sprite art, and one of the best displays of pixel animation I've seen, this is actually some pretty quality stuff. Once you play with someone elese who knows the game, it's very absurd, yet very fun and easy to learn.

The trading cards are pretty cool too!

author: {'steamid': '76561198176955874', 'num_games_owned': 221, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1483081219}
review:
Cuando me puse a ver las guías de este juego, observé que muchos decian que el juego es muy vacio. Y en efecto, lo es.

Pero eso no le quita que sea entretenido, por ende el bajo precio.

Vanguard Princess consta de 10 personajes, únicos en estilo de pelea.
Todas las personajes se ven bien esteticamente y no me he encontrado con fallo alguno.

Lo que la gente se queja es que el juego no puede ponerse fullscreen, pero es falso, incluso con ALT + ENTER se puede.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127636129', 'num_games_owned': 989, 'num_reviews': 130, 'playtime_forever': 166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1482062044}
review:
First of all, this is not a bad game and I actually love it. I give a thumb down here just to remind you guys don't instant buy, read a few lines below please.

It was originally released as a free game back in 2009, made by only one guy. And the free version is now still on the [url=http://suge9.blog58.fc2.com/blog-entry-21.html]developer's blog[/url]. If you just want to have a try, just go there and grab it. Pretty much the same as steam version, except it's Japanese. Well, who cares. And if you really love the original version and want to support the developer or donate some money like me, come back and buy it. (I've no idea whether the money still goes to the developer though)

It was a great game then. My mind was blown when I first saw this game. I can't imagine how much time it takes a single person to draw all the high quality pixel arts frame by frame for 11 main characters + 5 support characters. I can't believe a free game has so many voice actors. The controll is a bit clunky and maybe it needs a lot of balancing, (You know, fighting games need lots of test plays and feedbacks to do the balancing, it's just impossible for an one man developer to achieve that) I still enjoyed it for a long time.

But what has eigoManga done when they put this hidden gem on Steam? Let me tell you:
- DLC contents that was all in the original free game, yes unbelievable.
- Bad localization, some stuff not explained. Even the command list have mistakes, and never fixed.
- No technical improvements. The game was made with a dated engine called 2D Fighter Maker 2nd(2001). Low resolution, no support for 16:9 fullscreen, very limited settings can't adjust sound volume, bad controller support. All these were OK when it's a free game, but if you are trying to sell something on Steam, please at least be professional.
- A practice stage happens every time you start the story mode, in which you have to win 5 rounds against a standing still AI.
- Add a game mode which you fight with 2 AIs together, I don't know what's fun in this. When I stand between them I don't have any idea which direction is which and how to do a special move.
- Add some maps/backgrounds that aren't as good as those in the original game. Some are just like taken from a photo and reduced to 256 color. (due to the engine limit) They don't even try to fix some artifacts.
- Sell fanmade artworks for money.

Thank you for reading so much. As I said, if you are intrested in this game, or you want a few more pantus and waifus, go try the free game. After reading all these and you still sure you want to donate some money, then buy it, maybe on a sale.

review:
Bought this game+DLC when sale coming. Pretty fun and challenging for me, well since i'm actually not into fighting game genre. Very recommended to play this with controller. Kinda hard to play and execute the special moves with keyboard. The sprites animation looks smooth and clean, i like it.

Haruka is my favorite btw, and for support is Shiera. Since Haruka's "Melt Shot" move is OP af, and when i got into trouble, Shiera can just blow up the arena for me. (no one asking? no problem lol)

Do i recommend you to buy and play this game? If you're into fighting game genre with qt animu gurl, then this game is for you.

review:
Anime severler için tatlı bir oyun daha:

+ İyi dövüş sistemi

+ Akıcı oyun

+ Sesler iyi


- Fullscreen yok oyunu Winkawaks emulatörü ile oynuyor gibiyiz. (kaçıncı yüzyıldayız ?? oyun port edilmiş hala başka konsoldan port edilme işlemleri görüyoruz)

- Online Modu yok (bunu her oyunda söylerim dövüş oyunu dediğin online olacak)

- Oyunun Menü temasına ısınamadım 

- Karakter Komboları cidden zor 


Fullscreen için "borderless gaming" adlı program ile oyunları tam ekran yapabilirsiniz çoğu sorunlu oyunlarda tek çözüm

author: {'steamid': '76561198141262666', 'num_games_owned': 873, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1585582799}
review:
Я сам не анимешник.и всегда с лёгкой иронией и смехом отношусь к подобным играм с аниме стилистикой.
ключ на игру достался случайно.
поиграв в эту игру чуть чуть выношу вердикт.
Играть можно.весело.прикольно.на высокой сложности иногда начинает пригорать.
Но управление никакое неудобное как по мне.хотя в МК играю хорошо.лучше всего играть на геймпаде в эту игру.
когда я только начинал  играть в неё игра глючила но потом через 5 патчей всё стало норм.
к управлению надо привыкать.
10 из 10 симпатичных тянок.

author: {'steamid': '76561198343650897', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1478975798}
review:
I'm glad I bought Vanguard Princess especially on sale. In combat, you have to choose the direction of attack and movement, and the type of attack (Weak, Normal, Strong). 

Character selection screen needs some work, as you can't get a really good feel for the interpersonal relationships between the primary fighter and her assistant character. 

I would recommend this to anyone who enjoys pressing the attack key quite often. Overall, a good design choice.  Bottom line: If you DO like anime and more waifus in your life, you'll like this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013489529', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1478757344}
review:
I was very disappointed by Vanguard Princess. I was hoping for a smooth, fluid 2D shooter in the vein of Guilty Gear, BlazBlue, Type|Moon etc, but instead received a very unpolished product that barely runs on my system.

Issues:
* Game runs at 800x600 resolution. You can edit the graphics settings in the .ini file, but base assets are at an unacceptably low resolution for anything made in the past 10 years.
* Game is exceedingly slow and laggy on my quad core i5 system with a GTX 1070. I'm talking sub-20 fps here.
* Game crashes whenever I have my Xinput (nvidia Shield controller) device plugged in
* Keyboard input is also very slow and unresponsive, not taking in quarter circle inputs or anything more complicated than basic movement/attack
* Refund options do not include DLC purchase price (buyer beware)
* Controls and navigation are poorly implemented for keyboard users

The character designs are nice and colorful, and the combat system /might/ be good for all I know, but I am unable to enter any advanced moves because of the above input issues I am facing, so I am left with a broken product that I can't refund for anything close to what I shelled out for.

Regretfully, I will have to rate this game a "No".

author: {'steamid': '76561198154551738', 'num_games_owned': 268, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1577758099}

author: {'steamid': '76561198066361192', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1478679542}
review: sorry...As a huge fan of fighting games who has played atleast 100 different fighting games from 2d, to 3d, to anime fighters, capcom fighters, namco, snk, nether realms, etc etc, I cannot recomend this game. The buttons are wonkey and clunky. They don't make much sense when compared to most other fighting games. Worst of all it comits the worst sins of the worst anime fighters. The animations are pretty good. The backgrounds are decent. It has no sound controls what so ever(or much else at all for that matter). It only has 2 modes. That is a huge no no in a fighting game you want to charge for especially a game like this that wants to "reinvent" the fighting game control scheme. you get way more out of the free version of dead or alive and killer instinct. luckily for me I got the game for 2 bucks. I would not have wanted to pay any more for something like this. If it is indie get that it is indie but even then skull girls is a god send compared to this. It has potential. I hope the developers take more time studying more fighting games and what makes them as good as they are before making another one of their own. It isn't the worst fighting game I have ever played but it could use alot of work.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098667698', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1476436579}
review:
我发自内心的很不推荐购买这款游戏。

系统太过简陋，主菜单界面只有故事模式和vs模式这两个选项，画面分辨率太低，没有返回主菜单按键，甚至没有返回上一级的按键，一旦出了差错想重来最快的方法是重启游戏。故事模式没什么故事只有寥寥几句台词，甚至简单模式的电脑是不会动的。也没有任何一个用来设置游戏的选项，框框上方的选项卡除了用来设置键位外几乎一无是处。

游戏性我没有玩很久，但是不同的人物之间并没有鲜明的特点和值得称道的创意，没有吸引我去尝试更多的角色。更重要的是某些设计非常离奇，普遍手短和下蹲优势导致万金油下铲，还有恶心瞬发的远距离投技，很多招式实际范围或触发时间与图像显示不符，再加上很多抬手被偷工减料了，导致两人交手时的判定也令人匪夷所思。技能的雷同率很高，而他们之间的伤害和实用性的却差别很大，普遍上又把攻击设置的太高，不断伺机地用踢击蹭血就莫名其妙地轻松取胜了。

当然也少不了很多bug，键盘键位的设置就很奇怪，折腾很久才发现必须p1、p2设置相同方向键才有效，又比如KO之后的过场前打开技能表会黑屏，然后只能重开。

唯一的亮点大概是美术风格，但是对于一款没有其他亮点而且玩起来非常别扭的格斗游戏来说，这没有任何意义。

author: {'steamid': '76561198014279882', 'num_games_owned': 471, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1473068201}
review:
[h1]Video Review: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4470-kv0v3c[/h1]

Really good feeling fighting game that could be vastly improved with some polish:

At the time of writing this, there's only local multiplayer and not online. I emailed the devs and they said that online multiplayer is a priority. It [b]is[/b] possible to play this game online, however you need to do a little bit to set it up and tbh it shouldn't be this involved; [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=359817700]guide to playing online multiplayer[/url]

Another issue I have with this game is the menus; they're [b]really[/b] ugly and need touching up; having to click on a toolbar item and rebind the keys via a popup is really ugly and seems like something from a Windows 95 game.

Recommend this game for fans of the art style, and fans of Animu fighters.
[i]Psst[/i]:[spoiler]there's lolis and pantsu 👉🍑[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561197962981738', 'num_games_owned': 573, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1472752943}
review:
Анимемусор с диким управлением, по дефолту запускающийся в маленьком окошке. Oxyeл от творящейся там eбaнины буквально за 5 минут. Если вы не анимедаун - не рекомендую. Эта xyuта один из самых хуевых файтингов, какие я только видел, даже если закрыть глаза на аниму. 
Спасибо Гейбу за рефанд.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025123733', 'num_games_owned': 2764, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 271, 'last_played': 1569002826}
review:
For the newly released Linux port,

Lets start with the cons:
- It's a WINE wrapped ...
- ...Windows 9x Fighter...
- ...running only windowed mode (640x480, but can be changed though a game.ini file)...
- ...which causes the Steam Overlay not to work...
- ...therefore no working Steam Controller in-game bindings.

But, if you can look past these, here are the pros:
+ DS4 (PS4 controller) works perfectly through bluetooth without requiring any additional driver.
+ If the Steam Controller uses a regular controller template in desktop configs, it works just as well.
+ The gameplay is solid.
+ Every character I tried so far, while unique, is accesible.
+ The artwork is gorgeous, even under such low-res.
+ The animations are fluid.
+ It may make you come back for more after playing it once.

TL,DR: The game presentation and integration may be lacking (due to its WinAPI roots), but it's definitely worth a try, especially for $5.

Edit: For anyone interested in looking how the game plays, you can take a look here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=84PG-kKF5ks&index=11&list=PL1z9Dq5TTzQajbzN9vD2qOqjR9e3rXDWj

author: {'steamid': '76561198057171700', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1469490634}
review: 2/10 - Bom que eu posso resumir deste game ... o game e desbalanceado as lutadoras são muito desequilibradas a variação não vai de havy, tactical ou fast fight simplesmente vai de over power a inutel :/ Sem brincadeira elas não tem um meio termo de combos e poderes de explosão, tive o trabalho de ver vídeos para tentar fechar o modo arcade que que por sinal e o único modo de jogo se não tiver ninguém para jogar em split screen em versus. Achei muito plástico os movimentos o que salva mesmo e uma pequena história que prende sua atenção no começo depois você ignora tudo, gosto de games arcade e MUGENS e um dos pilares, mas este Vanguard Princess precisa trilhar um longo caminho ainda para se tornar um game bom.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071764270', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1469266710}
review:
Pros: 
-anime girls and pretty good graphics
-controls are simple, no crazy chains that will 100% you
Cons:
-Can't really chain attacks, so you can't 100% others
-5 assist characters 1 is op other 4 is useless and they walk right beside your character just to confuse you
-No practice mode
-No online match

Probably had too much expectation for the game so my review isn't really fair to this game, I thought this game would be like skull girls or melty blood or guilty gears. If you play a lot of fighting game then this game probably isn't for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009846226', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1418093531}
review:
So, I didn't play this game a lot, but it just didn't seem like a great fighter. It kinda relies on its anime style, fan service, and a cheap price tag.

However, I recently started playing Skullgirls, and it is infinitely better. If you want a good fighter, I'd find skullgirls on sale or in a bundle. The art, story, and mechanics are much better than Vanguard Princess. Fan service is there as well if you need that. There is a pretty good tutorial, though some of the sections are  tough for people new to fighting games. 

I feel like there are too many good fighters out there, and I feel no need to return to this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198308066082', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1585638088}
review:
Bom, o game é interessante pra quem gosta de jogos de luta...
Tem gráficos até bonitos também...
Ah sim, o game só tem lutadoras (estilo Arcana Heart, por exemplo).
Porém, serve apenas de passa tempo, visto que não há conquistas pra realizar.
O gráfico, em questão de resolução, deixa sériamente a desejar, pois roda no padrão 640x480 e só vai pra tela cheia no Alt+Enter (e fica consideravelmente ruim, ainda assim).

O valor pelo game é baixo e isto pode valer com que valha a pena fazer o pequeno investimento, contudo, pros dias atuais, se torna um empecilho (de certa forma) jogar um game que nativamente suporta uma resolução tão baixa.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000324475', 'num_games_owned': 424, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1552577678}
review:
So this game looks beautiful and what controls work are highly responsive. My lack of recomendation comes from multiple facts:

1) The game lacks a fullscreen, the closest you have is maximizing the window. This would be a minor issue but combined with issue #4 I can not recommend this game.
2) Stage selection (umong other things that should be handled in game) is performed via a dialogue popup. Again minor but again refer to issue #4
3) Even if on the lowest difficulty the AI should be able to defeat an enemy who is doing nothing but crouching in place and waiting for them to get close enough to be hit. Small quibble until you read issue #4
4) The game does not properly allow remapping on my Dinput arcade stick(HORI Fighting Stick Mini 4 for PS4) and has movement LOCKED to the Left Stick preventing me from mapping them to the stick on my arcade panel even if remapping worked. This results in the menues being impossible to navigate but once I get into a match my character crouches in place making it impossible to do anything except wait for the enemy to come to me. This issue alone makes the game an immediate avoid for me and combined with the others makes me consider requesting a refund.

I would love to see this game updated to fix these issues (especially issue #4), it truely looks promising but this should not have been launched as a commercial product in it's current state. In the event that an update is forthcoming I will reconsider my review but I will always be of the mind this should have been posted as a beta/early access to get these things ironed out.

Maybe these issues will not bother you if you are not a fan of the 2d arcade fighter genre with a nice pricy arcade stick.

author: {'steamid': '76561198135411016', 'num_games_owned': 504, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 867, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 497, 'last_played': 1622705804}
review:
This game is a blast. Whether you like anime itself or you are a fighting gamer. This game has some difficulty but its the type of dificulty that is fun and also challenging.

The game is really short. A experienced fighter can probably clear the story in about 10 minutes. But the amount of fighters and the increasing difficulty can make for a new experience everytime you decide to play.

The local multiplayer can be a blast if both of the players have played at least a little.

The only problem I have with this game is if you do not have a controller to play the game with, It is rediculously hard to even play. The specials require direction inputs that is rediculously hard for a person playing with a keyboard can do.

I loved the game and would reccomend it to people who enjoy fighter games and anime. But make sure you have a controller you can use!

author: {'steamid': '76561198068296108', 'num_games_owned': 121, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 209, 'last_played': 1580873292}
review:
돈콤의 능욕에 못이겨 회사를 뛰쳐나온 한 남자가 만든 남자에 남자의 남자를 위한 대전액션게임입니다.
스토리 자체는 직선적이면서도 나름 나쁘지는 않지만, 영어를 모르면 이 년들이 팬티 자랑하려고 싸우는 건가하는 의문점이 드네요.

게임의 완성도는 매우 좋습니다. 사실, 격투 게임 쯔꾸르로 이정도의 퀄리티를 만드는 것은 좀 힘듭니다. 무겐에서라면 어느 정도 가능하지만요. 그래서 그런지, 커맨드가 좀 뻑뻑한 면이 있고, 난이도도 좀 괴악스럽습니다. 더불어, 콤보 자체도 체인 콤보 방식이 아니어서 결국 입문자들은 필살 한 방을 노리는 경우가 더 많고요.
적의 난이도도 상당합니다. 특히 리리스는 악몽 그 자체에요. 동명의 모 빈유 서큐버스 년을 생각하면 안됩니다. 판정 자체가 괴랄한지, 아니면 게임의 템포 때문인지 몰라도 보스인 힐다 리제보다 더 어려워 보입니다.

하지만, 이리 적으면 돈만 날리는 게임이라고 생각하기에......
장점도 많습니다.

우선 보통의 격투게임과 다른 템포 덕분에 단점도 있지만, 장점도 나오게 됩니다. 요즘은 대부분 빠른 템포를 요구해서, 뱅가드 프린세스는 그래도 동인게임 치고는 입문하기 쉬운 편입니다.
더불어, 쭉빵한 도트는 비추를 박게 해도 추천으로 되돌아오게 만듭니다. 제작자는 단 한 사람 뿐이며, 초안 그림부터 일러스트, 스프라이트 전부 혼자서 찍어냈다는 것에 감탄사가 절로 나옵니다.

결론은 더 해봐야 알겠지만, 우선 추천입니다.
연습 같은 걸 하고 싶다면, 위키 같은 곳에서 정보를 얻는 걸 추천합니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041689420', 'num_games_owned': 508, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1481655195}
review:
Visually appealing. That game is not easy to controle.
Not numerous, the movements and techniques are a lil' bit hard to perform.

Also, a proper full screen would be nice with some anti-aliasing.
The Gameplay could be reworked I think. Not the easiest, compared to i.e. BlazBlue Calamity Trigger.

Would I recommand it ? If you like the manga style and the pretty girls fighting, then yes. Otherwise, look elsewhere, until the dev changes some things in the gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198173842847', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1461690600}
review: I dont know if i should recommend this game or not. I had gotten it as a gift from a friend, But if you look at the amount of time i have put into it its not that much. All it is really is a 2D Anime fighter. Not really a story with it or anything. If there is a story I didn't care enough to follow it. The graphics look great and the animation is nice to look at. The controls are fluid and very responsive. what really turns me off from putting more time into it is that its Anime based. I don't care for Anime at all. I care nothing for the genre and dont really feel the need to continue to play the game. So all that said I am going to give this game a thumbs down and only recommend it for play if its on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078844152', 'num_games_owned': 802, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 148122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78389, 'last_played': 1651302721}
review:
[b]It's been around 2000 hours and I still try to continuously figure out if this game is good or not. In the end, I cannot recommend it.[/b]

For now it has some missing features like online play and steam workshop (the store page says it has steam workshop) and I bet the engine of this game does not support steam API yet. Doing combos is hard and you have to look at the manual outside of the game which is inconvinient and also the control is awkward for keyboard. Best to play it on a controller. Story is meh, DLC does not work either. The only good thing about this game is the pixelly art and almost all characters show panties. I tried to screenshot them, that's what all my playtime is spent for, but I can't, which is the worst thing of all.

EDIT: they have added an in-game training stage.

author: {'steamid': '76561198242619404', 'num_games_owned': 940, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1702975598}
review:
《Vanguard Princess》中文《先锋公主》。是09年度号称最华丽的同人2D格斗游戏，也算得上是老游戏了。移植到STEAM上之后，还很良心地推出了MAC OS X版本。
    主要是一款美少女格斗的动作游戏，游戏可用角色有十一名＋五名可爱的支援角色（不含DLC）。人设与故事背景都很不错，BGM也有得一听。打击感很优秀，招式的确华丽。
    顺带一提该游戏的OS X版本。虽然除了mac版的初衷是好的，但按键乱排，画面只有屏幕的六分之一让人很难受......
    游戏的不足之处：1.角色招式太少。2.个别角色太过强大。3.游戏模式少。4.因为按键排布错乱，推荐用手柄游玩
    没有成就系统，但是有交换卡牌可以收集，价格也不贵，值得入手(感觉最棒的还是人设啊）

author: {'steamid': '76561198011595325', 'num_games_owned': 2476, 'num_reviews': 929, 'playtime_forever': 350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 350, 'last_played': 1461436311}
review:
Vanguard Princess é um jogo de luta com garotas de anime, e aparentemente, totalmente focado nas garotas, esquecendo da parte da luta. O jogo é totalmente desbalanceado e com controle horríveis, fraco e tedioso, parece realmente apostar mais na temática do que em todo o resto. Totalmente dispensável.
--------------------------
Vanguard Princess is a fighting game with anime girls, and apparently fully focused on girls, forgetting the part of the struggle. The game is totally unbalanced and horrible control, weak and tedious, really seems to focus more on the subject than all the rest. Totally dispensable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054690449', 'num_games_owned': 1377, 'num_reviews': 182, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1459454919}
review:
NOTE: played on a Mac

If you're looking to get into the fighting genre for the first time, avoid this game like the plague.  Even on a controller, the button mapping is a mess (it's far worse on a keyboard).    Nothing is mapped to the D-pad or arrow keys, which makes navigating the menus a hassle.  Finding out how to map buttons is a problem in and of itself; you have to go to the program menu, not the game menu, a concept that's out of place with most games on the market.  Even then, you still can't map moving to the D-pad.  

In addition, there's no hands-on tutorial or practice mode and you can literally get clobbered on Easy just because you don't know what you're supposed to be doing.  

If these concerns are ever addressed, the game would be a lot more bearable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011333280', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1469233496}
review:
Well, after some issues with the OsX release, the developer worked fast enough to have it fixed in 2 days.
I wish more Japanese Developers ported their games to Mac Os X... 

Pros:
- cool designs and animations 
- each character has it's own different fighting style, pretty different from the others
- You CAN acces the move list while in game, just press START
- Ps3 controller support and you can configure the controls on the menu.
- Fanservice everywhere (if you're into that)
- reminds me of Waku Waku 7

Cons:
- would wish there were more characters to choose
- The Pause menu only shows the move list. It lacks a "quit to menu" "chose other chara" etc. options
- Only Arcade and Versus modes. Would be nice to have Online or a Practice mode, but for practice I guess you can play 2 player game and play alone.
- I miss Waku Waku 7

So, with all that, yes, I do recommend it if you're looking for a fun, anime style, girls only (fanservice aware) fighting game to play alone or with friends on LOCAL multiplayer.

I tried to enjoy this game... but for me it makes no sense even if I am quite good (enough to beat up all my friends in Skullgirs and most levels in Blazblue), but this...
I know the strenghts and weaknesses of my characters, I know how to use supports... I read manual...
And yet it is the only game I know that you can play up to the highest standards and still lose since blocking and dmg calculation doesn't seem to have much sense as far as I played...

author: {'steamid': '76561198039038404', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1474395103}
review:
Ultimately I like the game and the team has updated it a few times since I bought it last year, so I'm recommending it, but that recommendation comes with some warnings.

Smooth animations and solid controls.  You get an Arcade mode and Versus.  There is a way to make Versus into Practice mode but it should just be its on own on the main screen instead.  

No online play.

To the devs' credit, I got this game last year and they have updated it a few times since.  They added D-Pad support as well as in-game move lists.  These should have already been there, but at least they did go back and add them.

Snag this one on sale.  

At $5 standard I can't quite recommend it as is, even though I enjoy it when I play it.  There are other fighters out there with online play and added modes that are more worth the $5 and above you'd be asked to pay.  

I will update this review if/when they update the game again and I play it.  Thanks for reading, hope this was helpful.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981127270', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 166, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1455665272}
review:
Let me start by saying this: This game is BEAUTIFUL to look at. The sprites are detailed, and the animations are fan-freaking-tastic. The music is catchy, the level design is bright(er than it should be sometimes), and all the flashy garnish you'd expect from such a heavily anime'd (probably not a word) title is most certainly present.
There's an attempt at a story, though I didn't really care too much about it, cutscenes used here and there, and the endings were a bit odd, but all nice to look at (animated victory screens etc).
Unfortunately, the gameplay is where it falls flat. Moves lists are short (and way too many are shared across multiple characters), combos are boring, and wins just don't feel that rewarding. It features the usual mega-cheese-boss from fighting games of yesteryears, but that isn't really a good thing.
No proper practice mode, nor in game moves list can be a pain for fighting game nubs, but doesn't really hold seasoned fighting game players back much (or I don't feel it should). The one gripe I truly had was the total lack of explaining what the heck my teammate was supposed to do (and / or how to get them to do anything reliably).
It hurts me in a strange way to say it (because I really do love the loveable bits of this game) As a long time, and I mean LONG time (like 25 years long) fighting game player, I can't recommend this title.

review:
무슨 격투게임이 튜토리얼도 없이 "야 내가 조종법 종이에 써줄께 이거대로해! " 이런식임...

 (그냥 콘솔키 버튼 존나 눌르세요 알아서 스킬 써짐 )
이지모드도 드럽게 깨기힘듬 뭐 기본키는 알아야 할꺼아니야...  (점프키 판정 진심 욕나옴)
 맞다. 키보드형님들 액박 콘솔없으시면 이게임 살생각도 하지마셈 키보드로 절때 게임플레이못함. 
촉수손가락 아닌이상 이게임 키보드론 무리임 옵션설정도 매인매뉴에없어요.





이게임말고 스컬걸즈 사세요.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038986880', 'num_games_owned': 112, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1454716805}
review:
Only for a hardcore anime fan that can't pass any title with big-eyed girls. Well if this game was released on Amiga 500 25 years ago it "might" have been barely OK, but seriously the graphics do look like adjusted for those kind of computers. 

1992 was when Mortal Kombat 1 was released, and if you run it now under dosbox it still does look and plays better than this title. I was not expecting much, but still was highly disappointed by how BAD this one looks and plays.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992964931', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 167, 'last_played': 1454620586}
review:
The fact the developer is still putting things into the (at a slow rate) is really cool and shows that there are developers that actually care about their games and their community. 

It's a "2 on 2" Japanese fightan game with cute anime girls. The game is pretty barebones only having a vs and arcade mode, so no story, which isn't really the strong point of fighting games. 

I'm garbage at fighting games but I can say that the controls are good, but since it's an indie I don't really expect fight sticks to work 100% on the game. Keyboard works perfectly fine.

Free content and updates is cool, the fact that this game was developed by one guy, Tomoaki Sugeno, is amazing. Props.

Its not really expensive so anyone could pick this up if you like cute anime girls and fightan games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037094104', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1242, 'last_played': 1454199899}
review:
Vanguard Princess é aquele tipo de jogo que eu fico em cima do muro entre recomendar ou não e eu vou explicar o porquê.

Me admira que seja um jogo criado por ex funcionário da Capcom. Ele deve ser artista pois a arte do jogo é muito bonita. Em contrapartida, o jogo tem problemas SERÍSSIMOS em termos técnicos que precisam ser vistos e que o jogador tenha ciência desses problemas antes de ter o jogo na biblioteca.

Infelizmente Vanguard Princess tem problemas que não vemos nem em jogo Indie.

Vamos à avaliação.

Gráficos 7 – Aqui vemos a arte do jogo em ação. O jogo é muito bonito. Os sprites são bem vivos e animados. A movimentação do cabelo, seios e no corpo das lutadoras são bem fluidos. Isso tudo contrasta no cenário que também é bem animado e colorido. Vanguard Princess é o jogo que tem a arte dos animes como base e as lutadoras grandes na tela deixam que a gente perceba todos os detalhes. O problema é que a tela é muito poluída. Como temos 4 personagens na tela (personagens grandes, aliás), a confusão fica grande pois, não há um efeito de sombra nos personagens que ficam um pouco atrás, tendo o mesmo destaque de quem está na frente.

Música 5 – Eu gostei muito da música de seleção de personagens. O jogo possui músicas bem animadas estilo rock que até lembram um pouco Guilty Gear, mas aqui nós vemos um dos problemas que veremos adiante.

Jogabilidade 7 – O jogo é bem fluido e rápido. Podemos comparar a jogabilidade com jogos do gênero como Blazblue, GuiltyGear, The King Of Fighters, antigos jogos de arcade rápidos e dinâmicos, com muita movimentação na tela e magias. Achei criativo o modo como a Luna foi criada. Se tornou minha preferida do jogo. Para mim aquele estilo de jogabilidade com armas é diferente e bem original. Nesse quesito Vanguard Princess está muito bem.

Recursos 1 – Pelo menos o teclado o jogo reconhece. Digamos que seja jogável. Mais detalhes serão explicados mais abaixo. O jogo tem problemas para reconhecer controle, problemas de tela cheia, problemas na música e faltam configurações oferecidas in-game. O grande problema mesmo fica a cargo da tela onde o modo “tela cheia” NÃO é suportado nativamente pelo jogo. O jogo também possui baixa resolução.

JOGO TEM PT_BR? Infelizmente não.

PROBLEMAS – Para este jogo tive que separar um destaque apenas para problemas, visto que o jogo possui muitos.
Vanguard Princess é o típico jogo inacabado, aparentemente é um projeto abandonado pelos criadores onde, aqui na Steam, está disponível para sugar dinheiro.

A comunidade muitas vezes ignora mas por meus olhos não passam despercebidos essa falta de respeito. O jogo é velho e já teve tempo suficiente para que esses problemas, velhos conhecidos, sejam sanados. Mas pelo tempo, não vão. Pelo menos eu não tenho esperança que sejam.

Músicas: Existe um problema nas músicas onde elas são tocadas pelo leitor do jogo, mas o mesmo não foi programado para dar loop, ou seja, a música tem um fim em “fade-out”, abaixando o som e aí reinicia de novo. Coloque mp3 num player fora do jogo e deixe para repetir, essa é a mesma sensação, como se a música não fosse do jogo. Também não há opção de ativar ou desativar as músicas, efeitos sonoros, vozes do jogo, absolutamente nada. Quando o jogo sai do primeiro plano a música desaparece, também ficamos sem opção de poder ficar na musiquinha de menu enquanto escrevemos as análises no Word (eu gostei daquela música, sério).

O jogo não reconhece o controle de Xbox360. Isso é resolvido apenas por programa externo. O teclado também vem com comandos confusos e precisam ser reconfigurados na configuração externa. Tudo do jogo é feito externamente com mods e programas, pois o mesmo, inacabado, não oferece os recursos nativamente. Eu consegui jogar no controle há alguns anos usando o XPADDER, onde mapeei o teclado no controle, mas precisava mesmo desse trabalho todo pra jogar?...

Transições: Eu na verdade eu só o considero esse quesito numa avaliação quando isso está totalmente gritante no jogo. Efeitos como fade-in e fade-out (o escurecer e clarear de uma tela para outra), a velocidade que o jogo age entre os rounds e os cortes que ele ganha são muito grandes. Desde a abertura vemos que o jogo foi criado para ser o mais simples possível, mas acredito que tenha sido criado mais nas pressas do que para ser simples. Podemos ver isso claramente na tela de continue, sem graça, feia, sem música, sem nada além de um papel de parede pixelado...

Tela: O jogo tem baixa resolução. O máximo que podemos fazer é clicar em Maximizar. Não tente dar um “alt+enter” pois isso vai bugar o seu jogo.

Não existe nas configurações para mudar essa opção pois “configurações” não existem nesse jogo. Tudo é o que é e está lá para ser. Nada de mudar nada. 

Existem programas externos para burlar isso mas... Poxa... Que custa o jogo nos deixar jogar com tela cheia? Tudo aqui parece ser resolvido por programas externos quando se devia já vir desde o início, isso era no mínimo a obrigação mais básica de um desenvolvedor.

Bom, tendo todos esses problemas, parece que o que fizeram, ao invés de consertarem, colocaram personagens de DLC por fora (e caros para esse tipo de jogo).

A qualidade técnica passa longe. É uma pena, pois a arte e a música desse jogo são muito boas. SobrE a história, não vai ter análise por fora porque o jogo já sofreu demais, ela é muito simples e não é aprofundada no jogo, serve apenas de pretexto para as meninas super sexys com poderes lutar.

Deixo minha não-recomendação por nível técnico, pois o jogo é inacabado. Se fosse gratuito e o desenvolvedor não tivesse um suporte, eu até não falaria nada sobre essa falta de investimento (que pelo tempo parece ser falta de vontade mesmo). Ainda assim eu gosto do jogo e achei bem divertido. Na data dessa análise vi a notícia de que vão implementar uma tela de lista de comandos (o que já devia ter há anos), mas por enquanto nada de consertarem esses problemas que são, no mínimo, bizarros para os dias de hoje.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103929756', 'num_games_owned': 956, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 641, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 641, 'last_played': 1455368099}
review: Moi qui suis un grand débutant, j'ai été très embêté par le fait qu'il n'y ai aucun tutoriel. L'ergonomie des menus est inexistante, et impossible de mettre le jeu en plein écran. Je ne recommande pas ce jeu mais vous pourriez peut-être apprécier si vous avez des bases en vs fighting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041063398', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1544149325}
review:
Date: 1/27/2016
Review Number: 2 
Game: Vanguard Princess
From (Creator Publisher): eigoMANGA
Played On: Laptop (windowed) with keyboard
Steam Price as of Review: 4.99
Total Time played: 30 minutes (barely)
Review:

Second review of the year of reviews, and already I’m barely squeaking by getting this in just before midnight.  However, the spirit is willing, and the body, though bruised and throbbing, is able to maintain just long enough to eke out a quick review of the game Vanguard Princess, a standard knock-off street fighter-esque 2D fighter by eigoMANGA.  Now, Street Fighter was all the rage around the time I was in late elementary school/junior high school, and I remember being able to play it for the first time on a super nintendo put up in our local Toys’R’Us.  I distinctly recall beating someone several grades above me who was demoing it next to me simply by marching up to him and spamming the throw button like it would give me free candy if I hit it hard enough.  As time marches on, I find that my strategy for these side view beat-em-ups has sadly changed fairly little.  Move back and forth a bit and repeatedly slam buttons until the other guy (or in this case, girl) falls over and you get a brief cutscene with a little happy dance and some nice music.  Now, as we are rolling into nearly two decades after that little bit of childhood, we find the market rather inundated with clones of the same game, just with different pixelated versions of the same sprites, all with flashy special moves that you either a) only do to look better than the person next to you or b) don’t really care about because anything more complicated than press x to throw really isn’t worth your time.  That being said, there is something oddly satisfying about the fighting game genre, if only for its nostalgia.  However, for a game with only a small handful of characters and not a lot of depth, I just don’t necessarily see a game like this being worth the investment.  Now I hear that the director’s cut version is riddled with fanservice, however in my thirty minute playthrough I can’t comment on that specifically, mostly as I didn’t really see much fan-service, but make of that what you will.  Even if it was, there are games filled with more content (both of the safe for work and non safe for work varieties) available online for free, such as the open source MUGEN engine, designed to let nearly any character be playable, regardless of its ability or costuming.  With games like those so commonly available and with downloadable characters up the butt, I can’t necessarily say Vanguard Princess has anything that would be worth that sort of investment.  To each their own, however, and I certainly don’t feel the need to remove it from existence, simply from my hard drive.

Game’s Fate: Uninstalled, though I may go find my old copy of MUGEN to replace it.
Buy/No Buy: Nope, though I guess it might be worth it if you’re already a fan.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084638847', 'num_games_owned': 330, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 568, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 469, 'last_played': 1645817495}
review:
หลายคนคงซื้อเกมนี้มาเพราความน่ารักของตัวละคร.... ผมเองก็เช่นกัน
และก็เป็นมือใหม่แกะกล่องเกม Fighting ด้วย รีวิวอาจมีผิดพลาดบ้าง
จะบอกข้อดี-เสียเลยละกันนะครับ

ข้อดี
-ตัวละครน่ารักมากกกกก ♥
-ตัวละครทั้ง 11 ตัว กดท่าไม่เหมือนกัน เหมาะกับพวกบ้าเกม Fighting แต่ก็ไม่เข้ามือมือใหม่อย่างผมเท่าไหร
-มีตัวละคร ซัปพอร์ตด้วย 
-เป็นเกม Fighting ที่ดีเกมนึงที่ราคาไม่แพงมากนัก
-Eri น่ารักมากกกกกกกกกกกกกกกกกกกกกกกกกกกก ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥

ข้อเสีย

-resolution ต่ำมากกกกกกกก ขัดใจสุดๆ

-หน้า menu ทำได้ไม่ดีเลย งงๆ แต่ใช้ไปก็ชินเองในที่สุด

-อันนี้สำคัญมากกกกก เกมนี้มี DLC 3ตัวคือ 1.hilda 2.lilith 3.kurumi ผมแนะนำว่าถ้าจะซื้อควรซื่อแค่ถึง lilith ก็พอ เพราะ DLC ตัวที่ 3 ที่ชื่อ Kurumi จะเพิ่มโหมดมาอีก 2 โหมด (ฟังดูดีใช่มั้ยละ) แต่มันจะทำให้เล่น Story เเล้วเลือกระดับความยากไม่ได้ !! WTF !! อันนี้ผมก็ไม่รู้ว่าเขาทำไปได้ยังไงที่มีระบบใหม่มา แต่ระบบเก่าดันหายไปด้วย สำหรับผมมันเลวร้ายมาก มันทำให้คีบอร์ดผมแทบพังเลยละครับ...

สรุป มันเป็นเกม Fighting ที่ OK นะ เพราะราคาไม่แพงมากนัก ตอนลดราคาถูกสุดๆ แต่ก็นั้นละอย่าเพิ่งซื้อ DLC ตัวที่ 3 เลย ควรเล่นให้คล่องก่อน แล้วค่อยมาตัดสินใจซื้อ

7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198010906861', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 336, 'last_played': 1453565929}
review:
As someone who loves 2D fighting games I thought I'd give it a shot.

You launch the game and see a small "Option" menu on top of the small 640x480 window. You look into the options just to see that you can't change anything except the stage in which you fight and the number of rounds. Really? Why is it not just in a ingame menu? No graphics option: if you want to resize the window, you've got to strech it, but the resolution stays the same, making the game looks awful.

Then you look for the options to setup your fighting stick ... and it doesn't work. A fighting game without stick support. Okay.

The whole game is underwhelming. You can't train, you can't access character move list easly, you don't know their stats etc... I wouldn't mind that if the rest of the game wasn't so clunky. I really feel like I'm playing to a game made by 1st year students in computer programming. 

Save your money and use it on a better fighting game like KoF 98, KoF 02, KoF 13, SF IV, GG AC+R, BB CT... for the same price you'll get a real fighting game. Just avoid this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198273005383', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1454997401}
review:
The hit detection on this game is severely off. I have no idea how this game was released with such weird hitboxes. Attacks that should be clear hits on fullscreen just phase right through my opponent and they just strike me. It makes no sense and i've tried a large variation of characters, the issues the same with each one.

The other flaws include; no move list on pause screen, no practice mode, no explanation of support characters playstyle (that is buried in the manual apparently!). 

I can forgive these flaws as the art is really decent, and once you learn the moves you're able to unleash devastating combos on your opponent that look pretty sweet.

The characters are varied, but not varied enough (I Haven't checked out the DLC yet) to be considered a highly robust roster. 
Plus some support characters have ridiculous full screen attacks,really? You're gonna put full screen nukes in your fighting game? Cmon man.

I still recommend this game as it is one of the few PC exclusive fighting games on steam that is even somewhat fun. Just don't expect any kind of competitive scene probably ever.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123825216', 'num_games_owned': 2190, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 299, 'last_played': 1452711163}
review:
The Game starts in a 642x532 Window with Menu Bar above and Status bar below and there is no Fullscreen Mode, you can however expand the Window to Screen Size (was TV's default 1920x1080 for me), but because the Resolution also stays at (640x467) everything looks pixelated and also the Menubar does not go away.

The Anime Art looks good and Music is ok also Gamepad is supported and worked fine for me, however the Controls are a bit clunky and because of the low Resolution if Window is maxed, Things on Screen gets a bit over saturated and chaotic, you don't see anymore what is going one apart of a colorful Pixelstorm.

There is also no Online Mode, so only Player vs. Computer or Local Player vs. Player is supported. And there is no Tutorial, no Combolist, no Practice Mode and i not found out how the Teamhelp worked.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137096530', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 172, 'playtime_forever': 351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 147, 'last_played': 1454189959}
review:
Bem, a maioria das pessoas não liga para historinhas de jogos de luta... Massssssssssss... Eu vou explicar mesmo assim =P
Basicamente, são garotas que receberam poderes estranhos advindos de uma espécie de evento desencadeado por uma misteriosa mulher que, quando criança, foi abdusida pelo governo por apresentar poderes especiais. Como sempre, eles queriam usar as habilidades dela para fins militares =P
Ela voltou jurando vingança, e blah blah blah, e você, usando uma das moças - Vanguard Princess - vai lá salvar o mundo ou não, porque cada uma tem sua motivação para estar nessa bagunça =P 

Eu gostei muito do joguinho. É bem divertido, as personagens são bem bonitas e o movimento muito legal. Só aconselho a usar o controle, do contrário você vai arrebentar o teclado! Possui easy, normal e hard mode, então dá para todos os gostos e experiências! Cada personagem tem seu mode, e também tem o vs mode para dar surra na cpu ou no seu coleguinha ruim de briga =P

Recomendo!

author: {'steamid': '76561198066190027', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214, 'last_played': 1452597058}
review: Унылое и отсталое анимэ-школьминэ, файтинг отстой, анимация движений туда же, просто записанные финальные позы, никакого аналога Морфа, и никакого плавного перетикания из одного состояния в другое. Не пропорциональные тела с трегольными головами и глазами на пол башни. Постоянно Экающие и Икающие звуки главное кто му же ихнее пищание давит на подсознание, такое впечатление что пришёл на болото и в берцах давишь больших головастиков. Смысловая нагрзка ушла в отрицательную сторону по осям координат, даже для файтинга. Если уж говорить о сиськах, костюмчиках и стонах, и долгого разглядывания всего этого барахла, то уж лучше зайти на сайты для взрослых посмотреть там на сиськи, послушать охания, а на костюмчики посмотреть в реальных пропорциях, на сайтах фотосетов на тему Косплэя, где хоть нормальные люди, а не отрыжка мультипликации, уважающему себя Европейцу не понять "творчество" анимэ-шкульбидэ с их застывшими картинками, вот Пиксар и Диснэй вот это я понимаю. Так что игру я не рекомендую, она разве что подойдёт для законченных анимэшников!

author: {'steamid': '76561198094707710', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1394555767}
review:
[b]THE WAIFU WARS 
PART 01:[/b] VANGUARD PRINCESS

It's the new year, and with it comes healing.
Both figuratively and literally, as Summer-Rain
stirs from her sleep, the attack on your game
by Mr. Hollywood and his now-wife, Ms.
Novocaine. You've brought a paltry offering
of chicken soup as rain patters down lightly
outside your house. Summer-Rain smiles
weakly as she sits up, looking at you.

[i]"Starboy."[/i] She mumbles, rubbing the sleep
from her eyes and yawning, before holding
her jaw in annoyance. Your hand finds its way
there and you try to soothe her pain. [i]"Oww..."[/i]
she welps, her injuries from Prelude still a
discomfort to her.

[i]"Don't move much..."[/i] You start, as she looks
at you with a mixture of irritation and pain.
[i]"Come on. Soup's here."[/i] Summer-Rain pouts.
[i]"It's been close to two weeks I've been resting,
and we even missed New Year's! I wanna do
something, Starboy!"[/i] She yells, before her
jaw stops her with pain. [i]"I know... I know...
Maybe we could play a fighting game?"[/i]

[i]"Ok...! After soup then!"[/i] Summer-Rain nods,
clapping her oversized pyjama sleeves and
hands together.

[b]AFTER SOUP[/b]

You boot up Steam and look through your
[b]'FIGHTING'[/b] section of games, when she
orders you to stop and points to a game
called [b]'Vanguard Princess'[/b]. Summer-Rain
holds her hands on her hips, her face says
that she demands an explanation.

[i]"Look, I was in a rough place in the first two 
weeks Ms. Novocaine left. Of course I bought
a game like that!"[/i] You sputter as Summer-Rain
rolls her eyes. Smiling, she shrugs and takes
up a second controller while you reach for
your own. Vanguard Princess boots up and
both of you are taken to the menu screen.

The game has a decent selection of both
lady fighters and their chibi partners, which
can be mixed-and-matched before any given
match. Optional color palette swaps are
available as you both thumb through them.
Summer-Rain looks at you for a while before
speaking, as she selects [b]'Saki'[/b] who looks like
herself, but comments on your choice of the
Vanguard Princess [b]'Kaede'[/b].

[i]"Why did you pick her?"[/i] Summer-Rain asks,
while the screen blinks the loading screen
momentarily before the match loads. Puzzled,
you ask what does she mean. Summer-Rain
explains that you could have picked any one
of the Princesses, even a mirror-match-up
between two Sakis would have been nice,
but the fact you picked Kaede... who has
more than a suspicious resemblance to the
evil Ms. Novocaine... says something about
you.

[i]"Are you... implying something, Summer?"[/i]
You start, as both of you begin to fight 
against the backdrop of an unassuming
High school. [i]"Yes... what if I am, Starboy?"[/i]
She says coldly, her eyes looking glazed 
over as she uses Saki's sword attacks. You
can barely hold up with Kaede's own
counterattacks and realize that she might
have a point... Kaede does look like how
Ms. Novocaine was when you were with
her.

[i]"This entire game makes no sense."[/i] You
suddenly hear Summer-Rain candidly say,
as both of you return to the menu screen
after Summer-Rain wins the match-up. 
[i]"How do you mean?"[/i] You ask, as your
tired girlfriend rolls her eyes. [i]"The story
is laughable, but in a good kind of way.
The game is so short, even with all the
different match-ups, and although each 
of the characters have their own
motivations, let's be honest..."[/i]

[i]"???"[/i] You tilt your head to the side.

[i]"This whole game is just an excuse to
see hot near-nude women go at each
other and occassionally glimpsing
upskirt and pantyshots. Right?"[/i] She
puts down the controller and gives
you a quizzical, [i]'I told you so'[/i] look.

[i]"....right."[/i] You reply, thinking better
not to explain yourself when she gets up
and pushes her controller to you. You
instinctively hold it as she walks past you,
where you feel an indescribable sadness
radiate from Summer-Rain. You call out
to her as she makes her way to the door.

[i]"...Summer...?"[/i] She turns to you, eyes
glistening and a look of sadness is her
response to you. [i]"You... still think of her,
don't you?"[/i] she asks, her voice trembling.

Your mouth parts in shock of what she
said, what she accuses you of, and also it
parts in disappointment. Disappointment
at yourself, where silence emanates from
your mouth, unable to respond to the girl
standing in front of you, where she is right.

[i]"Summer... I..."[/i] Summer-Rain lifts her hand
up to prevent you for saying anything as
her she turns her head away. [i]"I'm just 
going to the bathroom, Starboy. I... Don't
wait up, ok? I'll be back before you know it."[/i]

She opens your room door and makes a
beeline for the bathroom, as you look at the
different characters of Vanguard Princess on
the screen, Saki and Kaede staring down
each other. The door to the bathroom clicks
shut and you spring forward, rushing towards
the bathroom as you finally snap out of your
daze.

Playing Vanguard Princess allowed you to
avoid the pain at a dark time in your life, but
now it has reopened old wounds. All it did
was gloss over lingering moments and
memories from a better time. Your choice in
Princess was evident from that. 

You hang your head down in shame mere 
inches from the locked bathroom door, and 
you cannot bring yourself to say the words 
of decency to help Summer-Rain feel better.
When you muster the courage half a second
later, it is too late.

You hear your Vanguard Princess crying.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136906234', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1443785592}
review:
A simple and fun fighting game.

The PROs

+ Sprite work and animation is very well done.
+ Each character has thier own unique playstyle and feel.
+ Characters are for the most part balanced.
+ Colorful backgrounds and stages.
+ Soundtrack is nothing special but is still okay.

The CONs

- The defualt window size is somewhat small and going fullscreen makes it look ugly.
- No tutorials.
- No online gameplay.
- There are only two game modes > Arcade (Story Mode) and VS.

Overall, I personally enjoyed the game and would recommend this to anyone who can deal with the cons I mentioned.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054712891', 'num_games_owned': 538, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 497, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1466888124}
review: Vanguard Princess is a very interesting fighter. It sports an all female roster of fighters to choose from with their own quirks and what not. Each fighter is animated beautifully and with lucious detail. The soundtrack is excellent and fighting is very remeniscent of Street Fighter II. The main difference being that you get to choose a partner to tag along with you in every fight with their own enery bar (not life bar because they can't get knocked out only interrupted. You also get an energy bar of your own just like in any other modern day fighter. They are all also female. It took a while getting used to a four button fighter but, having a controller handy made the transition all the easier. The game also has a parrying system like in Street Fighter Alpha but, unlike Street Fighter Alpha where you pushed forward to parry, Vanguard Princess has it's own dedicated button (which makes the game more of a three button fighter come to think of it). If it wasn't for the reputation this kind of media already had, I would have gladly recommended it to most of my friends.

author: {'steamid': '76561198253334551', 'num_games_owned': 1243, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1567610965}
review: O jogo não é ruim, longe disso tem até bons momentos, mas faltam funções básicas de menu e aquela quantidade absurda de combos, alguns modos de jogo e mais outras tranqueiras que todo fight-2D tem que ter, porém sua qualidade gráfica e trilha sonora são de boa qualidade, tem personagens pra todos os gostos, só que é aquilo é apertar loucamente os botões e ver o que acontece até se adaptar, dá pra curtir tem personagens interessantes e aqueles oppais básicos ;) rsrs

author: {'steamid': '76561198249519674', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1644197803}
review:
as garotas do jogo são muito fofinhas para o sonho de consumo de qualquer nerd/otaku dos dias de hoje, além também de ter uma artwork muito bem trabalhada (resultado que tem a mão de um ex-produtor da capcom nesta obra) e uma historia interessante.

porém, o game é muito quebrado/desbalanceado/desequilibrado (ou seja, tem personagens que são mais fortes do que as outras), além também da falta de mais modos (inclusive o on-line) e não ter suporte ao controle de xbox 360.

resultado final:
apesar de ser bem quebrado, ainda dá pra se divertir devido ao fato da facilidade de pelo menos para dar o super das personagens com um só botão juntamente com a possibilidade de dar parry (como na serie street fighter 3).

eu recomendarei esse game pelo bom trabalho visual deste game, mas, eu não vou leva-lo muito a sério nas jogatinas, já que o game não tem muito equilibrio entre si.

talvez eu mude de opinião caso aja um atualização (sujeito há uma possibilidade de uma critica em caso de uma piora ou um elogio em caso de uma melhora com o tempo).

author: {'steamid': '76561198122672421', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1451699157}
review: This game looked pretty great at first, but to be honest it's a catostrophe. This game has beautiful graphics, but the overall design and execution is terrible. The controller support is very badly made. The controls for keyboard are very badly designed (TFGH wtf?), and on top of all this there is no obvious back or exit button; Instead you have to clse the entire game. The story is about a girl who somehow miraculously survived an airplane crash and then somehow grew up to become a "beautiful woman," with no explantion on how she got out of the terrible situation she was in. She then gains magic powers and the government now wants to exploit these powers. This game could have been really fun and enjoyable if it weren't for the many flaws it has in its design and story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073929833', 'num_games_owned': 245, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1451636388}
review: Like I love fighting games of all types but the options are so shallow, it's like swimming in a kiddy pool. You can't adjust the audio at all, can't play online without a 3rd party hook up, and the help bar literally just tells you who this game is made by. I like the characters and moves but the "storyline" this game offers is just a bunch of characters you fight in a row to the boss. Bruh, you gotta watch like a minute opening sequence that you can't mute everytime you launch this game. One of the most lazy fighting games evar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119867654', 'num_games_owned': 302, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 301, 'last_played': 1451475576}
review:
[h1]Vanguard Princess - это 2D файтинг с очень хорошо нарисоваными персоонажами и окружением.[/h1]

Сюжет:
Для такой игры он не так и важен, но если кому-то интересно и он знает англииский, то может попробовать разобраться в нем.

Плюсы:
1 - [u]Низкая цена[/u], которую можно отбить карточками или [u]созданием значка и если повезет, то выпадет фон стоймостью 824 рубля на момент создания обзора.[/u]
2 - [u]Противника можно уложить с одной комбинации ударов[/u], что облегчает прохождение.
3 - [u]Возможность использовать помошника[/u], но вся помощь заключается в зачастую смертельной комбинации атак.
4 - [u]В игре присутствуют  только женские персоонажи[/u], всего их 15 (10 основных и 5 помошников).

Минусы:
1 - [u]Нет русского языка[/u], для кого-то это значимый аспект при покупке игры.
2 - [u]Плохо адаптированое управление[/u], на клавиатуре нереально играть, [u]советую использовать геймпад.[/u]
3 - [u]Нет полноэкранного режима[/u], но есть руководство на английском в котором поясняется как заставить игру работать в большом разрешении.

Итог:
Довольно не плохой 2D файтинг, который можно пройти за пару часиков и получить удовольствие (если вы играете на геймпаде).

author: {'steamid': '76561198090456371', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1451541679}
review:
Playstation controllers only. :c --- Original Review***

The developer told me that this game is made for Xbox controllers. Tried to get the game to recognize all three of my xbox controllers. The game does not recognize them. The only one it recognized slightly was the logitech that switches from xbox to playstation. The game recognized the playstation controller, but was barely functional. Here is an example of how the game's setup is completely off-putting from the start. 

http://images.akamai.steamusercontent.com/ugc/355021990278974652/C47174E494060402441D7B323A7BD7D5C0E79377/

I still do not recommend this game. It's hard for me to give a bad review ever. I typically won't say anything if I think something bad about a game. But I just want to give a warning to people out there. The game seems to be pretty buggy. And since it has such a low price it may be tempting to get, but I strongly suggest looking into another title *cough* *COUGH* Skull Girls *cough*
developer_response: Vanguard Princess is made for Xbox controllers. Please refer to the game's FAQ if you have trouble.

review:
Não se importe comprando isso. Aqui instalei tudo certo, inclusive Direct Play e o DLC "Directors Cut" e nem teclado ou XInput são reconhecidos direito. As vezes parece que os inputs estão em "curto". Funcionam ok em todos outros jogos que eu tenho. A janela é 640x480 e aparentemente não tem sequer settings para mudar isso. Se você tentar um alt+ Enter quebrará a cara. De graça ainda está caro pela trabalheira pra nada.

Don't bother in buying this piece of crap.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025311825', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1188, 'last_played': 1691831706}
review:
This review won't even consider the lack of online mode (THERE IS NONE). I will instead focus on the version that is out now.

Vanguard Princess is a game that in its vanilla version is very much like the original freeware Vanguard Princess. Only two modes are selectable: Arcade and VS. Nothing else comes with the core game. You pick one girl and one helper. As usual, each character has her own moveset and advantages or disadvantages. The helper you pick also has certain abilities and quirks that will significantly alter the way you can attack and defend. That's pretty much it. 

With the Hilda Rize DLC, the final boss, Hilda, was added to the playable roster, but well, she was never really intended for human control, so her moves and animations are somewhat limited. That said, she comes with a few more extra musical tracks. 

As of the time of this review, the Lilith and Kurumi DLCs have been added. Of special note is the more recent Kurumi package because instead of picking difficulty, the game has you pick different modes. The usual arcade mode and two new ones. Team Mode and Streak Mode. Team Mode is basically you against two opponents, three in the final stage. Two girls and one helper. Streak Mode is a survival mode which puts you in a stage and opponents jump you one on one. The addition of these two modes adds a lot of replay value to the core VP game. In addition to the game, more saccharine music is included along with two really nice tracks. Is the new music bad? No. Not MY cup of tea, except for two of them, which I really liked. Still, the game's great and the new modes add a lot of value, as I said. Highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129332113', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 286, 'last_played': 1454721231}
review:
Is it a good fighting game? Ehhh?
I don't really play fighting games apart from Tekken so I wouldn't really be a good judge on how it is as a fighting game itself but theres a long list of problems that just bug me.
-Characters seem unbalanced: Some can do special throws that take away half of your health yet they don't count as a SPECIAL move so it doesn't behave as a special attack so it can be done repeatedly. Some characters have ranged weapons which they can spam. All in all the characters aren't bad but you can get some unfair matches that you really don't have any way of winning
-Supports don't do much: From what I've expirenced your loli supports don't really do a whole lot? Some seem really shit in terms of moves. You probably won't get a chance to use them much anyway seeing as how you get penelized from getting hit some certain way? I don't understand it. Also it seems you can't counter with the supports, it seems your support won't do damage if the opponent is just recovering from a hit or hitting or just preformed a hit. It's odd.

All together as a game I'd rank it a 6/10 but as a fighting game it's more of a 3/10. I know it's on an older engine but it seems the company that bought the rights to this game doesn't seem to really know anything about fighting games and balancing them.

review: Lo siento tanto por este juego, pero la verdad te deja demasiado insatisfecho. Todo lo loli, lo fanservice, lo yuri, no salvara que en si el juego sea chato por donde se lo mire. La poca variacion de personajes e inovacion de ellos (son clones de fusion con arcana hearts y blaz blue) , la disposicion de controles (no se siente comodo tener un boton unico para el support cuando solamente tenes una poca variacion de ellos), la falta de una pantalla de seleccion de niveles (algo basico por el amor de dios) , la posibilidad de que en medio de una pelea se active el modo practica sin querer, es lastima que un juego con tantas posibilidades quede solamente en "tetas, culos y lolis para los hentais", e visto juegos que ademas de usar esos recursos, tienen sistemas y variables increibles. No recomendable para un fan de peleas

author: {'steamid': '76561198024648674', 'num_games_owned': 405, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1466551116}
review:
Empfehlen würde ich dieses Spiel nur Leuten die gerne viel nackte Anime-Haut im Pixel Stil wollen.
Die Steuerung ist schwamming, man kann jeden Gegner einfach mit einem Runter + Kick besiegen und die meisten Attacken startet man mit Street Fighters Hadouken.

Das Spiel ist dauerhaft im Fenstermodus und nur durch Alt + Eingabe auf Vollbild zu Spielen.
Das DLC fügt nur einen Pantyshot hinzu.
Außerdem hat das Spiel nur 2 Modie: "Story" und den Versus Mode den man NUR gegen einen zweiten Spieler spielen kann.

Es ist einfacher als Skullgirls und mit einem 2ten Spieler macht es Spaß, aber alleine würde ich dann doch lieber andere Beat'em'Ups wählen.

Dieses Spiel bekommt von mir die Wertung:
Ein halbes BlazBlue/10

review: Well, for a start, the price is low, it's cheap, even more on sales. Second, It's quite supported, it has trading cards, has a workshop, controller support. I would say, it is recommended if you like fighting games, honestly it's not that bad. The game itself has quite an outdated graphics yet its still comparable to the kinds of Blazblue and skullgirls and yes its cheaper. It also has trading cards that prices quite high if your aiming for a partial cashback from the cards. What's more is that it has some great profile backrounds so overall, if it's on sale, or if you have the money, buy it. If you want a decent anime-style profile backrounds, buy it and if you're lonely or your crush just got a bf (my current life conflicts), this game helps you a lot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049111597', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 179, 'playtime_forever': 575, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 575, 'last_played': 1448585459}
review:
There are no audio options.  The only (sort of) video option is a command that restores the window to its default size.  Actually, there aren't very many options of any kind.  Those that do exist aren't handled using in-game menus.  They're handle with drop-down menus and sub-windows of the game window.

There's no tutorial, and the closest thing to a practice mode seems to be going into versus mode without second player.  Compounding these issues is a manual that is almost useless.

All-and-all, this feels like another terrible port of a browser game.
