author: {'steamid': '76561197994522515', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1461475782}
review:
Before you read: I am kind of disappointed about this game. So there you go. Now, moving on...

This is a kind of nice 2D fighting game. It is not the best one out there and I decided to get it just because.

Now, after playing it for a while I have to say that I'm pretty disappointed, because I expected more. For $10, you get the game with two extra characters... And that's it. Nothing more. The gameplay feels clunky and some characters feel more powerful and better thought than others.

Game modes:

Story: Really weird, I don't understand anything. And the boss has a freaking difficulty spike that's too hard! Presentation wise, this is not the best.
Versus: Confusing, you cannot see the movelist of the characters anyway, so you'll be finding out how to do stuff.

And that's it. The game is really counter intuitive and it's just not so good...

Except for the animation and art style! Those two are the best assets of this game!

I do recommend this one just to expand the library. Pick it for about $5 (incl. DLC) on Steam Sales (sometimes even less than that), unless you can get a better one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095709421', 'num_games_owned': 533, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1525626581}
review:
Ok, so it's a fighting game where you can control and fight against relatively scantily clad ladies. Now that that is out of the way let's dig into it. 

if you use a 360 controller you may want to remap the buttons more to your liking, since you'll start out with the "b" and "x" 's bound to your b and x. the problem with this is, many super combo/super attacks will take pushing these 2 buttons in unison. 

The sprites are well done, the physics on the sprites are well done (skirt flowing, hair flowing, boob jiggle, it's all there). The system itself (outside of the partners) is little more or less complicated that your average street fighter fare.

The partner system is interesting to say the least. you gain your partner bar as the fight goes on, and once you have a number, you can use certain abilities for said partner. The partner will use different abilities depending on which direction you're holding when you push said partner button, anything from little stuns, to machine guns, to screen filling blasts can be done by partners, some even shield you or some other fun.

The story is generally pretty sparse, you're one of several young ladies, scantily clad or otherwise, trying to figure out what happened during some massive explosion and find either a friend, or a target for your assassination contract, or a relative, any other standard character hook, you them meet someone you knew,know, remembers you, whatever. Then some story is said, and you fight. you then have a few more fights until you get to the boss.... speaking of the boss..

I have one complaint, one HUGE complaint. The boss is outright broken. This fight (and only this fight) is so whacked it's unimaginable. she has way too many invincibility frames and outright immunities ( she was stunned [ as in unable to do anything and having birds above her head] and i used the character i was using's [kaede hioh] super attack, and it activated, she zoomed towards hilde and.... the strike went right through her sprite, doing no damage.  

 Also, if you don't like luck in your fighting games, this boss will not amuse you. she constantly spams, teleports, and it's nearly impossible to get close to her unless luck is on your side. I have beaten her twice so far, and they were both due to complete luck. i know the combinations, i know how they work, i've seen every one of hilde's attacks,  however she spams them so much that unless you teleport yourself, or can manage to go through her nearly infinite blasts, you'll likely not lay a hand on her.  It's like fighting a button masher, her attacks come out of nowhere, have very little build time, and either do an insane number of hits, or a large amount of damage.   best of all is this surprise blast that happens immediatly under you. 

Back to point however. Good sprites, good controls, i'd generally recommend it, the only glaring nightmare is the boss. It at least has a story, and the mechanics are sound, but other than that big boss problem, i recommend it.

EDIT: Secondarily. to people who say " it's not for the single player, this game is there for the multiplayer". In my opinion a game should be able to stand on its own single player, the multi player is extra.

review: Well... where to start. This game is pretty simple, though I myself is personally horrible at arcade fighter games. I can not and I repeat can not do any of the cool combos that were intended. It is smooth overall and all the little technicalities are really fun to play with. Did i forget to mention skirts fly up all the time! Panties are all over the place! that is a plus to some people, though it dosen't particularly matter to me as it is all just eye candy. Though I do believe there is a free version of this game somewhere on the original creator's site. So I suggest you people that plan on getting this game go check that out first instead of buying it.

review:
Excellent graphics and great animations but poor optimization and no online.
I think there's a mod somewhere that you can use to play it online with your friends, but I'm not sure if it really works.
Definitely not worth your time if you're looking for a tournament level game, but it's pretty fun as a casual fighter.

Wait for some bundle or a Steam sale.

PS: Lilith is waifu tier.
PS2: You can see her panties.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054509214', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1594, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1053, 'last_played': 1704256872}
review:
Pros:
+Supports both XInput and DirectX
+Beautiful sprites, smooth animation
+Good music
+Easy to understand mechanics
+Local multiplayer (kind of expected)

Cons:
-No online multiplayer
-4:3 aspect ratio, can't adjust resolution at all
-no command history or replay
-no tutorial (only combo sheet)
- escape/back button doesn't work in some situations (can't escape from match, have to restart the whole game, but it restarts fast)
-Can't separately map XInput and DirectInput inputs

author: {'steamid': '76561198086989448', 'num_games_owned': 802, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1417537554}
review:
Tuve la "suerte" de encontrar el juego por menos de 1€, y aunque no es para nada caro, no lo recomendaría; mucho menos por el precio que tiene normalmente en Steam (4,99€, 3,24€ en rebajas...). Los ataques muy limitados comparados con cualquier juego de lucha, no hay online, y lo único que hace que dure más de 3 minutos el modo historia es que los enemigos son muy difíciles incluso en fácil.
Lo único que puede divertir un poco más es el multijugador para reírse de las escenas gratuitas, por lo demás, podéis ahorraros el dinero.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111716538', 'num_games_owned': 501, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1418456860}
review:
Where to begin... So there isn't much to say about this one but I'll do my best to help the steam FGC on their decision whether or not to buy this game. Lets get to it shall we.

Pros:
*Nice anime style graphic I would go as far to say on par with blazblue or guilty gear
*Good voice acting 

Cons:
*controls are beyond awful! doesn't work with every controller it didnt work with my madcaz sfxt 360 fight pad I had to use xpadder to even play it some what all I can say is good luck

*Resolutions are not adjustable they have a poor full screen mode and a small windowed mode which is really the only way to play it

*Story mode is very confusing and poorly translated and to short 

* Verses mode is very limit and doesn't include a quit to main menu option or select new character option once in a match

*No online mode at all this is the most depressing and mind blowing thing about this game

Conclusion:
This game has no real value and very disappointing.[B] DO NOT BUY THIS IF YOU'RE LOOKING FOR A GOOD FIGHTING GAME! [/B] 

Rating:
2/10 No online bad controls bad resolution over bad  I give it 2 just because the art and voice acting isn't to bad other than that big flop

author: {'steamid': '76561198036820147', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1417522836}
review: Dear creators - please go back to MUGEN while I'll go back to Skullgirls that did a similar game with style. Controls are limited and sticky. AI is horribly paced. At least I bought it on sale and the character graphics aren't that bad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198124916479', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1417243683}
review:
After an hour of playing, I am more than equipped to give my thoughts about this game.

Score: 7.5/10

++Fluid animation
+Variety of characters (plus 2 more if you buy the Lilith DLC. Lilith DLC includes Hilda.)
++Really nice music
+Awesome anime girls (moe and panty shots included)

--Insane learning curve
-Semi-difficult with keyboard alone

+/-Almost all characters share the same combo/Special Move inputs (this could be good/bad depending on your view)

[[ IF YOU PLAY KEYBOARD STYLE LIKE ME, DISABLE THE GAME CONTROLER OPTION VIA GAME MENU AND REBIND KEYS BEFORE DOING ANYTHING ]]

As I'm used to these types of fighting games I mostly saw BlazeBlue in this and thought it was pretty similar. I was right. Technically all 2D fighters are the same, but that's another discussion. For the most part I love it. The anime characters are interesting, but with the amount of anime nowadays, you could probably say they remind you of other series/characters--whether in games or another.

Jumping straight into the Arcade mode is a very big NO. I got my *** kicked so bad and won the first match by button mashing. The second fight was impossible. Not because it was difficult, it's because I didn't know how to play it. By luck I got back to the menu screen and did a complete overhaul of the keybindings through trial and error. I find it works best if you use ASD for Light, Mid, and Heavy attacks respectively. W for Parry, and Q for support. And the Directional Arrows for movement. This works best for me. After 5min of Arcade sessions for practice you can easily learn many of the combos. I learned all the combos for all the fighters so I know how to challenge them with whichever character I choose to play as. (Versus may not have an AI, but it's perfect for learning how to play the game.)

However, the Story mode is still relentless. The difficulty, even knowing how to form combos, was still a little high. The first few matches were easy, but difficulty continues to rise. I haven't beat it yet but I'm sure I will if I sit and focus. Animation wise there's lots of motion. LOTS of motion. Lots of bouncing for each character showing off their assets. Overall it is smooth and seems to flow pretty nicely. The only downside is that you can sometimes see the tiny white pixels around the fighters. They're even noticable in the Character Select screen. This is a small detail I can look over.

As for the Support they added into the game. I honestly don't use them. Only rarely do I do or find them useful. The music on the other hand, now that's something to get into. Just about every track--except for maybe three--I really loved causing my foot to tap while I'm laying down combos. (The Shrine music is my favorite.)

At this point this is all I really have to say. Hopefully, if you read this, will help those that play Keyboard style. I like Game Controllers as well, but PC games MUST be played using the keyboard. At least for me anyways. It adds a difficulty that many people hate, but is oh so satisfying when you show your stuff.

author: {'steamid': '76561198133295572', 'num_games_owned': 406, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1607, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1523, 'last_played': 1572407064}
review:
I have collected all of the trading cards, made a badge, have over a day played, and beaten the game on all dificulties. It is time for a review.
I personally love this game. Saki is my favorite character. Do I recommend this game? Yes, but under certain circumstances. First, let's dive into the true pros and cons of this game. [READ EVERYTHING, INCLUDING MULTIPLAYER]

Pros:
+ Decent fighting system
+ The game runs perfectly fine (Even with WINE)
+ I got it for $1.50 or something like that on Amazon
+ Animations are great
+ Voice acting is good
+ Very fast pace
+Works 90% with Xbox 360 controller (Even through WINE[Still no D-Pad support])

To the cons:
-Little to no story
-Full screen is stretched if you have a widescreen monitor
-Full screen is just default window size and blurry
-Characters such as Lilith keep on spamming a move that will take down your health crazily. (Example: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=immWpTWSCuM )
-The game does not tell you the commands for the support. (It tells you that Y [Xbox Controller] is the way to activate support, but to actually use them properly. It requires you to move the joy stick in certain directions.

Conclusion: I will recommend this game because it is definitely fun. Of course it's not the absolute best fighting game out there, but for $1.50 or ($5.00 on steam) it's not really that bad. In fact it's fun to play. Other review say that it's only good for about two or so hours of gameplay, but if you give yourself challenges such as beating the game on all difficulties, then you will get the most or even more out of your purchase. For those who may understand, this is basically Marvel VS Capcom (the original), but with an anime/Japanese art style.

I didn't include this in the review, but I think people should know about it. You can play multiplayer with Vanguard Princess. I'm not talking about local, I'm talking about online.
If you want to play multiplayer with a friend, (because I could not for the life of me find any servers) then follow this post:
https://steamcommunity.com/app/262150/discussions/0/540744935955723372/?insideModal=1
Now, this explains MOST of what you need to do. But if you want to host your own server for your friends to join, you MUST..
*_ Open port 7500 to TCP and UDP
*_ Now that the port is open, open up MTSP
* In order to host a server for you and your friends, you must get your public IP here: http://www.whatismyip.com/ (Your IP is: ###.###.###.### <-- that long number)
* Once you have copied that number, go back to MTSP
* The Startup window should still be open, click the tab named "Encrypt IP"
* Paste your IP into the Unencrypted IP box and press the button "Encrypt"
* The box below it should have a whole bunch of numbers now
* You need to copy those numbers and go back to the "Select Mode" tab
* If you are making the server for your friends, make sure the current mode is "Server"
* Paste the number you got into the "Server Name" box and press okay [MAKE SURE IT IS STILL ON PORT 7500]
* Now your server is made and your friends can join
_For your friends, they follow the SteamCommunity post, then open port 7500. (I don't have to do TCP and UDP, but have them do it just to be safe)
_Once they open MTSP , they should have that same Startup box
_They need to click on "Client"
_Then they need to put the number the host recieved got earlier (The encrypted thing) into the "Destination IP" box
_[Make sure DNS is off, unless you know what you're doing] and then press OK
_This should result in joining the server. Right click someones name to the left and press challenge to fight them.
You should be set up now for Online vanguard princess. The reason I'm putting this here is because I had to find that community post, and then go through an ancient MTSP post on a Japanese website in order for it to work. (Because the servers are empty and may cause a high ping)
Hope this was helpful!

author: {'steamid': '76561198060616666', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1417177752}
review:
I littleraly broke my controller on this one, and are now in need of a new one.
There was not enough review here that could warn me of the dangers of playing this game.
So before you buy this game, let me tell you as of now.
Have you ever played [b]Tekken[/b], [b]Street Fighter[/b] and/or [b]Mortal Combat[/b] and felt like the bosses were overpowered having everything at their favor?
Well you poor soul, let me tell you right now that this game´s character are just like those last bosses, but the word OVERPOWERED (pardon me for caps) comes from the last boss itself.
The devs took that internet meme [u]Imma firin mah lazer[/u] to the limit, this boss is as if made of lazer shooting down the entire scenario leaving you no place to hide, however you can still defend.
Her companion is a combo of [u]Navi[/u] from [b]The Legend of Zelda[/b] and [u]Gill[/u] from [b]Street Fighter III: Third Strike[/b] being both annoying and overpowered.
Although the game offers easy mode, it in fact goes as the following: [b]Normal Mode[/b], [b]Hard Mode[/b], [b]Insane Mode[/b].
The easy mode its not really [u]easy[/u] per se, you will feel as if the characters got even more aggressive.
So upon playing the game and break more than a controller, here are the pros and cons.


Pros:

- Very addictive
- Interesting fighting mechanics
- Beautiful characters
- Lovely loli Theme
- Unique powers.
- Tradicional Japanese anime voice activing

Cons:
- Terrible Storyline
- No Options
- Hard game
- Difficult controls
- No training session
- Overpowered Characters (especialy the last boss)


i really dont know if i should recommend this, as the game is a bit hard even if using a controller, but beautiful and fun nontheless, so i´ll give a thumbs up for being the first game ever to make me break a controller, also my finger.
I guess i wont be playing games for a while now, still i enjoyed playing this one, and it is an honor having it on my library.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039472141', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 244, 'last_played': 1417207963}
review:
Really good game, but it lacks shit to do. The roster is tiny and there's nothing to do other than the arcard mode. It plays nicely and is very nice to look at, though. I recommend this game to the obvious people who'd enjoy it. This is by no means a gateway experience for people who don't like anime-fanservice, cuteness, or fighting games much. You'd probably come out hating those things more. Fortunately, I love fighting games and cute anime sexploitation.

Wish there were more side-lolis to choose from, I don't really like any of their abilities. The combat could have a bit more depth in the combo system/attack variation for my tastes. The game lacks any resoultion options and pretty much looks like shit at widescreen/expanded. Also there's an error which I'm experiencing that freezes the game when fullscreened. 

Final boss is a mother fucker. 

アニメの美少女とファイティングゲームが好きな人なら、このゲームも好きかもしれない。皆のパンツが見えるからね。。。

author: {'steamid': '76561198063234333', 'num_games_owned': 572, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 233, 'last_played': 1652687391}
review:
Hey now, this game is a rarity with beautiful visuals, fairly original movesets and characters and an average storyline.

The selection of characters is pretty good with little side-kick allies to bolster it further, the sounds are fantastic though the music to me is forgettable. The moves are incredible, simple enought o be able to pull off whilst button mashing but still good enough that you'll be able to put them to good use if you know what you're doing. I honestly found myself just button mashing for a fair while haha. 

You get 2 modes Arcade and VS, it does support DS3 controllers via better DS3 and 360 controllers though you'll have to fiddle with settings a tad to get them managable. The menu sits in a toolbar on the screen window so if you are fullscreen you'll need to hit f4 to access it which can be a pain. For versus, changing stages is also done via the window toolbar which is sloppy but hey, it's not game-breaking.

What can be game-breaking is the game's occasional all-out refusal to accept any input commands resulting in an 'I.T. Crowd' esque, turning it off and on again. There doesn't appear to be any particular trigger for this although so far it's only happened outside of gameplay in the menu and so forth and the mouse is never affected.

I'd easily recommend this game at the price especially for how different it is!
8.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198138967057', 'num_games_owned': 228, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1442941789}
review:
I wouldn't recommend this to someone who's rather new to the 2D Fighting genre since the enemy AI is rather hard for beginners.. The final boss is also hard AF, with all the teleports and laser spams, you can't even get close to her.. I only managed to defeat her once in my 3 hours of playing this game.. (I got this game already before i bought it on Steam.)
The controls itself is rather easy to understand, took me around 1 hour to actually be able to string my own combos..
Also somehow I had more fun playing this game than playing BlazBlue, even though BB is better made and bolsters more fighters, something just sucks me into this game.. Maybe it's because Lilith is literally Minase Iori from the iDOLM@STER? Nyeh, maybe, I'll get to it later..
All in all, IMO, this is a reaaallly well made game.. and considering that this used to be a doujin game, to have made it on Steam is, just wow..
Now, getting to the good and the bad parts of the game..

The Goods:
> Assist system? That's new..
> Pantyshots, nyeeess~
> Graphics are pretty neat.
> Lilith = Minase Iori from the iDOLM@STER (Doll? Check. Shiny Forehead? Check. Headbutt? Check.)
> Hard AI makes the game challenging, but frustrating at the same time..
> I don't get people's review about this game not working with their gamepad. The game is very responsive to my gamepad, controls are smooth.
> Old styled graphics = Good framerate and smooth gameplay~

The Bads:
> No Online Multiplayer.
> No Training mode. (You can just do local VS mode though.)
> Pause screen didn't show combo list, I got around the wiki for the movelist.
> Unbalanced characters. (Lilith too OP, pls nerf.. So this is why they made her into a DLC..)
> AI too hard, pls nerf..
> Too many DLCs, why not buy the original doujin version of the game? One disc, and it got everything except Hilda in it..
> The story of the game is not so clear, unlike BB who mindfuks you with all the time paradox and yadda yadda, the story mode is....... Short on text? maybe.. Yes, I'm the kind of guy who puts the story over graphics..

But despite all the bad things about this game, I would still recommend it.. Why? Because this game is challenging AF.. The hard AI will make you rage, I'm sure, but once you get the hang of this game, there's the sense of accomplishment, and you would want to fully master all the characters in this game..
Also, this is a 2D Fighting game, featuring cute girls, lolis, an idol (oh wait, wrong game てへぺろ~ ) piledrivers, brainbusters, laser spams, and lots and lots of rage quits..
You have been warned......

author: {'steamid': '76561198059553059', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1415959541}

author: {'steamid': '76561198141256226', 'num_games_owned': 328, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214, 'last_played': 1461412882}
review:
这是一款绝对合格的美少女游戏，却是一款完全不合格的格斗游戏
这游戏人设很赞，更是适合hentai来玩，并且配音做得也十分不错，可以卖卡回本，背景很赞

--------------------------------------------------------以下，是这游戏的缺点
操作实在太反人类，无论你是苦逼键盘党，还是手柄党！这游戏的出招和操作都十分不舒服，尤其是键盘！！本来想买了这游戏yooooooooooooooooooo的，结果开开发现不能 全屏还特么不会摁！！！我整个人都不能yooooooooooooooo起来了，这就像是你玩i社的尾行3和人工学园，你玩个h游戏都要费大半天劲过关，简直不能开心的yooooooooooooooooooo了。。。
总而言之，言而总之
本游戏欢迎各类hentai以及不在乎画质和操作的玩家
5/10

review: This game is horrible. The controls are horrible and unintuitive. The storyline is weak, and not very coherent. It is an all girl anime fighting game, I guess that's the only thing this game has going for it. Other than that, absolutely horrible; I would not recommend this game to anyone, if I could get a refund for this I defintely would. Quite possibly one of the worst fighting games I have ever played.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053083938', 'num_games_owned': 417, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1429163605}
review:
TL;DR: If you're looking for a mildly entertaining fighter game with heavy ecchi themes and some pantsu shots to boot, this is your 2-4 hour fix.

First some tips:
1) Don't download the Hilda DLC, you get it with the Lilith DLC.
2) Also this game is hard to play on the keyboard. A controller is really the only way to play effectively.

And the review:
As I said in the TL;DR version, this is a fighting game with a horrible story, some cheap boss moves, a few interesting fight/game mechanics and a tokyo sized dump of pantsu anime waifu ecchi fanservice oppai cleavage showing spectacular. That's pretty much it. There's no online play only local vs mode and an arcade mode that is really linear and with no options to change anything or view anything. Also there's no pause menu, but you can pause and view what the controls are.

Let's see, there's around 10 characters: a loli with a pedo bear, I mean teddy bear, that grapples, a school girl, a sports girl, etc etc etc, and a Tenchi Muyo Ryoko-esq girl with big guns and pistols. wait big oppai and pistols.. oh and she's not wearing any pantsu... So there's that. Also there's a set of 5 sub characters that support your fighter as you fight, which is that interesting game mechanic I mentioned. The artwork is pretty good and the backgrounds are interesting and vary in style from one to the next, so it's nice not playing cookie cutter levels every single level, but this is a 2d fighting game so it's not like you can really enjoy the game's scenery when you're button mashing hard with only one hand on the controller. FYI you can play with two hands, but only if you're a member of /r/nofap.

Seriously though, This game is probably worth 5 bucks if this is your sort of thing and 2-4 hours of gameplay is justifiable to you, otherwise get it on sale, as I've seen it go on sale frequently. And again don't buy the Hilda Rize DLC cause you get that for free in the Lilith DLC, along with 2 more stages and some better songs. Imo the Lillith DLC is barely worth it at 50% off when I got it, but it literally adds almost nothing to the game (except Hilda) so it's purely cosmetic. They could easily add another stage or a campaign mode with a map or something, but as this was an already released game long ago and this is a newer updated version with exxxtra pantsu I will continue to support it. Actually if they made a CP2 wait I mean VP2 then I'd support them as long as they don't cut as many corners as they did here.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962195611', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1686156942}
review:
After about an hour of gameplay I can give an honest first impression. First off while I don't love fighting games I do enjoy them from time to time. So this isn't going to go in depth into mechincs and such. With than said this game is ok. The fighting works, and the graphics bring back old school SNES memories. However this game has 3 huge flaws. 

1) the controls to navigate the menues are TERRIBLE. Nothing is explained, so half the time when I was trying to navigate I would just get thrust into a game.

2) Almost no ingame menu. Instead of an ingame menu it has a top task bar menu in windowed mode. The ingame menu is nothing more than a pause screen with basic controls. Worst is there is no audio menu, so you have to adjust audio through Windows. This is really cruel since this game started at 100% volume. So don't do what I did and look for an ingame audio menu. Just turn it down through Windows.

3) No real tutorial. It has a 2P practice mode, but no AI tutorial mode. The game also doesn't have a move list even in 2P practice. So you'll have to download the manual for the game. This reminds me of games like the original Mortal Kombat, but I've been spoiled by games like Darksiders, and MvC that give me an ingame mvoe list, and full tutorial. The manual is essential since it explains a lot about the game, that isn't in the game.

Again, I would say it's an ok game to bum around in, but don't expect MvC, or Street Fighter levels of production, or features. Also this was my first impression rather than an indepth review of all the features, mechanics, story, etc.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008583489', 'num_games_owned': 373, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1488551978}

author: {'steamid': '76561198040350513', 'num_games_owned': 2000, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1469936775}
review:
A most welcomed game in a time where PC combat/arcade games are much needed. Simplistic in it's nature the game manages to charm it's players with it's character diversity and easy controls. Gamers might find themselves asking the question "How in the world do I cast super moves" in the beginning but will soon find out casting them is a piece of sweet cake that landed on their plate unknowingly. Without a multitude of options in the main menu the player is left to wonder "Where's the rest?" but that awkward sensation vanishes the moment you select one of the two options provided. There is a virtual manual provided by Steam as always for those who want to know everything before they fire up the game but it's as thin as paper and rightfully so considering the fact that the whole game is based on the movement keys, a weak attack, a medium attack, a strong one and a parry. The game leaves a fresh trail of "I want more" in it's wake and delivers on it's promise. If only there was more to it. As an anime fan myself I am left to wonder why exactly is the game so short. Finishing it you soon realise that the only replayability stands with trying the next character and so on so forth until you beat all the enemy characters with each one of the characters available and with the first 5 Free Steam trading cards in your inventory and a little chipping in on the side in the form of 20 and up to 30 pence price per card you soon come to realise that you got your badge and there's nothing left to do. That's not to say that the game hasn't got the X factor as with any other game of this genre, if you got someone to play with all the better. But at this low price I would say it's a must have for any pc gamer than enjoys this type of games. If I had to describe the game in one short sentence that would be:

"It's a well designed, captivating and exciting piece of art for as long as it lasts and well worth the price tag."

author: {'steamid': '76561198081013346', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1447, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1281, 'last_played': 1608933896}
review:
It's an excellent 2D fighting game. The fights went pretty fast and unless you know your character, it's hard to know what you are doing. However, once you mastered the controls of a character, fights became really intense where your reactivity is brought to its limits. Moreover, it's a trully beautiful games, using japanese manga style graphics (which I love). Musics, voices and sounds are also good and manage successfully to instaure a good atmosphere.
I must insist on the fact that it is a hard game, a VERY hard game, and it is really pleasant to see one which can resist you because those games are really rare nowadays. But, this statement is also a drawback as, in hard mode, the final boss is sincerely unbeatable (I only manage to beat him twice in more than 10 hours of playing). This is the main flaw of this game : its final boss is just going to drive you mad. I do not understand the interest of setting a boss like that, because, that character aside, there is really a good balance between the different fighters. But, Hilda, the final Boss, she is definitely broken. Of course the final boss is powerful, but it should not be that much. Fact is she can attack you from distance instantly and without any pause. She can also teleport when engage in hand-to-hand combat. So, I do not know how the IA of character is made, but she will keep spamming lasers and explosions without any delay from the other side of the arena, and if you manage to get close, most of time she will teleport instantly.
Appart from having hulk as a boss, playing Vanguard Princess is very refreashing and amusing. Combos are well thought, and the game has a good lifespan. An excellent game for a small price, I encourage you to buy and play it (I recommend you to play with a joypad because some techniques are very hard to make using keypad only).

8/10 according to me.

PS : if you want to see what the boss is really capable of, buy the DLC ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198056358544', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1607445835}
review:
Веселый, но ужасно легкий файтинг. Хотя смысл этой игры явно не в механике боя. Начну с того, что тут сражаются только девчонки, причем одежды на них не так уж много. Да-да, трусики, танцующие груди и прочие элементы фансервиса (кстати, весьма хорошо нарисованные) налицо. Играть весело, процесс нисколько не напрягает, можете любоваться героинями, не заморачиваясь насчет победы в бою - жмите все подряд и будет вам счастье)

А теперь, собственно, плюсы и минусы этой игры:

+ Хорошие графика и звук
+ Фансервис (лично мне он нравится)
+ Графика в стиле аниме (обожаю рисованную графику)
+ Да и вообще, люблю японские файтинги)
- Слишком уж легко (я хоть баттонмэшер тот еще, но все же предпочитаю чтобы победа доставалась именно в бою, а не в избиении младенца)
- Почти полное отсутствие комбо-системы (поэтому я предпочитаю Skullgirls, Melty Blood и Blazblue)

Итог:

Рекомендую эту игру поклонникам анимешной графики, эччи, няшных девчонок, а также тем, у кого не хватает навыков для игры в те же Blazblue или Skullgirls. Моя оценка 8/10, ибо весело, заманчиво, но ОЧЕНЬ легко.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091730319', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1464, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1321, 'last_played': 1457200985}

author: {'steamid': '76561197973938427', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1412190540}
review:
Ok I decided to get this game out of sheer curiosity and the fact that there was good reviews for a game with such a low price. The game is definitly targeted towards those are interested in this style of anime, but put that aside (not to mention you practically get to see some of the characters private parts, or their under garments.) this game honestly was fun. 

The controls are easy to figure out, the only thing obviously is even on easy mode you have to have really good reflexes. But instead of getting pissed off I'm actually happy that even against the computer players that the fights make me feel "you know what, that was actually really fun." You can choose between a few side characters that will help you (and theres a button for that, they're like a mini assist) and the final boss is actually pretty challenging which makes the vibe of the game much better. Other than that, game is easy to figure out, I'm convinced this game probably came from a website but...it was well worth it. Honestly even if you wanna have this game on your list for shits and giggles the game is worth the $5 if you have nothing better to do or if this game is something you wanna spend the whole afternoon doing. 

Only downgrade I'd say is the music...honestly this is more of a personal view but I can't really get into a fighting game with this kind of music, I know it's a Japanese Anime game but I'd personally put the type of music you'd listen to working out, driving fast like an idiot or whatever gets your "kick-ass" mojo going on your mp3 (or cd player for you old timers) and listen to that instead of the music in the game while playing it. It makes it much much better. It's not like the "storyline" (that I just pass anyway) is in text or that important anyway. (and I can say that's probably me personally...but the story is the standard "I must get stronger" crap that most anime's do.)

author: {'steamid': '76561197999295351', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1412036453}
review:
This is the first review i've ever felt compelled to write for a game on Steam.

The store page claims this game has full controller support. It does not. Even the controller native to the operating system i use (you know the one) does not work with this game. When i start the game, i can only move the cursor to choose between one of two game modes one time, then i cannot move it again. Once i choose a mode, the character select cursor continually moves down. Using the controller stops the down movement, until i let go of it. Then it moves down some more. If i happen to actually be able to choose a fighter i wish to play, she just crouches on the stage and doesn't really fight, so much as crouch a whole lot, and get punched and kicked and things like that.

I tried changing the controller configuration, but the direction pad buttons, you know, the ones you use to move a character? They're greyed out. so i can't actually configure them, despite the settings options being there specifically to configure them.

So how is the actual game? I don't know. I can't play it. See the other, longer paragraphs to learn why.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094085764', 'num_games_owned': 777, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1418484489}
review:
Игра очень... неоднозначна. любителям фансервиса она точно понравится из-за обилия панцушотов, лолей и прочей хрени. Комбо в игре присутствует, но не так много, как хотелось бы. К тому же, на них тратится отдельная полоска энергии, которая уж очень медленно восстанавливается. Достаточно интересна система 2x2 - "саппорт", второй персонаж, может помочь вам с заднего плана, например, скинув на противника ТАЗ. Геймплей же страдает - иногда создается ощущение, что управляешь не девочкой, а танком. Система боя хуже, чем даже в первом Melty Blood. Эти недостатки сильно перекрывают все достоинства игры, если бы не одно но: дико дорогие карточки. Они по стоимости от 10-12 рублей (обычные) и заканчивая 200 рублями (металлические).
Я считаю, что все-таки стоит купить и опробовать, особенно если игра на распродаже. Карточками она окупит себя сполна, и, быть может, даже доставит вам удовольствие.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025834191', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 228, 'playtime_forever': 209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 209, 'last_played': 1419410893}
review: Vanguard Princess is a single player 2D fighter with easy to learn combos and an "interesting" cast of characters. It is a 2v2 style fighter in that you select a primary fighter and an assisting fighter, the majority of combinations are tied to the primary fighter with the secondary being controlled through a button bind which acts in the same manner as one of your attacks (weak/heavy, punch/kick etc.). This design element adds great value and unique gameplay as you can mix and match primary fighters with assist fighters to a variety of effects and combo potentials. The game does feel cheap by certain design choices (character/UI/mode wise), but considering it is an indie project with a very small development the value is outstanding albeit odd for this game as it offers quality graphics, balance and gameplay. Recommended for fighting game fans if you can get past the design choices.

review:
嗯。。。后悔买了
这游戏现在给我的唯一价值就是能挂卡卖出去回本
本来以为Steam上卖的游戏应该能达到和Skullgirls这个差不多的水准吧（那个很有意思啊）
没想到是一个未完成的同人社团卖肉格斗

一样是同人社团绯想天则这个系列上不来，反倒这个上来了，游戏性还不怎么样
Valve你节操是不是掉了，你得明白游戏归游戏，二次元萌系要靠边站，一码归一码要分清

author: {'steamid': '76561198043079819', 'num_games_owned': 377, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 288, 'last_played': 1590501909}
review:
Игра, конечно, хороша и стилистикой, и динамикой, но за паршивое управление разработчикам бы руки оторвал, и настучал этими руками по им морде! 
Это чтобы выполнить какой нибудь приём, это надо вертеть левый стик кругами! Почему нельзя было сделать комбо удары и приёмы как в МК?!

Большинство жалуются на плохое управление с клавиатуры и рекомендуют геймпад.
БРЕХНЯ!!! ИГРАЛ НА ГЕЙМПАДЕ X-BOX360!!!

Вечно у японцев с управлением полная "Ж"! (У Capcom и Tecmo с этим всё ОК)

Игра быстро наскучивает. В "Guilty Gear XX" и в "Tekken" я и то дольше рубал, и больше удовольствия от игры получал. Нежели тут - кроме как ненависти и злости к AI, и к управлению небыло.

Касательно музыкального сопровождения - это ещё один фактор придающий уныние к игре. 
Под подобную музыку не хочется играть в файтинг, а хочется выключить свет и идти спать! 
Я не хочу сказать, что музыка плоха. Просто такая музыка категорически не подходит динамичному файтингу! Она напрочь убивает весь эффект динамики игры!

Персонажей мало... Очень мало! И не говорите мне мол "ПЕРСОНАЙ МНОГО НЕ НАДО! ТАМ ТРИ РЕЖИМА СЛОЖНОСТИ! НИЧЕГО ТЫ НЕ ПОНИМАЕШЬ!"  и т.д.
Пройдя на НОРМАЛЬНОМ режиме, с чертовски кривым упралением и кривыми special командами (!) , уже на СЛОЖНОМ играть не шибко-то и хочется.

+Динамичные бои
+Прорисовка

-Музыка убивающая динамику игры
-Кривые управление и special command
-Мало персонажей
-Игра быстро надоедает

(4 из 10)

author: {'steamid': '76561198032072517', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1423339125}
review:
It has been said that there is a fine line between challenge and frustration.  Vanguard Princess does not have a fine line - it is purely frustration.

For starters, there is no training/practice mode.  So unless you are a rabid hardcore fighting game nerd, the fighting is trial by fire (and in a very unrerwarding way).  The controls leave much to be desired as they are not as tight as I would like them to be - but sometimes you can work it (if the game feels generous).  I am still trying to figure out where the "solid" gameplay the promo mentioned is.

Lastly, any of the fun you might have playing Vanguard Princess will evapourate as soon as you reach the end boss.  Hilda Rize is so insanely OP she can easly destroy 1/3 of your health with a single attack.  Her favourite tactic is to simply throw/knock you  to the other side of the screen and use overblown AoE attacks to annihilate you as you try to get close enough to her to hit her (this must be the "global hit" the promo referred to).  Of course, these attacks will knock you back to the opposite end of the screen each time they connect.  So you need to get close to her when the "announcer" is saying "Ready, Go!" if you want to avoid Hilda scoring a "Perfect" on you.

Don't bother with this game - it may only cost $5 but there are MUCH better fighters out there to choose from.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050515803', 'num_games_owned': 1392, 'num_reviews': 374, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1450356458}
review: 这完全就是一款gba画质的手机游戏，全程只需要按w和d就行了，而且游戏的贴图在窗口最大化的时候非常的粗糙，可以说是完全无法忍受了。这样的游戏质量和游戏体验，即使买了两款dlc之后，也只是加了一个背景音乐和几个人物，本质上还是没有任何突破。

author: {'steamid': '76561198151671626', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 787, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 780, 'last_played': 1409956409}
review:
You'll notice that I don't have many games in my account, this is because there was no way I was going to play this where my friends would see it, so I made a new account where I could quietly appreciate it's .. vibrant .. visuals.. 

So firstly some technical stuff, this game does have controller support but will only recognise movement input from the left analouge stick, which isn't ideal for fighting games but still perfectly useable. For hardcore D-pad enthusiasts there are several guides on the Community Hub on how to configure an Xbox D-pad, PS3 controller or fightstick to work with the game, which requires the use of third party programmes so I didn't bother with it.

With only two modes, a story mode and a VS mode that can double up as a practice mode, this game is pretty light on content.. but is also light on your wallet so take that how you will. Ten fighters and five support characters gives a pretty well rounded roster, with some characters such as Luna (AKA Boobs McPistols) standing out as having a pretty unique playstyle not seen in many fighters. My main entertainment from this game came from trying out each character and support combinations and then putting them to the test in the story mode, however the lack of an in-game online mode means that you won't be trying out your combinations against particularly intelligent opponents. 

It should also be noted that this game was originally freeware, and can be downloaded for free in a very similar state to the steam version albeit in Japanese and not the English translation that you get from purchasing it. I would recommend trying it out for free before purchasing it. http://www.g4g.it/2012/11/30/vanguard-princess-v1-08-english-version/ (pretty sure this link works ...) 

My verdict: 
 
Would I show this game to my family and friends? No.
Does this game explain itself very well? No.
Will you suddenly realise that making these cute, fictional girls fight is cruel and sit there contemplating the complexites of idle animations? Maybe. 

But I still think that this game is an enjoyable and well animated fighting game for the price, especially considering it was all made by one guy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068147954', 'num_games_owned': 249, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1470539295}

author: {'steamid': '76561198039066446', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1409255750}
review:
Oh dear god what a janky mess.

An alpha at best with so much polish in the wrong places.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988560627', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 204, 'last_played': 1456769904}
review:
Definitely not recommended for newbies or low-level fighting game players (which I am). The game difficulty is unbalanced, but you get the strategies for each character against each enemy pretty easily.
But that goddamn final boss will drive you mad. I started with the soldier girl wearing an armor and crosses everywhere, beat the boss in no time by spamming specials. Then, I used (and am actually still using) that girl with the sword... and it just takes a crazy amount of skills. Even in easy mode.
You will get your face spammed with lasers, more lasers, again more lasers, and when you finally manage to get close, the boss' support characters will come in and push you back away.

Also, no arcade stick support (had to use Xpadder), resolution can't be set and fullscreen keeps the window bar.

review: Tem 2 versões. A "Steam" e a "Director's Cut". A segunda é a versão planejada do jogo. A primeira é "Family". Otimo jogo de luta, personagens carismáticas e divertidas. História interessante. Use sempre o game pad e nenhum combo faltará! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198010014422', 'num_games_owned': 3022, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1408673055}
review:
The Good:
-Solid mechanics that make this a better fighting game than most.
-Nice pixel animation.
-Diverse character playstyles that make everyone in the cast feel unique.

The Bad:
-Worst control options ever  means you'll plug in a controller rather than trying to figure out how to get your arcade stick to work right.
-Very few modes.
-No screen resolution options means you're playing this in whatever aspect ratio the game decides for you. And it will be low.

The Huh?:
-Busties
-Underooroos
-Character designs are par with the highest quality fan service animes available. You decide if this is good or bad.
-Card support allows you to show the world how shameless you are about putting these things on your public profile.

Rating:  Bursting with personality / 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029143063', 'num_games_owned': 1039, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1408461896}
review:
I swear, this game was part of a bundle. Honestly! I totally didn't buy this.

Joking aside, there's no doubt in my mind why people buy this pile of steaming gizzards. As has been said time and time again. Sex sells. And scantily clad women is just about all this game has. The art is nothing to write home about, it seems like it was cobbled together very quickly, the controls are atrocious (after you figure out you can't play with a keyboard and mouse), and hell, there was a typo before you even get to the main menu. 

If you like the idea of a fighting game with boobs, just go play dead or alive. 

I'm ashamed I've played this game, and I'm even more ashamed that I have over an hour on it. Gotta get those trading cards.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115018661', 'num_games_owned': 528, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1408163895}
review:
Fangen wir mit den Positiven an. Es hat wenig Tastenbelegung und ist einfach zu Steuern es ist ein reines "Haudrauf Spiel" und es hat für die Männer eine sehr interesante Physik und Schwerkraft bestimmter Gliedmaßen. Nun zu ein paar negativen Punkten. Die Auflösungsgröße ist wirklich minimal und natürich umso größer man das Fenster zieht umso schlechter wird die Grafik aber das ist ja in dem zusammenhang auch Logisch. Die Steuerung ist nicht wirklich schwer allerdings muss man sich da erstmal mit auseinander setzten um es tatsächlich spielen zu können. Ich finde auch schade das es keinen Online Koop hat das würde das Spiel meines erachtens nach noch aufwerten. Im moment hat es leider nur viele junge halb nackte Anime Charaktere die ich fast schon Hentai nennen wollen würde aber naja. Also ich würde sagen es ist mehr was fürs Auge als zu richtigen Spielen.

Grafik: 7/10
Sound: 3/10
Gameplay: 4/10
Story: 1/10
Schwierigkeitsgrad: 5/10
Atomsphäre: 2/10
Humor: 2/10
Spaß: 4/10
Wiederspielwert: 3/10
Multiplayer: -

Gesamt: 3,4/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198067594146', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1519505126}
review:
A good game with worst  menu and pad support i've ever seen.
To preserve the framerate DON'T use the full screen and don't use the borderless app: on my dual quad xeon, 24 gb ram, ssd extreme with gtx 680 4gb, the only choice to run smoothly this game is:
hook the window at the top (windows 8.1)
set the monitor to 4: 3 
disable the pad from the options 
use JoyToKeyto map the keyboard on the 360 pad

Have fun!

P.S. F12 key seems don't works here, probably for the presence of direct play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066952174', 'num_games_owned': 501, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 83, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1557332463}

author: {'steamid': '76561198013488169', 'num_games_owned': 423, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1407922511}
review: Rough game. Couldn't get my XBox 360 PC controller to work so I had to dig up one of my ancient logitech controllers to play the game. Keyboard controlls are available but I would not reccomend them. No training mode or tutorial that is easily accesible. Have to go into versus and push some button on the 2nd player controller to activate it or something along those lines. Couldn't actually do it myself. Game is hard to follow with the supports staying on the screen right beside or inside your character at all times. Seems that every character has the exact same control set up which means having your basic combos be Z techs which are impossible with the keyboard. Menu is very basic. This game definitely needs more work. If it was just a beta it'd be okay but there is a lot that this game seems to lack.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026440232', 'num_games_owned': 558, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1455865327}
review:
Mi Calificacion acerca de este juego seria 8/10 

~Buena Jugabilidad
~Combos que tienes que inventar
~Gran Diseño del juego

Este juego es algo corto, con no tantos Personajes pero en si tiene una gran jugabilidad Aunque solo tiene pocos Movimientos, la imaginacion es tu mejor amiga para poder realizar un buen combo.

En si el juego esta muy bien diseñado en cuanto a historia y personajes y efectos, es algo complicado manejar los personajes pero entretenido al momento en lo especial me gusta mucho practicar para lograr realizar algo, Y cada personaje tiene su propio esitlo de pelea usando diferentes tipos de movimientos y armas ademas de tener una "LOLI" Como ayudante que realmente es de ayuda.

El juego mas que nada yo lo veo para pasar el rato , ami me gusta jugarlo cuando tengo tiempo libre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078164689', 'num_games_owned': 314, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1405666634}
review:
Okay alors commençons par le commencement. Ce jeu promet beaucoup de choses quant à son contenu. Notons d'abord une compatibilité mannette aléatoire voire inactive selon les pc. Ensuite vous avez un pc pouvant faire marcher watch dogs ou autres jeu next gen à fond. Ne vous réjouissez pas trop vite. Car le jeu pour un problème d'optimisation bug sur certains pc et pas d'autres. 
Ensuite si vous avez e bonheur que je le jeu marche, un mode practice est disponible... En allant chercher comment le trouver sur internet ! De plus si votre mannette marche, je vous souhaite bon courage pour comprendre comment sortir un combot. 
Pour tout vous dire : soit le jeu va marcher, vous allez être fan et tant mieux pour vous, soit rien ne marchera, ça laggera et le jeu sera une purge de plus dans votre bibliothèque steam.
Mais lorsque j'ai voulu chercher un peu plus sur le jeu, j'ai découvert que des versions freewares du jeu existait, avec plus de features que le jeu payant lui même. Ici on nous propose un dlc payant pour un personnage. Pas grand chose me diriez vous. Un possible netplay, a 10 000 $ de kickstarter échoué. Est ce que là on se fouterait pas un peu de notre tronche. 
De plus le netplay existe sur les freewares....
Honnêtement vous voulez du kawai et des boobs sur un style manga/comics. Gardez vos sous pour skullgirls qui lui mérite vraiment qu'on y joue et les sous dépensés.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043661139', 'num_games_owned': 519, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1406339802}
review:
4/10
I bought a code for this game from a trader for 50 cents, the game fails to teach you how to play in a constructive way it's really just a bad excuse for another ecchi fighting game but in saying that it does control well and the combos are actually do able on a key board.
The main menus also shit so theirs that.
End boss is also impossible even on easy x.x Like you can't even get near her.
If you really want an ecchi fighting game spend your money on something like skull girls that at least trys to be a fighting game rather than an ecchi.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087979217', 'num_games_owned': 207, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1405832631}
review:
It took me a while to realize the bugs that plagued this game. Originally, a freeware game, this game remained very similar to  the freeware version. First off, there is a compatibility issue with Windows 8. Any system with Windows 8 or newer cannot launch the game in full screen mode without the resolution messing up. Adjusting the settings and Windows compatibility mode does not resolve the problem.

In addition, the story for this game has no plot devices. Compared to other 2D fighters, it failed in all aspects. With a cluttered UI, unorganized story mode, and confusing versus mode, the game is a disaster. The only appeal it has is the girls and the "kawaii" theme. However, this appeal is also lacking too. Until Vanguard Princess gets a major overhaul, steer clear of this game.

Rating: 0.5/10 (5%)
No Achievements
Game Done.

review:

I am using a laptop and seem to do fine mostly in VS mode but when it comes to doing Story mode I just seem to stand there and not be able to move..

author: {'steamid': '76561198018927788', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 385, 'playtime_forever': 717, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 491, 'last_played': 1707477405}
review: Allora questo non è affatto un gioco per casualoni. Si tratta di un gioco che si rivolge come me ai fan della vecchia SNK quindi parlo di KOF 94 e Fatal Fury 3 (con cui ho iniziato a giocare in sala giochi). L'eccessiviva difficoltà (provai un'esperienza simile per Rage of Dragons in Sala Giochi) e la mancanza di un trainning mode può scoraggiare. Ma non fermatevi alle apparenze, giocateci con calma in locale con gli amici e imparate pregi e vantaggi dei personaggi. C'è chi è più forte in attacco, chi è presaro (come la ragazza con l'orsacchiotto) oppure chi va giocato da lontano (la tettona mio main assieme alla sua rivale ninja, tra l'altro pressa l'avversario da vicino come il miglior Fei Long). Che dire? Non perdete la pazienza e imparate. Non ve ne pentirete.

review:
It´s a fighting game consisting in battle with 1 VS 1 but with the help of other support character.

The fighters are anime appeals (all of them girls) 
Everyone single one has their own moves and types of attack.

In the first time. For sure you need to change the keyboard controls on the option menu because they are really uncomfortable to play with.

There are 10 fighters (plus one of a "DLC") with 4 support characters 

And a free dlc of fanservice xd

The good:

Gamepad allowed +

The challenge is there +

It´s make it´s objective of being fun +

Original japanase voices +

The bad:

No online -

Very fews game modes (the story mode and a versus against other human player) -

It´s not windowed completely -

review:
I'm not even going to describe the gameplay.  I'm not going to describe the visual.  There's one thing you need to know about this game:

The move lists in-game use A, B, X, and Y.  The diagram showing the controls shows what appears to be a ps2 controller with "strong", "normal", "weak", "assist" and "reflect".

I don't like calling people stupid, but I think that interface demands it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041543513', 'num_games_owned': 761, 'num_reviews': 213, 'playtime_forever': 198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1409643365}
review:
If you like fighting games, anime, ecchi (entirely female character selection), then you will really like this game.

Be advised, using a controller is highly recommended, as the keyboard controls may not be very responsive or convenient (still possibe, but can be a pain and changing the key bindings is not well supported).

The music and aesthetics are very good, the character models are well-detailed and the developers made sure the bounce/boing factor was working properly during combat. 

When playing single player, the combos for each character are displayed before battle, and there is a pause menu that brings up the controls display. There is an option to play local multiplayer (again, controllers recommended), and you can alternate between versus and practice mode (infinite health) at will; however, time will still tick down to 0. 

The game and AI can be fairly challenging (the boss is very difficult if you do not know your combos and button mash), however, the learning curve is reasonable if you are used to fighting games and/or persist through the game.

There are support characters, and you have a gauge for your special attacks and support options. You can use your support characters to harass your enemy or even inflict brutal combos on them. 

The combat is very fleshed out despite having a limited skill/combo list for each character (you can still string together many cool-looking combinations). There is a fun parry mechanic that allows you to ignore attacks and counterattacck or retreat. One of the best feelings in the game is successfully parrying an oppent's special (like the Street Fighter tournament where one person successfully advance-guarded Chun-Li's combo special to take no damage, if you've seen the video).

Although the character selection is small, each character is very unique in their skill sets and specialties. For example, there is a fighter who excels in grappling, and another who wields guns and can chain together devastating long/short-ranged combos (she starts with a fixed number of bullets, and must reload once she runs out - leaving herself temporarily vulnerable).

I would definitely recommend this game for people into fighters and/or anime.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089514700', 'num_games_owned': 1033, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 146, 'last_played': 1405077163}
review: No interest,just 4 the cards,and I've got an extra pack!Who's with me?

author: {'steamid': '76561198003866738', 'num_games_owned': 371, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 370, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1604207106}
review:
A fun and simple little Doujin (japanese fan created) fighting game. The game has fun solid mechanics and impresive sprite work, despite the limited animation it looks really good in motion. as a huge fighing game and anime enthusiast I would recoment this to people who like those two things, if you dont like anime, you will probably be turned off, and even if you do like anime this game has a huge loli presence and that could turn you off as well. the only complaints I have are the same as everyone elses, no resolution options, and gamepad support is virtually nonexistant, If you plug an Xinput/Direct Input pad it'll work but just the sticks, the Dpad does nothing, which is a massive flaw holding back an otherwise good fighter. 

Despite that I still have to give this game a recommendation.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971399102', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1404831022}
review: I expected better, much better, sure the engine is old but sometimes the older stuff is best, well sadly not here, this game is just broken. picked it up cheap on the steam sale and after finally getting it full screen yet still low resolution (the game has no video settings at all) I plugged in my controller to start kicking butt, no idea who any of the characters are so just picked a couple at random, it gives snippets here and there about them but thats it...using a game pad I quickly found the controls dont work properly, often sluggish to respond and combos did not seem to work as intended so I resorted to the age old button mashing technique lol, keyboard is...well who uses TFHB for movement controls?? rebindable yes so i highly suggest you rebind keys before trying to play the game. with no video options the game will full screen or window and look terrible on a high end machine, the interface feels like it was thrown together and overall VP is more like the kind of game you download for free from a fansite not buy on steam. Honestly though its pretty cheap so dont expect much but if you want a good anime style 2D fighter get skullgirls instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082983415', 'num_games_owned': 276, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 104353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3947, 'last_played': 1657727748}
review: 全力推荐........萌哒哒的妹子满屏幕打来打去.....手感很不错....比拳皇略简单....可以迅速上手..不过需要吐槽的是设计键位的那位，您是左撇子么?分辨率略低差评，没有中文差评(但是不要中文配音TAT）撇掉这两点之外，其他的很吸引人......调整键位之后和好闺蜜玩了一会.....完全把持不住(?)还有设计出来的辅助也很萌....突然想起来了，为毛选择人物的图标是像素类型的啊?萌一点，三头身不好吗?

author: {'steamid': '76561198021049939', 'num_games_owned': 916, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1419992678}
review:
Let me start by saying that if you are into fighting games and cute anime girls this will likely be up your alley and this is a well done in terms of a fighting game (so long as you know what you are doing.)

That being said this is why I would not recommend this as of right now (I am hoping some patches will come down the line that will allow these issues to be fixed) 

*First off, the game will literally have only two options if you are not checking the window options (This can be bad seeing that it has a full screen though you will not likely use this and I'll explain why later) Those being arcade and VS. IF you accidently choose arcade there is no back button. You WILL have to choose a character start it up then restart the game or restart it by closing it and re-opening it. There is an opening cut scene and it does respond to every input so mashing the controlls to either reset or skip the intro is like saying yes if it gets to the choosing screen. (ALMOST EVERY BUTTON IS LIKE CHOOSING YES). If you are wanting to train however, you will likely be having to look up a guide because there is no quick way to get to it and you will have to be using a second player remote regardless. Also if you want to change anything because even if you do activate practice mode, it will have a timer for some ungodly reason.. You will have to go up to tab on the window to fix the timer. Also prior to going into a VS match (the only way you can get practice mode) You will not see your characters move sheet and nor will you see it going into the game. You will literally have to either write it down or have another window open to try and deal with this. (Sorry if that comes off as lazy but I havn't dealt with this kind of stuff in a game I paid for since the super nintendo era...)

*Second off the game does say it has full controller support. This is half true, if you are like me you may be using a xbox 360 wireless controller to try and play this. First off the remote will work, however you better be good with your d-pad otherwise you will likely have to find a program to fix this issue (there is a guide recommending a program that will cost $9.99 unless you plan on getting it another way) Also if you have a second xbox 360 controller... TOO BAD! The second controller won't. For some reason the game always picks it up as the second. This might be due to my Nostromo pad but if I leave that unplugged while starting up the game it will cause the xbox remote not work at all.(Second controller thing might just be me but the fact I am dealing with this means that certain drivers will ruin the game. I have many other games that do not like nostromo but usually unplugging it fixes it. This one doesn't like it at all.)

*Third the game will easily begin breaking and or crashing under any stress. This means if you plan on checking out the costumes or want to skip cutscenes you will quickly learn not to. Also if you try to place it in full window mode it will begin to flicker (at least with me this does) And it's not something that is fun for the eyes. It's fine if this was in beta but.. it looks like this has been released for a few months with dlc. 

I would much rather prefer to recommend this than to give it a bad review but... well the game needs so much needed love and I'll just leave it at that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087020268', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 177, 'last_played': 1404575516}
review:
전 캡콤 직원 스게노 토모아키가 퇴사 후 혼자서 3년 반동안 제작하고
무료 배포한 미소녀 격투 게임.

개인 제작 게임치곤 훌륭하다고 볼 수 있으나 캐릭터 밸런스가 불균형하고
멀티 플레이 미지원으로 뱅가드 프린세스 팬이 아닌 이상 손에 잡히지 않는 게임.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063789357', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 245, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1526012782}
review:
If you enjoy anime and all things japanese then you will most likely ernjoy this game, if you don't then probably not. It is a fairly polished game with a pretty loose story but who plays fighters for the story anyway! 

The combat is pretty strong and feels satisfying however it is a bit difficult to understand at first and trying to pull of special moves is extremely hard. I have only succeded in using an ultimate 1 time I think. But dont let this put you off as when you do succeed it feels even better!

I would massivley advise using a controller because the game becomes undecipherable with the keyboard as there is no tutorial or control menu. 

One massive pro for this game is the soundtrack. All of the stages have great music that fits in perfectly to the game. I would happily buy the ost on its own.

Overall this game is very fun and definitley worth the asking price. As I said before if you are a fan of anime this game is for you, even if it is just for the gorgeous visuals (if you know what i mean).

author: {'steamid': '76561198007550860', 'num_games_owned': 517, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1403885346}
review:
So you're wondering if this game is for you. Well are looking to pass a few hours? Are you fan of old school fighting games? Anime Girls? Moe, Moe? Well you found the right game. 

[b]The Good[/b]
I purchased this game as a part of an indie bundle with no prior knowledge of the title, but as a veteran fighting game enthusiast, I was pleasantly surprised to find a fighter within the bunch. It's rather casual in terms with most AAA fighting games, but has plenty of charm. It's easy to pick up if you have experience with fighting games. The characters are well designed and have a total of about 6-8 moves, with usually 1-2 being special moves. On top of your main character you choose a small assistant to fight alongside you simultaneously.

The inputs for the skills give you enough wiggle room that you won’t have issues preforming skills, even with a keyboard (though a gamepad is always recommended). The attacks are flashy and fluid for most characters, so combos are never problematic. The ultimate/special skills build quickly and most have small, but cool cut-scenes, but don’t worry, they don’t take ages to finish. 

[b]The Bad[/b]
The stages are nothing spectacular, but fit the theme well. Same can be said with the music.
 
The game’s largest flaw is its absolutely horrid UI. Most of the game options are outside the actual game have to be changed through a windows menu at the title and the lack of game modes (single player/ local vs) and unlockables means you probably won’t get much in terms of replayablility. Most players are probably going to get 2-6 hours most from this game, still it was a nice random pickup from an indie bundle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198109196832', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 571, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 130, 'last_played': 1476650869}
review:
un exelente juego muy recomendado en lo personal soy muy fan de los juegos  fighter y este no es la exepcion sus personajes estilo anime de muy buena calidad en las animaciones ay una gran variedad de combos pos su sistema de asistendes de los cuales puedes salecionar 5 diferentes aciendo un buen complemento para tener un sin fin de conbinaciones de movimientos  para ganar 

lo unico negativo de este juego es que no tiene un modo online lo cual en estos tiempos no se puede vivir  si un modo donde puedes probar tus habilidades contra otros jugadores 

pero en general es un juego que recomiendo ampliamente, felizidades a los creadores de VANGUARD PRINCESS por darnos un juegos muy bueno a un exelente precio.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963105770', 'num_games_owned': 1238, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 640, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 622, 'last_played': 1540069587}
review:
I mean, I'm a sucker for fighting games, and some people say that the dev doesn't get money if you buy this version of the game because there's been a lot of wishy washy didgy dodgy communication.

However it is 100% wrong when people say this version of the game is censored, the pixel jiggle is real but it's a free DLC on the store page that you need to install to get all the jiggle frames the "true full version" of the game has.


Besides that it's kind of tricky and you probably don't want to get this game if you're not serious about fighting games. If you are serious about fighting games then you need someone who will run local sets with you because there's no online. So I mean, I bought it, but I'm a fighting fanatic, if you are a fighting fanatic then maybe you should buy this game.

review: 这个游戏感觉有点无脑，我只要←↓→重轻拳有节奏的拍打，就能完虐所有boss。打最后一个boss感觉拍打的节奏不对就可以略用战术了，一开始冲刺打他一套，然后拖时间，不要让他太近身，因为他会破防搞你，这样可以拖时间赢。这样是不是太猥琐。其实我是一套打她个僵直，然后连死的，我就是有节奏的拍打而已。

author: {'steamid': '76561198048610420', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1524572758}
review:
Vanguard Princess

เกมแนวต่อสู้ 2D ภาพน่ารักมากๆ ชื่อเกมก็บอกอยู่ว่า Princess เพราะงั้นไม่มีตัวผู้แน่นอน อารมณ์คล้ายๆ Steel Fighter นั่นแหล่ะ
ส่วนตัวรู้สึกเกมมันกดใช้ท่ายากไปหน่อย บอกตรงๆ ว่าผมเล่นจบไป 2 โหมดละ Easy Normal ผมยังไม่รู้เลยว่าท่าไม้ตายมันกดยังไง
ก็เลยเล่นแบบตามมีตามเกิด

ดูมันบอกวิธีกดมาก็งงๆ หรือผมโง่เองก็ไม่รู้ ในเรื่อง Gameplay ทำออกมาได้ลื่นไหลดี ตัวละครมีอยู่ 10 ตัว แล้วก็มีผู้ช่วยให้เลือกใช้อีก 5-6 คน
มีโหมดเล่น 2 คน แต่เป็นแบบ Local นะ ไม่ใช่ Local Online (Local ก็ประมาณว่า เล่นคอมเครื่องเดียวกัน เอาจอยมาต่อ 2 อัน อ่ะ ส่วน Local Online คือ เราสร้างห้องเอง แล้วให้คนอื่นเข้ามาจอย แต่เกมนี้ไม่มี)

โดยรวมแล้วสนุกดีครับ มี DLC Director's Cut ให้โหลดฟรี สำหรับคนมีเกมนี้ในสตรีมด้วย เห็นบรรยายว่า 

Vanguard Princess Director's Cut features uncensored DLC demanded by longtime Vanguard Princess fans. Play Vanguard Princess is it was originally intended. Recommended for mature audiences.

อะไรไม่รู้ละ ผมอ่านแค่คำว่า uncensored พอ พอลงไปแล้ว ไม่เห็นมีอะไรแตกต่างเลยอ่ะ แค่หน้าเมนูเปลี่ยน ตัวละครไม่ได้ถอดเสื้อ ถอดกางเกงสักหน่อย จะ  uncensored  เพื่อ...? หรือผมโดนหลอกหว่า?

6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198014926595', 'num_games_owned': 775, 'num_reviews': 967, 'playtime_forever': 2509, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2471, 'last_played': 1429756652}
review:
EDIT:  Okay, I normally don't re-review, but I feel I may've been too hasty on this one.


Nice artwork.  Cute Characters.   Needs a LOT of refining.

I really enjoy playing as Ayane and Luna, though.

Difficulty is too high even on Easy. (Depending on your characters and skill level.)
No Training/Tutorial mode.  (Learn the controls and learn to succeed)
No online multiplayer.
No Vs. Bot matches (except for story)
Poor story
Difficult to play via keyboard.   (Probably easier via controller)

I do recommend it, but with fair warning....  I'm certain with some more polishing, it could fare much better.

6.75 / 10    Passing, but buy when it's on sale if you're willing to gamble.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080578741', 'num_games_owned': 499, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 140, 'last_played': 1406587184}
review:
Para quem gosta de jogo de luta 2D, Vanguard Princess pode quebrar um galho.
Mas não espere muito do jogo, ele por si só é limitado, no número de personagens, nos modos de jogo (só tem dois) e não possui o que o faria um tanto quanto diferencial, que é o modo online.
O sistema de combos pode ser agradável se conseguir se adequar a personagem escolher, a trilha sonora é agradável e as vozes delas também.
No final o jogo para mim valeu a pena, pois quando estou meio ocioso, pego o jogo e vou tentando zerar com todas as personagens.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988908361', 'num_games_owned': 513, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 602, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 557, 'last_played': 1425813539}
review: Derrière ses apparences de pur produit weeboo avec son casting composé de joli poupées à petite culotte, se cache un pur jeu de baston jouissif grâce à son incroyable rapidité. Un round peut facilement se terminer en moins de 10 secondes si vous vous montrez peu réactif, et les coups demandent une rapidité d’action hors pairs. Vanguard Princess est l’opposé de Glove On Fight. Et c’est pourquoi je vous le recommande si vous voulez un jeu de baston rapide. Si vous croyez que vous allez pouvoir mater tranquillement des culottes comme celle de Sakura dans Street Fighter, vous allez déchanter.
