author: {'steamid': '76561198116939136', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1403333012}
review:
4/10 Taktlos

Vanguard Princess ist ein kleines 2D V.S. Kampfspiel, ähnlich wie Street Fighter, King of Fighters, oder Mortal Kombat, in dem zwei Leute gegeneinander antreten und versuchen den jeweils anderen zu dominieren. Gerne gesehen dabei ist, dass sich alles ohne Probleme oder der Installation von Add-ons wie Joy2Key steuern lässt, egal ob Sie mit der Tastatur, einem Gamepad oder einem Arcadestick  spielen (Getestet mit Tastatur, Xbox 360 Controller, Mad Catz Street Fighter IV Fightpad & Mad Catz Street Fighter IV Fightstick).

Ursprünglich wurde Vanguard Princess 2011 als Freeware veröffentlicht um später, 2014, bei Steam für einen Verkaufspreis von €4,99 aufgelegt zu werden. Die aus zehn Hauptcharakteren und fünf Sidekicks bestehende Besetzung wurde aus ausschließlich weiblichen Kämpferinnen zusammengestellt.  Etliche davon sind knapp bekleidete, minderjährige Mädchen und es ist offensichtlich, dass der Fokus des Ganzen definitiv auf ihnen beruht. Dies ist auch der Grund weswegen ich das Spiel nicht weiter empfehlen kann. Die Sexualisierung von Minderjährigen ist inakzeptabel und zerstört ein ansonsten design-technisch aufwendiges, mechanisch gutes Spiel.

Da es sich zudem um ein Indie Spiel handelt, gibt es ein paar Angelegenheiten die neben der [b][u][i]Pedobear[/i][/u][/b] Affäre genannt werden sollten. Attacken beruhen ausschließlich auf der genretypischen 90° Bewegung am Steuerkreuz (→↓↘ + ⓚ v Ⓟ), was zwar heißt dass jeder jeden Charakter einfach aufgreifen kann, aber es existiert keinerlei Abwechselung. Ein weiteres Manko ist die bis jetzt fehlende Onlinespielmöglichkeit, welche das Entwicklerteam aber hofft noch implementieren zu können, und die zu guter Letzt, Tatsache dass der Bildschirm überfüllt ist.

Insgesamt sind konstant vier (bei der Endgegnerin fünf) Charaktere im Vordergrund zu sehen, welche zusammen mit der Hintergrundanimation dafür sorgen, dass Sie schnell den Überblick über die Situation verlieren. Auch gibt es keinen Trainingsmodus, die möglichen Spezialattacken Ihres Charakters können durch das Drücken des 'Pause'-Knopfes nicht angezeigt werden. Der für Steamübliche Overlay wurde auch (noch) nicht implementiert.

Das Spiel hätte sehr gut werden können, die Attacken machen äußerst viel Spaß und die Designs sind äußerst kreativ gestaltet, aber die Lolitas zerstören den Spaß für mich.

review: Fun game worth the buy, reminds me a lot of blazblue but more of an anime aspect.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065328493', 'num_games_owned': 1142, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1403417881}
review:
I would love to say good things about this game, after all it has, anime style, fight, some very good combos, good music and animations, but nope, the game is not optimized for windows, you cant go full screen, you cant set some advanced graphics, the controls have input lag sometimes, the game would be great if the bugs get fixed but until then, no, dont buy it or get it on a humble bundle or steam sales of 90%.

Eu adoraria dizer coisas boas deste jogo, pois ele tem estilo de anime, boas lutas, combos decentes, musica e animações ok, mas não, o jogo não é optimizado para windows, isso quer dizer que voce não consegue rodar em tela cheia, tem erros graves durante as partidas, o controle não respodne as vezes, se essas falhas fossem arrumadas seria um otimo game, mas por agora, so o compre se for num humble bundle da vida ou com um desconto de 90%.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064687100', 'num_games_owned': 3585, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 297, 'last_played': 1409768091}
review:
Just another 5 hours of my life wasted. The only positive part of my experience - i think i saw boobs in this game!

Let's start with the fact that this exact same english version of the game is available for free. Will not mention the link, but you can find it in the game's Discussion tab from Steam Hub in a closed thread. Second -  Steam Interface is not working, so you won't even be able to take screenshots, at least not in the standart way (F12). Full controller support ?! Really ?! Changing the up/down/left/right controlls from analog to arrows its not possible, also in order to exit the game while playing in Big Picture Mode you'll have to move your ass from the sofa and kill the process or minimize the game tab and then close it, cause there is no damn exit button. It doesn't have selectable resolution. You can play in its original microscopic window, or try pulling the window larger from the sides either selecting to play in full screen, which in any case will screw the aspect ratio. There are only 2 options in the main menu: story mode & VS mode. No tutorial, no option menu, no training mode, and again - no exit button?! The plot in story mode is overwhelmingly boring. Fortunately you can at least skip it. Even if you have enough patience to get over all this - i doubt you'll have any left after discovering how imbalanced the characters & AI are. And that last boss... oh man! Do yourself a favor and look for something else to loose your money on. Nothing worthy here...

review:
Save yourself some moeny and hassle; Dont get this game. 
This one claims to be a internationally acclaimed fighter... but it fails in almost every way.
If you make the mistake of switching the game to fullscreen you'll never be able to find a way to customize the controls.
This is done thought the Windows File menu, which is not visible in full screen; Good luck customizing them after you find it.
Struggled to set this one up to my liking on a game pad, and then the gameplay is unsatisfying.

review: Vanguard Princess was fully developed by Tomoaki Sugeno (or Suge9), an ex-Capcom sprite designer who worked in games like Resident Evil 3: Nemesis and made character sprites for The King of Fighters EX: Neo Blood. overall the design and visual of the characters and fields looks really nice a beatiful sprites art work! now the cons. the game possess little number of combos, AI of this game have surprised me, in spamming attacks, but nothing that cleaver what makes the game easy... sad thing about this game you can't play online matches. but you can play a multi with 2 players, like a fighting console game. for a short game overall is nice, i only sugest to buy if is in promotion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000678218', 'num_games_owned': 318, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 563, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 408, 'last_played': 1407942021}
review:
For the price
It's worth it
This game .....let's start off with graphic
Of course as you see it's very beautiful but it won't be that beautiful when scaled up to HD (if developer change engine)
The gameplay
Long combo are based on support
So you have to choose support that fit the character too
Most combo are short if you don't use support
Replayability
There's not much to do and learn in this game
The character aren't that interesting either
Combo are pretty easy to do so yeah it's too easy
AI
Normal
There's no "hard"
All is easy to normal
With exceptional of final boss
That boss is broken but beatable

So yeah this game is good for like 3-4 hours
But you can invest more time than that
It's very short if you played any others fighter games before because this is just too easy

When there's online play i would put more time into it

author: {'steamid': '76561198088434982', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1437446357}
review:
my big review for Vanguard Princess, I hope that the developer see's and responds to this.

First off I'd like to say that the gameplay is unique and well thought up, but overall it needs some major work done.  If even half of these are implamented then I feel that the game would become at least 10x better.  Also by makeing some improvements I feel that you could of made a better indiegogo campaign (which I missed)

1) my first problem is that to view all options you'd have to be in window screen instead of full screen mode to to view the "Windows, Options, and Help" tab.  They should be place as part of the main menu screen.  Along with being able to acess them when you pause the game.

2) the whole press "start+a+b+x+y" to quit needs to be replace with a quit the game to a simple pause menu (like stated before) with a selectable option to end the game.

3) The main menu screen should have a training room/practice mode instead of haveing to puase the game and do it manually.

4) a suggestion for the "Directors cut "DLC how about including something like directors cut at the title screen

5) It needs a move list that you can bring up during a match to see all of your characters moves.

6) the keyboard controlls, what where you thinking.  I know that we can rebind the keys but come on those default controlls are rediculous.  I'm glade that I use a 360 controller.


overall I rate this game a 6/10 but needs a lot of improvements to hardness a larger fanbase like SkullGirls.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129257148', 'num_games_owned': 421, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1401671394}
review:
Meh, this is a fun game, has a Persona 4 Arena feel to it sortof, however, I have a few problems.

1. Button remapping isn't possible, so playing with a keyboard for me is nearly impossible since the only two keys I know of are z and x that work.
2. I made the game fullscreen and now have no way to make it windowed mode "without uninstalling and reinstalling"
3. There is no practice mode.
4. Random freezing issues, and yes my pc is fine, I can run CS:GO on Ultra settings.

The game could be much better, it seems rushed.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990381411', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 180, 'playtime_forever': 271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 268, 'last_played': 1473033382}
review:
Vanguard Princess is a b*stard child of some other b*stard child.

I like to picture that Japan decides to makes one really good ALL-GIRL anime-based fighting game. After it's success, a thousand copycat companies want to emulate that game. You hear chatter from their developers : "Our game is different because our Sailor Moon character has a blue dress!" "Our game is different because half the girls are actually space aliens but still look human!" "Our game is really different because there are FOUR characters on screen instead of TWO."

The game starts abruptly - start the game and then you're in the character select screen. You pick a character (all females). Then you get to combat, and it's the same flashy japanese fighting game that you've seen since Street Fighter Alpha. Then you smash buttons until flashy lights make you dizzy and the announcer goes "KAY OOOH!" and one of you remains victorious. 

Now, here's my problem : This game lacks serious polish. There's no option screen. There's no MENU. You press escape, and it takes you to a slash screen of the controls. You can't even QUIT without pressing every button at once. There's no training option. There's no features at all. 

Unless you need to play every single ALL-GIRL anime-based fighting game that comes out, then stay away. Otherwise, find a copy of "Arcana Heart All Girl Fighting Game" and see what a ALL-GIRL anime-based fighting game should play like.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086891412', 'num_games_owned': 1260, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 640, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 640, 'last_played': 1401769152}
review:
This is a very smooth 2D fighting game with a very short and straightforward intro, despite the fact that all characters are anime stereotypes and sort of degenerates women in general a little bit, well, recipe for success in the gaming industry. The manual is a mess, it refers some sort of primitive dualshock which uses ABXY, if you want to get the most out of this game I strongly recommend having a controller, so you can play the game the way it was designed to be played, but you can configure the keyboard controls as well.

Bottom line, is it worth the full price? I don't think so, but you should definitely grab it when it's on sale or in a bundle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051407386', 'num_games_owned': 713, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 158, 'last_played': 1591996000}
review:
Según entiendo Vanguard Princess anteriormente era un juego freeware es decir un juego gratuito pero en esta versión se han mejorado algunas cosas como la IA.

Si me pongo a analizar el título puedo decir que que la relaciono calidad/precio esta perfectamente equilibrada ya que este juego de lucha aunque es algo simple llega a cumplir con lo que un jugador busca de un título de lucha en 2D.

La jugabilidad se puede decir que es perfecta en terminos que permite realizar varios combos y aunque no innova en nada en su jugabilidad ya que comparando lo visto en otros juegos de luchas 2D como guilty gear o Blazblue queda muy pobre pero aun así no se le puede pedir mucho más ya que es un juego inde. Aun con todo esto juego es muy entretenido más si solo quieres disfrutar partidas rápidas, además trae una modalidad para dos jugadores es decir que se puede jugar 1vs1 de manera local nada online, así como si fuera una maquina arcade.

Me puedo considerár fan de los juegos de luchas y recomiendo mucho este juego, tal vez no por su historia que sí tiene pero es algo simple o su apartado técnico que no es lo mejor que se puede ver en juegos de lucha, pero si por lo divertido de su jugabilidad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111145172', 'num_games_owned': 473, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1462119517}
review:
Vanguard Princess is really good fighting game.
There are not as much moves as in any other popular fighting games like f.ex. in Tekken or Street Fighter series but still it's worth trying.
Of course the most appealing thing in this game is the art, the way the girls look etc. but don't get me wrong It's still worth playing even if you might want to break your keyboard or anything else while trying to beat Hilda on Hard.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063011140', 'num_games_owned': 1214, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1570023725}
review:
While I do enjoy the battlesystem of the game, it's not possible to use a arcade stick or the D-pad for some weird reason. The only way to play/move the characters is using the analog stick or the keyboard, and I dislike using either for a fighting game. Changing the buttons used for up/down and left/right is not possible.
I hope, that they'll fix this, because, to be honest, I have enjoyed playing the bit that I have played. I'm not going to give the game a negative recommendation because of this problem either, because it's a personal preference.
And Well, i like this Anime Game, make remember me back in to 90's year. i Love This game, Character in this game is very cute, kawai and yeah it's good for Anime Game Fans, this is not a VN Game, but Fighting Game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037577863', 'num_games_owned': 617, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 601, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 582, 'last_played': 1639341848}
review:
Well, what can you expect? It's just another fighting game.
Aside from it being a 2v2 Assist fighting game, the art/graphics in this game and fighting style does make it stand out compared to the other games. Who doesn't like girls fighting against one another in a struggle for glory? While the game itself offers very little, the actual fighting portion is very enjoyable, but maybe too difficult. Mashing buttons as a beginner, or performing combos as an experienced verteran, this game is worth playing a few times times over.

There are very little choices in the main menu; but, on the character selection screen, you can mix and match mostly any two characters of your liking. Even though there's a decent roster to choose from, there aren't too many characters you're probably used to having in modern fighting games. Unfortunately, these characters are also divided into 2 categories: the Fighter themselves and the Assist Character. You must select one of each.

Using a controller seems to work by "chance". while some controllers work great and have no problems, others would fail on a button or two. It really does confuse you on whether it's the game or the controller that's causing the problem. I prefer to use my keyboard in my opinion. At least the computer knows that each key works. The mapping for the controller is also a basic, click to assign button, and actually pressing the button you want to assign it to. The problem lies in the analog stick. While some people don't mind using the analog stick in their gamepad, others find it simpler to use the D-Pad. However, as far as I know, the game would not let me use my D-Pad. It could just be by "chance" but I didn't think playing comfortably would be so difficult.

And lastly, from the forums and the internet, many have found Vanguard Princess a disappointment because of the lack in progress. As the developer brings up an idea for the future, the spotlight shines away. This caused people to believe that bringing in campaigns and such to be "a scam for your money" and is not to be trusted until improvments has been occuring.
What hurts more is how there is a free version of the game as well, but audio/text would be in another language.

I personally bought this game in support. I have seen many small companies or just a single person, bring a game to life and cross harsh paths or even stop their dream because of competitions, old engines, or even because no one would realise it's potential; and when you reach out to your fans who bought the game, they won't even offer help out because are aren't doing so well in creating your game. There are millions of problems that can cause games to suffer and eventually, become nothing more than history.

I personally see a bit of potential in this game, despite the many people that disagree with me and despite the fact that the game has progress nowhere for a long time. I just believe that hard work needs to be done. It is a difficult job to bring something to life and to keep it alive.

Buying in this game is really up to you. If you want to support, buy this game. If not, I believe the internet is your friend that will find a nice alternative.

review: Do not purchase.  It's a terrible fighting game, with limited gamepad support. There are no menus, no options, no video options, nothing. No training mode, limited skill list, and no D-pad support.  The game is simply a sales gimmick for Kawaii type characters with poor fighting.  There's only 2 modes: Story and Versus (which requires another player, or a special key input for CPU AI ).  This game is horrendous.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130264504', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 726, 'last_played': 1455952539}
review:
又是一个玩卡牌和背景的游戏，这个游戏还表现的不太明显，因为卡牌和背景价格还行，喜欢萌物的可以去搜搜看,表示终于找到不太贵还萌的背景了好兴奋，准备入了它哈哈。。。
格斗游戏，又是考验键盘的时候了，当然这个游戏也支持手柄，最享受的就是那一大串创华丽连招的快感了，键盘感觉略难搓的样子啊，不过借了舍友的手柄试了一下，还是默默回去搓键盘吧，好吧我承认我是手残党，我是被妹纸吸引来的╮(╯▽╰)╭
游戏中除了自己本身之外还有援护角色，用的好的话可以扭转战局哦~~
游戏有故事模式和本地对战，闲下来跟基友搓两盘也不错。。

author: {'steamid': '76561197971201484', 'num_games_owned': 3765, 'num_reviews': 193, 'playtime_forever': 124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1400330532}
review:
不錯的FTG(格鬥遊戲)
電腦有點強.而且戰鬥方面雖不至於花俏
但是招招華麗.
對格鬥遊戲苦守的我來說.這AI的強度根本就是堅不可摧
喜歡滿滿肉以及美少女的格鬥遊戲
目前這款應該是數一數二值得收藏的好GAME

缺點不支援STEAM的拍照功能
而且對搖桿的支援度有點低...(XBOX搖桿)
要入手前必須先考量這兩點
再決定是否要入庫會比較好

本款遊戲竟然有免費版下載
ㄎㄅ，如果不是綁STEAM的必要的話.建議就不用入手了
下載地址：http://vanpri.wikiwiki.jp
作者：スゲノトモアキ：http://suge9.blog58.fc2.com

author: {'steamid': '76561198058127745', 'num_games_owned': 770, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 83, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1399989198}
review:
Начну с того, что эта игра напрочь противопоказана тем, кто не любит анимешную стилистику, ибо да, Vanguard Princess - файтинг  в аниме-стилистике (да-да, Кэп на связи). Итак, что может предложить додзинси-файтинг (додзинси (doujinshi) - японский "аналог" инди-сцены) за 99 рублей?

Сюжет в игре существует лишь для галочки. Некое Праительство (да, оно прям так и называется) очень любило баловаться с магической энергией, что вышло для него боком - произошел катаклизм, у случайных девушек начали пробуждаться сверхспособности, и одна из них озлобилась на человечество и вам не составит труда догадаться чего она хочет. Остальные же девочки преследуют свои цели (например одна хочет всем доказать, что она дочь самого Сатаны) и по ходу "сюжета" отметелят вышеупомянутую девицу.

Сами же персонажи делятся на два типа - это те, кем вы лично управляете (их десять), и те, кто оказывают поддержку первым (их пятеро), ну и все они являются сплошным фансервисом. Девушка в очках - есть, девушка в школьной форме - есть, девушка-волшебница - есть, полуголая девушка с пушками - есть, зеттай рёки - есть, DFC - есть, в общем, каждый найдет себе свой предмет фетиша. Ну и не забываем панцушоты и весело прыгающие перси.

Бои ведутся по схеме "2-на-2". Входной порог очень низкий, не надо быть мастером геймпада и клавиатуры, чтобы нормально играть в эту игру (хотя для исполнения некоторых приемов все-таки придется размять пальцы). Динамика игры очень высокая и в некоторых моментах невозможно уследить за происходящим. Каждая из персонажей имеет по 6-7 приемов, которых очень легко чередовать. Приемы просты для исполнения и буттонмашеры будут в восторге от этой игры.

Первое что бросается в глаза - это то, что как все в этой игре безумно цветастое. От такого буйства ярких красок и кучи сверканий шансы хоть что-то увидеть стремится к нулю. Но все-таки стоит отметить, анимация в игре просто чудо. Музыка тоже хороша, да и озвучка персонажей получилась качественной.

Кратко отмечу минусы:
- Невозможно переключиться в полный экран (экран начинает мигать с адской частотой).
- Нет онлайна (извольте играть вдвоем на одном компьютере).
- Дисбаланс.
- Не работает Steam Overlay.

Итог: Vanguard Princess - очень приятный файтинг. Яркий, простой, динамичный, няшный. С мастодонтами жанра конечно сравниться не может, но за такую цену - это просто чудо.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997036304', 'num_games_owned': 3184, 'num_reviews': 459, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1399294886}
review:
A fighting game, but the issue I have is that it's a fighting game of skill and not button-bashing. You need to memorise the moves as you fight against a computer who is completely unrelenting in it's offensive strategy. 

The animation is very well done with many cute female leads with a somewhat more unique anime opening. However in many ways it seems this game is geared towards a certain audience too. It can be fun with you master the controls, but I was only able to make them work with the controller.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042259317', 'num_games_owned': 4316, 'num_reviews': 414, 'playtime_forever': 108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1399628132}
review:
Buy? Unlikely.

TL;DR: Vanguard Princess is a beautifully animated with generally solid fighting mechanics at it's core, but with a feature list that can can be counted on one hand built in a inexcusably shoddy program environment for PC, it is a game that only the most ardent anime/moe/kawaii otaku's and die-hard fighter gamers should dare even bother with.

-=Presentation=-
If at first glance, you saw this and thought this was a game mostly built to appeal to pervy anime fans, you'd mostly be right. That's only a problem depending what type of person you are, but at the get go, it limits it's appeal to only those type of gamers and then it's a core fighter which some of those types are not intreseted. The minute you open the game, it loads in a window, much like some early-to-mid 90's PC game or exported title from Japan (well, that's basically what it is). You can go to full screen with the Menu Bar (when's the last time you had to use that for a game?!) or Alt + Enter, but there are no resolution or aspect ratio options. What's worse, the application window can be freely scaled with no way to constrain it to an aspect ratio, so you can end up stretching the visuals too wide or too tall (or not enough of either) if you aren't perfectly dragging the window out to the correct size. This also almost defeats the purpose of the pixel based art style since it won't scale properly due to a lack of scaling options or anti-aliasing/smoothing - play full screen and you'd practically be able to count the pixels on the sprites.

It's an absolute shame too, because the animation is some of the most fluid and well animated sprites I've ever seen in a fighter (admittedly, I haven't played many "newer" anime fighters to compare this too like BlazBlue, Guilty Gear, or SkullGirls). It's clear that a vast majority of the time and resources (and not money, since this was originally a freeware title, unless money was spent) was built into the fighters and friends. Cloth flows, hair sways, boobs bounce...though this is all directly animated sprites. Most characters are wearing skimpy, revealing, or otherwise shapely garments, most especially the "loli" friends some of which that have clearly revealing and unrealistic "PLEASE LOOK AT MY CLEAVAGE" attire - this will immediately disturb and drive people away who aren't comfortable with this. It's doesn't bother me enough to not play the game at all, but I do feel weird playing this when relatives are walking by.

Sound is solid. The music is good, and is standard anime fare. I don't remember any track annoying me or sounding too amateur-ish.  Character speech is all Japanese voice acted - which is perfect for the "I only watch anime with subs" crowd that fawn over Japanese voice acting, everybody else will be either disappointed, annoyed, disgusted or a combination of all. That said I've seen no problems in terms of bad audio quality, glitches, cut offs or weirdness (like music getting stuck or not playing where it should. Though I've only played less than an hour's worth)

However, the game as a whole being presented to you as a game and a PC game is god awful. No resolution or aspect ratio options. (You can only change key input and full screen vs windowed in the menu bar) No in game options screen. No online multiplayer (excusable since this was a free/cheap game). Broken training/practice feature. No tutorial or learning feature. Only two main menu options, Tiny bars for the special and assist meters (which are really bad in a fighter when you need this info and have to look in the corner away from the action). No pause menu. No audio options. An absolute mess. It is sometimes hard to believe this is a game that is being sold for money - thankfully this came as part of a bundle for me)

-=Gameplay=-
I can't give a proper review of the combat mechanics. There is a weak, strong, medium and assist attack. There are various moves that some can knock enemies into the air, allowing for some mild juggling (nothing like Tekken though). It's tough for me to get a grasp of how specials, assists and combos work, since there's not a true practice system in the game. You can go to Vs mode (the only other item to select in the main menu. Are you kidding me?) and after fumbling with the character select for the 2nd player, you can set the 2nd player into a practice mode where she keeps regaining health. You have to do  this clunkily by pressing the button assigned to Right Bumper/No Action (Why cant this be in a start menu like EVERY OTHER FIGHTER?!) and even with that mode, the time still runs out.

It's strange, I had no problem adjusting to Gundam Wing: Endless Duel on an SNES emulator with a third party gamepad on PC (and playing it quite well and being able to beat it reasonably), yet I can barely get by (and not beat the 3rd enemy) on a title built on the ground up from PC. It seems like I can't always get the moves I want to activate and it's even stranger when some characters have moves that apply to all attack buttons and others don't. Unfortunately, I have no way to learn this other than to study the moves list that appears ONLY when you select a character. Nothing in the pause menu...oh wait - there is no pause menu - it's just a screen that shows a picture of preset button inputs (that means it won't change when you change your keys) and somehow doesn't work properly when a battle starts, showing a screen saying "Oops, you need to Press Start" which doesn't always clear when you do. Oh, and the pause menu is defaulted to right thumbstick by default. Some of the shitty, unpopular 90s fighters did a less sloppy job with their menus than this game.

Regardless, I had a hard time learning how to play the game. I did get a little better at one point, and had there been better systems in this game, I could see myself playing this a little bit longer just to see how good I can get (As I'm relatively Decent on PS3 SFIV and pretty darn good at Dreamcast/Arcade CVS2). I would enjoy this game more if I simply could "Suck less" and if I was more patient with it, could maybe become a decent player. I hopelessly suck at it, and I have no reason to deal with that when there are better fighting games to play.

-=Summary=-
If fighters are among your primary genre and you enjoy the clearly hentai-esque vibe, then you may find an enjoyable fighter if you are willing to put up with one of the most awful PC gaming experiences I've ever dealt with. If you don't have a high standard for what to expect from PC game and you consider yourself part of the "Japanime" ethos, than you may tolerate this game. You may be able to live with the problems and even expect it since the game is $5 or less on sale/bundles - but neither I nor most gamers need waste their time with this when there are better options (unless you're desperate for a cheap/free fighter).

Steam user duvel wrote a reasonable interpretation of the game that tells you what you need to know, though with 66% helpful rating due to likely pissing off the fanbase. Vanguard Princess is clearly targeted a very niche market.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025186600', 'num_games_owned': 674, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1399252778}
review:
I find it very difficult to recommend this game. Which is a shame because the mechanics are actually really good and the art and animation are absolutely gorgeous. But there is no options menu, no way to pause the game, if you go full-screen then the only way to quit is to alt+tab and close it from there. A controller is literally the ONLY way to play this game. Since there is no options menu  there is no way to know what the key-bindings are, let alone change them. I'm not even sure if you CAN play this with your keyboard.

While a controller seems to be the only way to play this, even that seems somewhat dubious. The first time I booted up the game the controller didn't seem to work properly. I would move the analog stick around in every direction and the menu cursor would only occassionally decide to move as though I were merely giving it a suggestion. After playing for a few minutes it seemed to become more responsive. I can't even begin to explain why that was happening.

As mentioned before there appears to be no way pause the game. Thus there is no way to bring up a menu to review your character's moves in the middle of battle nor is there a way to simply quit out. If you wish to go back character selection in the middle of a fight then apparently your only recourse is to let the computer beat you up. Also the game crashed after only about 30 minutes.

But honestly, stability and bugs are the least of this games problems. Aside from lacking something as vital as an options menu, the game barely has a menu you to speak of. Your only options on the main screen are "Story Mode" and "VS. Mode". That's it. No "Options" menu and no way to quit the game from within.

I really WANT to love this game. But it's missing some very basic standard features. I've heard that this used to be a freeware game. If that's the case then it seems it hasn't changed much.

review: Pretty dedent anime fighter, XBox360 controller works, but no D-pad support. No real fullscreen, just stretched window of 640x480 by the looks of it. Depending on your fighter, controls are pretty good, some characters just dont seem to be responsive, or maybe I'm just doing it wrong... Combos and special moves are fairly easy to pull off. At the select screen, characters have their special moves listed with controls, which is a nice touch for any fighting game. I don't know if they ever will, but if they fixed control issues to use D-pad/fightstick etc and fullscreen even 720P, it would breathe soo much life into this game, title says 2014, but really it feels more like 1997.. Not a bad thing, if you love anime  you'll enjoy it. Its not got alot of replay value, but it is a fun little waste of time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005701722', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1431231717}
review:
I only write reviews for games that I have finished, and tried different modes of the game.  So despite the fact that I haven't actually spent too much time on this one, I've beat the game a few times, and I have also tried playing local versus game with a friend.  Let's just say that I don't thumbs up or down a game with 0.1 hour into the game.

I find that there is just too many problems with this game.  First of all, the game only run in 640x480.  I don't mind it all that much, but this game seems to have decent animation, just seems like a waste that you can only play in such low res.   And one of the biggest issue I have with this game is the navigation of the menu.  It is so broken.  Once you select the characters, you go to the next screen to choose difficulty mode; and you can't go back to the previous character screen once you are at that screen.  That is not that big of a problem, but the thing I hate most is that I personally haven't found a way to properly exit the game.  When you pause the game, the screen says that I have to press Start + A + B + X + Y to exit...Seriously, can't they just make it like any other game where you can just press start, and a menu comes out for you to exit the game.  And not only that, the problem is that it won't work all the time.   I'm using a Xbox controller, there shouldn't be that much compatibility issue.  So at least for me, I always have to alt-tab, and close the program from my desktop to exit this game.

Now about the actual gameplay.  I've played many 2D and 3D fighting games before.  I won't say I'm a fighting game master or anything, but I just have to say there is nothing too special about this one, other than the fact that you have a 'sidekick' to assist you.  The only thing I like a bit about this game is that getting to the boss doesn't seem to require too much time.  It's only 6 stages, then one boss stage.  I have easily beaten this game on normal difficulty without continuing, that's thanks to one of the character's overpowered moves that I was abusing.

Even back in the 90s, when a developer/publisher port an arcade fighting game to the console, they always pack with many different game modes in the game, for example, things like gallery mode(movie, still pics or sound clips).  Well, not that I really care about that kind of stuff, but you can see that the developer/publisher created those to encourage you to replay the game more,  and unlock different stuff in different game modes. (And don't forget, fighting game is all about replay value).  Now I understand this is a low budget and cheap retail game, but I just hope that maybe adding a training mode...or even just an option menu would be nice.

To sum it up, broken menu navigation, barebone game with no extra, somewhat unbalanced characters, low res graphics...and the list goes on.  I just don't see any replayability for this game, so I can't recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105791683', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 130, 'last_played': 1436654254}
review:
O jogo em si so é bastante limitado,so tem duas opiçoes de jogo, o modo historia ou o modo versus,o que faz vc ter que descobrir tudo no jogo na marra,e os controles sao praticamente bugados,no começo dificilmente vc acertara alguma sequencia ate você entender como serve o sistema de controlar 2 personagens.
 É Bacana,mesmo tendo todos esses infortunios,e o preço dele é bem em conta.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086566294', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1399002518}
review:
I'm having a very hard time recommending this game.  There are good mechanics here, and the sprite work is top notch, but...

The game's controls are counter intuitive.  On the keyboard, the arrow keys are not the default movement for Player 1.  Instead it's T, F, H, and B, which are not only a bit spaced out, but too close to the attack keys.  Using an Xbox 360 controler is also a pain, requiring you to completly rework the default controls.  Hell, by default, there's not a single button that will pause the game.  Not to mention you need third party software to even use the D-Pad (or a PS3 controller, which many recommend).  Also, it dose not bode well if the most effective tactic is button mashing (at least on a keyboard).

UPDATE: I tried using a Hori brand arcade stick (the one included with Tekken 6), and though the buttons worked, the joystick would not.  And before you ask, YES I did test it on another game (AVGN Adventures), and can confirm that the joystick works just fine, meaning that it's the same issue as the D-pad.

Another problem is the difficulty.  I've played many hard fighting games before, but a good chunk of the time I can't even beat the first opponent on Story Mode, ON EASY!  This game is unforgiving to anyone new to the game, and will kick your ass unless you learn how to use your character, or just get by by dumb luck.

There's also no apparent VS CPU mode in the game, or even a training mode to help you practice (which it could really use).  It also dosen't help that the only way to get to the game's options is when it's in windowed mode.  In full screen mode, you cannot access the game's options, making it very hard to even quit the game at times (first time playing this on full screen, the only way I could quit the game was to use ctrl+alt+delete).

I also want to bring up the graphics.  I have a high resolution screen, and the games speed is good, but the graphics look like I'm playing it on an early PS1 or Saturn at times (if not just a step below that).  It may be just my system, or it could be that the game isn't optimized for high resolution screens.  Until I can confirm what the problem is, I have to say it's a "results may vary" situation here.

UPDATE: Reading other reviews, it is indeed a resolution issue.  Not game breaking, but it will hurt the game for some players.

The lack of a net code dose hurt it a bit, but this is a problem being work on, so I cannot fault the game for that, not to mention that don't play games like this online enough for it to be a real problem for me.

Compared to games like Skullgirls, BlazBlue, or Arcana Heart, there is some good mechanics, but the interface, controls, and difficulty in it's current form makes this hard for me to reccomend.  Should these things be fixed, I would say it's worth the $5, but as it is, I say wait until the game is patched to fix these problems.  When it dose, I will revisit this review

author: {'steamid': '76561198027396381', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1439863338}
review:
In the all of ten minutes I've played this game (so far, waiting to get my friends to stop by and play it), I experienced emotions that most games never quite aroused within me. As I sat there, controller firmly gripped in both hands, struggling to comprehend what I was supposed to be doing or what was taking place on the screen before me, a number of thoughts raced through my mind...

-Why did I buy this game? I have close to zero interest in lolis or ecchi or kawaii or anime, hentai, or whatever any of this stuff is called/ might be called by some shmuck like me who (clearly) isn't an otaku and doesn't remotely frequent the kinds of sites or venues that may host that content.

-Maybe I know next to nothing about fighting games as well, but come on. This is just like Skullgirls with the multiple characters in fights as assists and fanservice with the all-female roster and jiggling and panties and such, right?

-What is happeni...

Oh. OH. Oh my. This... this is... I don't even... oh. Okay, wow. That just... whoa.

And as I sat, and stared, mesmerized by the gratuitous flurry of events taking place onscreen regardless of my futile attempts at gaining some semblance of logical return for my braindead, pawing inputs on the controller; something magical and/or terrifying was taking place.

I could feel, as an acute physical sensation that emanated somewhere beneath my liver, my very own sense of dignity and self-worth slowly, deliberately, yet unmistakably evaporating from each orifice on my body in ascending succession with each passing moment that I continued gawping at the screen and half-consciously pressing buttons. It was magnificent. Sublime, even. Never in all my experience of gaming did I think a game could do such a thing to my mind, to reduce me to such a state. And I'd had my share of uncomfortable and undignified gaming experiences... such as "enjoying" (if one could even call it that) the private dances and illicit sexual services in the Grand Theft Auto games, or even playing some games beyond a reasonable point ***cough*** Lollipop Chainsaw ***cough*** to unlock increasingly skimpy (and ultimately unsatisfying) costumes or art galleries.

But so far my very short time spent with this game has extended my collective sphere of gaming stimuli beyond simple discomfort or awkwardness to a point that, in my opinion, lands it nowhere short of brilliance. You may take this as saying that I can only recommend the game for the novelty of it alone, but the truth is that the game's content, taken at face value, is on such an off-putting, yet irresistably tantalizing wavelength that I'm enamored with the idea of continuing to play it (preferably with friends), and maybe even learn the ropes of it and become somewhat competent at a fighting game. That is quite an achievement. That is definitely worth my five bucks, and my praise.

Overall... what can I say that hasn't already been said here? Either get it or don't. For the sake of influencing your decision, I'll leave with one of the other reviews posted by another user here...

"One of the fighters isn't wearing any underwear"

That's all you really need to know, right?

review: I always wanted to pay for this game, and now i can! this fighter is worth it if you have someone to play with locally as it doesn't offer much outside of Vs and Arcade/Story. What really brings me into this game are the visuals, they're sometimes stunning and i forget its all pixel art.  There are a lot of all girl fighters out there, this is one of the better ones to me, it has interesting designs that stand out from similar games. Gameplay wise, It takes a lot from Street Fighter, and this is a good thing, it at feels responsive. Again the a draw back here is the lack of game modes, but hopefully things will be added in the future.

review: I do not recommend this game. It is very confusing, as you can't use a controller, and there is no training mode. author: {'steamid': '76561198009554098', 'num_games_owned': 1487, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 103, 'last_played': 1472834547}
review:
I was really looking forward to getting this one.  Unfortunately its unplayable at best. Its boots up fine, but the controls are barely functional. I tried booting it up and using my 360 pad, but nope. It would recognize a few button presses and then completely stop. So I tried remapping the controls, but it wouldn't let me. I tried the keyboard, but even that wouldn't work.

Even if the controls did work, I must say im quite upset with the lack of graphic options available.  There is no way to change the resolution or any other option. You can simply switch to either a micro-sized window, an increased size window with the menu bars up top, or full screen. When I switched to full screen, everything got distorted and my mouse would only function for windows as if the game wasn't there.

If you can get this to run correct then great, the game looks fun. If not, then at least you're out only $5 on this unplayable garbage.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024246936', 'num_games_owned': 5024, 'num_reviews': 194, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1395953383}
review: Most of Vanguard Princess's charm and appeal lie in its interesting character design and sprite art, and those visual elements are admittedly pretty spectacular. What's more, this game revives some gimmick mechanics that haven't been seen in 2D fighting games for decades, like sidekick assists and parrying. For those reasons, it's easy to want to like the game, but it's clear from your first playthrough that there's something fundamentally wrong that all the cute panties and big, floppy anime boobs in the world can't fix. I've played through the game with all of the characters, and of the entire roster, only one had a set moves that was even halfway intuitive. It's highly reminiscent of one of those bad Neo Geo games developed by ADK. Even standard punches and kicks cause characters to flail around wildly and unpredictably, a problem exacerbated by the game's breakneck pace. So much effort is spent struggling to figure out what's going on at the basic level that it's difficult to find the opportunity to explore the "2 on 2" gimmick that the game touts. It could be that Vanguard Princess's horrendous sets of moves just make the learning curve ridiculously steep. It could be a very rewarding game after hours of practice. But with no online multiplayer and sketchy support for pads and sticks, what would be the point of getting good at a game you can't play with anyone else?

author: {'steamid': '76561198029656416', 'num_games_owned': 1138, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1397319236}
review:
เคยเป็นเกมฟรีมาก่อน แค่แปลจากญี่ปุ่นเป็นภาษาอังกฤษก็เอามาขายบน Steam ได้แล้ว?
http://www.vector.co.jp/soft/dl/win95/game/se477052.html

คอมโบน้อยมาก ท่าก็น้อย ปุ่ม เตะ ต่อย ก็ไม่มี มีให้มาแค่ 3ปุ่ม โจมตีเบา ปานกลาง แล้วก็ สูง อีกปุ่มนึงคือให้ผู้ช่วยโจมตี ผมว่าธรรมดาเกินเน้นจับจังหวะมากกว่า

ใช้เอนจิ้น ตกยุคไม่เหมาะกับหน้าจอสมัยนี้ 2D Fighter Maker 2nd (FM2K) ความละเอียดต่ำมาก แถมยังใช้อัตราส่วนจอแบบ 4:3 ซึ่งไม่ดีกับคนใช้จอ LCD แบบ Widescreen แน่ๆเปิดเต็มจอทีภาพโดนยืด แถมความละเอียดต่ำ ยิ่งเบลอเข้าไปใหญ่ ใช้เอนจิ้นตกยุค ไม่ลงทุน ดีตรงภาพวาด Sprite ตัวละครสวย แอนิเมชั่นลื่นไหล
เล่นออนไลน์ไม่ได้ ถ้าจะเล่นสู้สองคนต้องใช้เครื่องเดียวกันเล่น

กราฟฟิคเกมเป็นแบบการ์ตูนอนิเมะ ญี่ปุ่น ถ้าใครชอบแนวๆนี้ก็เหมาะอยู่ แต่ถ้าคนชอบเล่นเกม ต่อสู้แบบจริงๆจังๆ ผมไม่แนะนำ

ถ้าชอบเกมต่อสู้จริงไปหา King Of Fighter, Street fighter หรือ Tekken (ไม่มีบน PC นะ) มาเล่นดีกว่า

ถ้าเอาไปเทียบเกมยุค PS1 อย่าง King Of Fighter 98, Tekken หรือ Soul Caliber ผมว่าเกมนี้ยังสู้ไม่ได้เลยอะ (พูดถึงระบบเกมต่อสู้นะไม่ใช่กราฟฟิค)

โดยรวมถ้าเกมพัฒนาให้เข้ากับหน้าจอ Widescreen ความละเอียดสูงสมัยนี้ได้ + สนับสนุนออนไลน์ + คอมโบหลากหลาย ก็น่าเล่นอยู่นะ กราฟฟิคในเกมสวยอยู่แล้ว

author: {'steamid': '76561197989214336', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1405197447}
review:
Although it appears to be a competent fighter, there are a variety of problems with it. The manual does not conform to the terminology used in the game, making it very hard to get into the game at first glance. I have also been unable to play the game in full-screen mode or even use a controller, although it is listed as having full controller support. 

Developed by Suge9 the game naturally sports, albeit, even by fighting game standards, ridiculously sexualized, beautiful sprites, although in my opinion, the battlefield often ends up cluttered because of the 4-character setup. The mechanics at large feel interesting and the characters diverse, but this is hard to say anything about due to the controller issues. 

Recommend waiting for patches.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004346647', 'num_games_owned': 841, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1396195329}
review:
What if everything wrong with anime...

CAME
IN
A
FIGHTING GAME

This game was originally free-ware, but even I wouldn't subject myself to this much fan service to play a barely decent fighting game, even if it was free.  I can't play this game in public.  Actually, I cant play this game at all.  Controller support is bad.  I played about 5 minutes on keyboard, got sick of looking at loli after loli.  The animation is pretty good to be honest, but the art style is just atrocious...  I idled to get the trading cards afterwards.  As far as I can tell from the little time spent actually playing, it felt like a generic fighter.  That probably stems from the fact it was made in Fighter Maker.

Even if you like this kind of art style, its a generic fighter with bad controller support.  Could not recommend under any circumstances.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078631236', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 419, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 419, 'last_played': 1395532949}
review:
Файтинг в стилистике аниме с чисто женским составом участниц.
Минусы - Графика режет глаз. Управление просто ужасно (верите или нет, но боксовский геймпад под неё работать отказался!). Из режимов только стори-мод и версус-мод. Сюжет до неприличия второсортный. Музыка тоже особо не блещет. Количество приёмов как-то маловато.
Плюсы - Фансервис. Что у игры есть, того не отнять! Большое количество персонажей, каждая из которых тян. Причём тян довольно-таки милые и симпотичные!) Радует их разнообразие. Мастерская Steam (наверное будут новые арены - хотя это и не спасёт игру). Но на этом плюсов у игры я больше не нашёл.
Итог - В стиме есть много хороших файтингов - MK, Street Fighter, BlazBlue. Если Вам нравится наличие именно красивых тян, то Skullgirls; если анимешная олдскулл-графика, то Guilty Gear Isuka. Любой файтинг из стима, мне кажется, будет лучше чем этот.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066965778', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1517246783}

review: 人物萌死我了，当时还以为没有日语语音，结果发现有的那一刻我相当激动，自己还是steam玩的少了啊，图样图森破。人物相当萌，值得喜+1。

author: {'steamid': '76561197971296149', 'num_games_owned': 423, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1394261491}
review:
I received this as part of a Groupees Bundle that eventually got Steam keys. It wasn't a highlight of the bundle, but when it came over to Steam, I thought I'd give it a shot.

Vanguard Princess is a very pretty game, certainly, but suffers from several UI and gameplay issues that really keep me from recommending it. I don't mind the fanservice in it, but that's really the main focus of the game from what it seems. The art style seems to have taken precedence of deeper movesets, online netcode, and several other features that would have made this more than just a basic Freeware game.

Buttons are difficult to figure out and somewhat of a pain to change. From my short time playing it, I noticed that some of the move commands listed in the game are different than what they actually are on the gamepad. Several of them rely on awkward finger positioning, and changing the buttons requires going into the software menu int he Windows bar; there are no in-game settings for that. Which, speaking of, if you Fullscreen the game, you lose access to that button.

There's no online play from what I saw. You do get a Versus mode to play with friends, but it requires a second player. If you want to play dead bots, you have to figure out the 2P buttons on a keyboard or controller to input your selections. There is no AI Practice Mode. Also, in the Versus mode, your movesets are not listed in any of the menus, and the "Quit Match" command doesn't seem to register on the keypad, so you have to Alt+F4 out of it or figure other ways to leave.

There are shadows of a good fighting game in here, but it is way, way underdeveloped to really recommend paying any money for. As it is, there's really nothing to enjoy unless you just really want to see cartoon underwear. Or, if you got it in a bundle, you can probably sell the Steam cards for more than the game costs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012856063', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1394298193}
review:
Amazingly, this version of the game runs worse than the freeware version, with the framerate being totally unplayable. Both versions did not recognize my Xbox 360 arcade stick, and fullscreen mode doesn't work right (Windows 8.1). Complete lack of practice mode, as well, is a serious issue. Overall, there's just a serious lack of polish that completely ruins the experience for me.

[b]Between King of Fighters XIII, Skullgirls, and Street Fighter, you can get some great fighting games on Steam right now, but this is unfortunately not one of them.[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561197971528997', 'num_games_owned': 2512, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1395076532}
review:
Oh my god another Anime Beat em up, ok lets look at the plus points

@ It looks pretty much like any Japanese Manga / Anime
@ It has a nice sound track
@ It's very cheap
@ Character Design is cool

And the Negatives

@ It's not a Casual Beat Em Up, it's like playing a Mugen game, with very broken AI
@ The move lists are only visible at character selection
@ Story Mode isn't that great
@ There's no practice mode

Would I recommend it, ?

Only Just, hopefully they'll fix some of the negatives, but in it's current form I'd give it a 6 / 10, it's a nice beat em up, if a bit confusing at times

probably one for the beat em up hardcore only.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986364107', 'num_games_owned': 396, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 487, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 366, 'last_played': 1450596537}
review:
I'll be frank with anyone reading this. I didn't know what to really expect from this game since my stigma with fighting games on PC's is a lingering issue, though I come from a long LONG history about them: One Must Fall 2097 and FX Fighter come to mind. Now with that said... I know more and more fighting games are slowly making their way onto Steam, and that's awesome! Show your support with that trend and get this game.

Let's also just get some of this stuff out of the way: As you can see from the screenshots, yes... there's a bit of loli going around and scantily clad women--but come on, this is video games we're talking about and a fighting game of this degree needs no explanation or attempt in being subtle... because this is a damn good fighting game. Put the visuals to the side and let them appeal later on, and you'll be all the better for it.

This is a fighter I'm trying to wrap my head around because just in the first few minutes of it, I instantly fell in love with it. The animations are beautifully rendered, the sound design is astounding (we're talking late 80's, early 90's sounding arcade sound design here! Just listen to Luna's guns and you'll know exactly what I'm talking about!) and the combat is pretty on point. The drawback is that the game is very... PAINFULLY even, barebones.

There are two modes, Story and VS Mode--but no online mode. Story mode isn't exactly your typical "Story Mode" from other fighting games which try and set up a story. This is more like a straight up Arcade Mode than anything as you hit up any of the characters and take them for a spin. It's a shame really that there is no online mode because I would definitely love to take up a match against someone else in this game!

The game also only has 10 characters, 15 in acuality, but 10 you can actually play as and 5 which are your support class characters. You can't switch to these support class characters, they are there solely for what they're supposed to be: support. Now as for the action in this game? If anyone remembers playing the ORIGINAL Guilty Gear on the Playstation, you've got a pretty good idea what this game feels like. If you haven't, I'll say that this game offers a unique feel and spin on the typical fighting game repetoire. Each character feels unique and play VERY differently from one another, and you'll most likely gravitate to one character that  suits your play style or how comfortably you smash around on the controller.

The game isn't without flaws however... given the very bare bones aspect of the game, there are points where the AI will always have the advantage over you and juggle you around. And in a way that might add to the challenge of getting used to the game's fighting system but other people may find that disagreeable.

Still, for what the game has, it does everything very well and looks extremely good doing it. It has some disadvantaging quirks but I wholly support more fighting games coming onto PC and to see the company behind this particular title to push something bigger and better down the way for me to pick up, because I'm already a fan of this awesome little game with big potential!

author: {'steamid': '76561198068761642', 'num_games_owned': 1879, 'num_reviews': 177, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1394829388}
review:
我从小就一直是格斗游戏苦手，十几年前的时间过去了，那种斜下方的箭头到现在不知道要怎么按。无论是用键盘还是手柄，都总是搓不出大招。这是我一直不喜欢玩格斗游戏的原因。不过好在这游戏没有那种特别华丽的大招，基本上是用很普通的招式克敌制胜，在援护、反击、吹飞这些细节上还是稍微有些讲究的。作为一个同人游戏的水准来说，完全是合格的。

但是这个游戏最大的特点还是在于美少女角色的刻画了。格斗过程中翻飞起舞的胖次，露娜满场横飞的肉弹，还有LOLI大魔王那几句“バカバカバカ”、“一万年早い”之类钉宫式的娇嗔，都让我有些感动。对于美少女游戏喜好者来说，是完全能够满意的一作。

游戏一个缺憾是没有成就，导致可玩性下降；但是游戏的卡片和背景又极为出彩。总的来说，还是建议大家买的。不过资金不宽裕的人也可以再等等打折，到时候三张卡片不想要的话卖掉就差不多能值回票价了（到时候请务必联系我~）

author: {'steamid': '76561198042076438', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1665626710}
review:
La calidad gráfica es bastante aceptable, sin embargo le falta mucho que pulir, por ejemplo:
- Las opciones de configuración para el control son muy básicas.
- Las opciones de menú se deben de acceder utilizando el mouse.
- No hay modo de práctica.

Por otro lado, para pasar unos cuantos minutos dando golpes y al mismo tiempo ver buenas tololas esta bien, de hecho, con un poco más dedicación éste se podría convertir en un gran juego de luchas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120263479', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1451752148}

Но вот для любителей сего жанра данный файтинг придется по душе. Тонны фан-сервиса и фапабельные тянки в комплекте. author: {'steamid': '76561198042864202', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1394669334}
review:
This has all the things I like: Anime styled characters, fighting, and an all girl cast.

...But I still can't recommend it.

There is a short intro for the plot, which doesn't do much except tease you with a hint of a story.
The characters have backstories that sound interesting but aren't explored much. The sidekick you choose doesn't seem to have one at all =(

Fighting is pretty much like any other fighting game. Every three fights you get a special fight that shows you some really simplistic chatter between characters.

If they took more time to explore the cool stories they set up, and gave more reasons as to why the girls are fighting each other it would become a much better game.

It has promise but I don't think it will get any better in time so save your money on any other fighting game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036800433', 'num_games_owned': 1578, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1454933292}
review:
A fun game for a a few bucks, the characters are allot of fun to play, but there is no content outside of story mode and local versus.

The graphics and animation are great, and allot of stuff happens both in the fight and in the backgrounds.

Do be warned about the lack of content when thinking of buying the game; There is no tutorial, no online, no training against bots, no challenges etc. The content there is (story mode and versus) aren't that great either, story mode has almost no story, there are only 2 lines of dialogue in the entire story mode per character, and the only part that actually has story is the ending. There is also no options menu, and getting controllers/arcade sticks to work isn't as easy as it should be.

I would recommend this game to people that like fighting games, if you would like to try a unique fighting game, but only because of the low price.

If you do get the game, then get the Free director's cut DLC, unless you have an unreasonable hate for animu pantsu

author: {'steamid': '76561198109691541', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 46, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1394301162}

author: {'steamid': '76561198052478802', 'num_games_owned': 3342, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1455983533}
review:
It's certainly no Skullgirls, but Vanguard Princess offers a surprising amount of tactical depth for such an inexpensive indie fighter. Once you get used to the controls, you can pull off some pretty cool combos alongside your support character.

Needless to say, all this mayhem's very pretty to look at, even though the sprites are low-res. If the developer can bring this game's extremely limited modes and options up to snuff, then the beauty and fun of Vanguard Princess can really come to the fore.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016859256', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1394423472}
review:
An excellent fighting game with an extremely interesting 2 character gameplay mechanic that's very unique from similar games.

Sadly, most players will probably never discover it or give it a chance due to the lack of netplay. I believe the creator has hinted at maybe adding netplay in an update, but until than you'll have to rely on home made netplay programs (Lunarport) if you don't have any local fighting game player friends (just don't expect it to be convenient).

If you do have the initiave to get netplay working or the local friends required to get some fun out of this game, it's totally worth it, because the game is really good fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985309624', 'num_games_owned': 417, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1405963728}
review: Vanguard Princess has a lot of potential as animu fightan, but seeing as it has no online play, no features outside of story and local versus, no movelist, no training mode, and very few characters, it falls really short. There are other better anime fighters. Play one of those.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081154397', 'num_games_owned': 371, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1394351538}
review:
It's a nice little game to pass the time, though it's best played with a controller. I would suggest it , but I don't feel that it's great enough to be worth the full $5. If you feel it is, go buy it, if not, wait for a sale.

The size of the game is pretty small when compared to some of the other games I spend most of my time on, and it's a nice little time-waster while I wait for my other games to download.

I'm not entirely familiar of what makes a good/bad fighting game, though I did find the movements quite fluid. As a 2V2 fighting game, I feel that this was a decent buy for me.

Final Verdict: Good game, 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198036996067', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1590107380}
review:
vanguard princess... it is a.... rather strange game, its a "2 on 2" fighting game, but i'd use that term lightly, you get an assist partner, but your main character does most, if not, all of the fighting. the game plays like a few other fighters i've played, but this feels a bit lighter than the others, though the characters stay on the ground, they look and feel like they could be uppercutted to the moon, its really quick too, i've only played so much of this game but i've already lost about 5 times, the default controls are.... strange, T, F, H, and B, being your directional controls and the buttens to the left -E being your attacks. it would be best you use a game pad if you have one. the game looks really well done, the art design is rather nice and works. the characters and the back grounds are colorful, the characteds look somewhat varied and there is a good combination of main fighters and assist partners. other than that, the game is a sound fighter on a budget and is recommended. 

tldr: gud game, but not the best around


and for a not so serious review... tits, lolis, and panties ohhh my,... and as other reviews have said... i found the fighter who doesnt wear underwear

author: {'steamid': '76561198128735828', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1394182033}
review:
I've been wanting to play this for awhile and finally got BootCamp for my Mac. But I find out the game will be ported to Mac and guess what? It isn't and I'm forced to run BootCamp which wasn't really that big of a deal to me. 
I download the game and guess what else? The controls only work for the fighting comands and not the arrow keys, and its stuck in full screen mode everytime I boot up. So I'm pretty much stuck with this version since BootCamp doesn't update Windows 7 so I can't get the Japanese language pack to get the original game which was always free anyways.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010703299', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 758, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 427, 'last_played': 1603500493}
review:
Vanguard Princess. Yeah, it's a roster of all “cute” females—and a few that might be overly endowed at that—but there’s so much more here than fan service: it’s a true fighter. 

	I should mention right away that I’m a casual gamer (I’m no pro at fighters) and although having a second character (four all together on the screen after your opponent and their partner) took some time to get use to, the game is easy to initially learn if you take some time in practice mode. 

	While the user interface lacks and getting into practice mode isn’t obvious how to activate, this game is mostly about fighting game mechanics. That said, there are some overpowered characters if you’re playing against other people, but if you like playing against the AI, it’s fun when played casually. There’s some intense combos to learn if you put in the time to learn them; and when you learn to use your partner properly, the results are devastating for your opponents. 

	While most your initial opponent’s AIs will be overly easy, the following ones will progressively get challenging until you get to the end boss that all characters must face. For some characters she can be very challenging. But if you’re not winning after a few tries, go back to “Easy Mode” and practice with different partners until you find the one that suits your needs.

	  While VP is all 2D sprite drawn—and not at the highest resolutions to boot—it’s a beautiful game that makes you feel like you’re fighting in an anime; and the music is some of the best I’ve heard for a fighter. On a larger budget and with a little more character balancing this game could give any top-tier fighter a run for its money. Simply put: at the price they’re asking, buy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110385312', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1394291803}
review:
I dislike reviewing games I've not played for at least 20~ hours. But I believe I have a unique perspective on this one:

I don't like fighting games. They just aren't my thing. Yet, I find this game--this very fan-servicey game--to be enjoyable enough to keep playing. Maybe because I look at it from the "one guy made this whole thing whoamg" perspective, and the love put into it oozes out that much more.

This is not a "complex" or "deep" fighting game. As other reviews have noted, it's more in the vein of a classic Street Fighter 2 arcade fighter. Movelists are not long. Mechanics don't take much time to learn or figure out. The act of actually playing it, as a result, becomes more accessible than the MvC-esque series that I simply can't adapt toward. The colorful presentation and beautiful spritework can be taken as a lesson in art direction alone.

As far as user interface, most people's complaints are fairly validated. But none are enough to really detract from the enjoyment. Everything is simple "start the game, pick a mode GO. FIGHT. NOW."

Suggest supplementary movelist guides, as many character attacks are not listed in-game. IE: Aerial Hadokens, Aerial Down+Parry, varying character-to-character on whom has access to which supplementary moves.

o3o

author: {'steamid': '76561197974882257', 'num_games_owned': 537, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1394349652}
review:
ゲーム内容的には素晴らしいがフリー版で十分、タダキーを貰ったらカードを売り払うって用途なら・・・
問題はパブリッシャに信頼が全く置けない。

・2D格闘ツクール2ndの実行ファイル改造品を販売している
・eigoMangaのサーバーに、格ツク海賊版に関連したファイルが置かれていた痕跡がある
・エンターブレインの権利表記を除去していて、正規ライセンスを取ったと思えない
・作者スゲノさんが音信不通で本当に許可を出したのか不明
・許諾を取ったならPrimeバージョンを出すのが筋ではないか？
・二次創作の同人イラストまで無断利用している疑惑あり
・さらにはドット絵をSteamWorksで公募しそうな気配

http://matome.naver.jp/odai/2139398637764808801
http://matome.naver.jp/odai/2138354046813104301
http://matome.naver.jp/odai/2139422862078330901

状況を見る限り黒、もしくは限りなく黒に近いグレーなパブリッシャーであると感じる
VALVEはeigoMANGAの著作権侵害に対する懸念を払拭できるように
パブリッシャに説明責任を果たさせるべきである。

author: {'steamid': '76561198044876469', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1409931827}

author: {'steamid': '76561197960451627', 'num_games_owned': 3565, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1394111816}
review:
Steam版のメリットはランダムセレクトでしか選べないサポートのヒルダが直接選べる点くらい。
外人が勝手にツクールのロゴ表示を消すなど実行ファイルを弄くった結果オンライン対戦ツールから認識されないというデメリットの方がデカい。
Groupees等のバンドル買ったらこれのキーが付いてきたって人はともかく、単品で買う価値は全く無い。
フリー版で遊ぶのをお勧めします。

author: {'steamid': '76561198040325991', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 953, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 882, 'last_played': 1396191558}
review:
15人の可愛い女の子達がパンチラしながら戦う2対2の格闘ゲーム
メインキャラ10人とサポートキャラ5人の中からそれぞれ1人ずつ選び戦う
コンボを持ってるキャラが少ないのでサポートキャラを使いコンボを繋げていく
前貼り二丁拳銃お姉さん、紐パン隻眼巫女、ロリ悪魔などキャラが魅力的だ
カード対応でエモや壁紙も女の子の絵です
元は日本のフリーゲームなのでやりたいだけならそちらをお勧め
フリー版はネット対戦MODあり
ルナ姫木ちゃん！

author: {'steamid': '76561198084522826', 'num_games_owned': 401, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1582098384}
review:
Отличная игра для настоящих фанатов Аниме ! О такой игре только мечать можно было) Игра достойна оценки 10/10 !
Плюсы:
1. Няшность over9000.
2. В игре есть Лоли :3.
3. Много класных и красивых комбо.
4. Хорошо прорисованые персонажи.
5. Очень понравились фоны. На заднем плане даже юбки двигаются от ветра.
6. Интересный сюжет. Сюжет как в Аниме: про магию, боевые искусства, отношения и конец мира.
7. Помощники классные) Няшные и у каждого есть свои способности и не одна.
8. Колекционные карточки это хорошо. Для меня будет честью собрать значок 5-го уровня!
9. К управлению с клавиатурой можно привыкнуть. Но удовольствия больше с гемпадом.
10. Если к игре добавят мастерскую Steam ,то люди станут выпускать моды. А моды это доп персонажи,истории ,комбо и вообще доп. контент. Будет хорошо)
Минусы:
Единственный минус ,что я вижу , это отсутсвие мультиплеера.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966754850', 'num_games_owned': 1178, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1393963483}
review:
Vanguard Princess is pretty terrible. The fighting is good enough, when you can follow the action. It's almost impossible to tell what's going on the screen because of the support characters lingering around in the background. Then there is no d-pad support for controllers, aspect ratio issues for fullscreen, and "fullscreen" is basically a maximized windowed mode. At least I only played $3.50. This game is not even worth the $5 original asking price.

2 of 5

author: {'steamid': '76561198084104925', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1485112390}
review:
This is one of the hardest fighter I ever try, The cpu are pitiless even on the easier difficulty. The fighting style is really fast paced and test your reflex greatly. 

The cast is really diversified and they all have their own fihting technique proper to the character. I will not pronounce myself on the support character because I oly tried two in total but they can pull you out of a dangerous situation quite fast.

Alas the game only have 2 modes being local multiplayer and story, there is no training mode to actually learn the game before being pummeled to the ground by the game AI. 

Even thought let all remember this game was made by only one person and in this sense it is truly a formidable game that have an original story line and beautiful anime animation and graphic, let not forgot it is cheap. I recomend it to fighter games hardcore fans and anime fans that have experience in fighting in general.
