author: {'steamid': '76561197997685725', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1404680766}
review:
เวอร์ชั่นที่เล่น 1.4.1

- ราคาเกม $4.99 ถือว่าไม่แพงสำหรับเกม Dojin
- มี Steam Card ด้วย http://steamcardexchange.net/index.php?gamepage-appid-262150
- ถ้าใครเคยซื้อ Let's Build a Doujin Bundle 2! ของเว็บ Groupees ได้ Steam Key แล้วนะครับ ไปเอา Key กันได้
- เกมนี้ไม่รองรับแฟ้มใน Windows.old (คือถ้าลงวินโดว์ซ้ำ ไฟล์ของเก่าทั้งหมดจะอยู่ที่ชื่อนี้) แต่โดยรวมสามารถลงเกมนี้ได้ทุก Drive
- อย่าลืมกด DLC ของเกมนี้ มันฟรีและกลายเป็นเวอร์ชั่น Director's Cut
- ก่อนเล่น ควรเข้าไปปรับปุ่มกดของ Keyboard เป็นอันดับแรก (ถ้าใช้จอย Xbox360 ไม่ต้องปรับ และแนะนำให้ใช้จอยเล่นเกมนี้)
- การปรับ Option ของเกมนี้ต้องเป็นหน้าต่างของเกมเท่านั้น (Game in Windowe Mode) ถ้าต้องการปรับภาพเต็มจอหรือเล็กลงให้กดปุ่ม F4
- ผมลองใช้จอยโยกของ Fighting Stick EX2 แล้วมีปัญหาบังคับ บน ล่าง ซ้าย ขวา ไม่ได้ (มีใครเป็นบ้างครับ)  
- เกมนี้ไม่มีภาษาญี่ปุ่นแต่เสียงพากย์ในฉากต่อสู้เป็นภาษาญี่ปุ่น

- เกมนี้ไม่มีระบบ online และไม่มีระบบคะแนน
- เกมนี้สามารถหยุดเกมกลางคันได้ (Pause) ต้องกดปุ่ม ESC เท่านั้น และไม่มี Save game ทำให้ผู้เล่นต้องสู้รวดเดียวจนจบ
- เกมนี้ไม่สามารถปรับ Resolution ได้ แม้ว่าจะปรับขนาดเกมเป็น Full screen ก็ตาม
- Resolution ของเกมนี้คือ 640x480
- เกมนี้ 30 Frame rate และบางครั้งเหลือ 20 Frame rate
- เกมนี้ไม่ Sync กับระบบ Steam เช่น การบันทึก Screenshot ในเกม 
- เนื้อเรื่องของเกมสั้นมากกกกกกกก เล่นแปปเดียวจบ
- เนื้อเรื่องของเกมนี้ไม่มีอะไรมาก แค่ Boss ต้องการล้างเผ่าพันธุ์มนุษย์ และตัวละครต้องต่อสู้เพื่อปกป้องโลก
- ปุ่มต่อสู้มีแค่ เบา กลาง หนัก ไม่มีต่อยเบา ต่อยหนัก เหมือนบางเกม
- อาวุธโจมตีจำพวกธนู มีข้อจำกัดการใช้กระสุน ผู้เล่นต้องรอเวลาสักพัก กระสุนจึงจะเต็มเหมือนเดิม 
- อาวุธโจมตีประเภทปืนต้องกดเติมกระสุนเอง ครั้งละ 2 ลูก
- ท่าไม้ตายมีแค่ Gauge เดียว... และท่าไม้ตายโชว์หวิวทุกตัวละคร (ดูทาง Youtube ได้)
- เกมนี้ไม่เน้น Combo แต่เน้นจังหวะการโจมตีมากกว่า
- เกมนี้เน้นเรียกผู้ช่วยมาโจมตี ผู้เล่นสามารถเลือกได้หนึ่งใน 5 ตัวละคร และมีถึง 5 Gauge สูงสุด
- Boss ของเกมนี้ โหดพอๆ กะ Boss ใน King of fighters ของภาคเก่าๆ เลย เพราะท่าโจมตีคล้ายกันมาก 
- Boss ของเกมนี้เก่งเพราะโชว์กางเกงใน

- นางเอก (Yui Kutuna) ในการต่อสู้  เธอ(น่าจะ)โชว์กางเกงในน้อยที่สุดในเกมแต่คนอื่นโชว์กันไม่ยั้ง บางคนแทบจะทุกท่าการโจมตี...
- กางเกงในของตัวละครไม่ซ้ำแบบกัน หรืออย่างน้อยก็ใกล้เคียงกันแต่ไม่เหมือนกัน
- เกมนี้ไม่ใช่เกมต่อสู้ แต่เป็นเกมโชว์กางเกงใน ถ้าไม่เชื่อ เข้าลิงค์นี้ได้ครับ http://steamcommunity.com/app/262150/screenshots/
- ข้างล่างเป็นวิดีโอเนื้อเรื่องของตัวละครตั้งแต่ต้นจนจบครับ (Spoil)

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=235029546

P.S. ในอนาคต เกมนี้รองรับระบบ Steam Workshop ด้วย

author: {'steamid': '76561198006395100', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1541406910}
review:
A fantastic 2D fighter that was and is free (older versions) that's totally worth your time and money.

The game is light on modes/features (just story and versus), but it has an excellet cast of 10 playable characters that are all very different, as well as 5 different support characters that actually feel like a significant addition to the system rather than just a tacked on extra move set.

It's fast, it's fun, and it's not quite as combo-centric as many modern 2D fighters.


Keep in mind that apparently the game has an issue with some xinput controllers, so if you have one, make sure to check out the forums for possible troubleshooting, and if your controller not working is a dealbreaker for you, personally I would suggest downloading one of the older free versions and giving your controller a test run.

Actually, go ahead and download one of the older free versions and give the game a test run anyway. If you think it's worth money, why not show it with a purchase? If not, then at least you were able to give it a good shot with no skin off your back.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000430290', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1478516820}
review:
솔직하게 아쉬움이 많이 남은 게임이다. 
일단 지난 구버전 부터 재미있게 즐겼던지라 4천원은 안아깝지만,
좀 깔것이 많다.

윈도우7 같은 경우(XP, 7 사용중) IME2007 APPCRASH 처음 봤다.
 1.08버전 돌릴때는 안보였던데...

몇몇 컷인 삭제... 이전 무료 배포판이었을때 하셨던 분들이라면 아실텐데...
필살기 적중시 추가 컷인이 있는 캐릭 같은경우는 추가 컷인이 삭제되었다.;;
(...)

다른분들이 지적하신 멀티의 부재도 크다.
덕분에 실제로 게임을 구매 하고 이전 무료배포 1.08버전으로 루나포트 실행중이다.


돈주고 샀더니 무료배포판보다 구린 버전을 받은 느낌...
다만 예전부터 재미있게 플레이해서 후회는 없지만, 
만약 처음 이용하는분들이라면 좀더 버전업후 추가되는 기본 컨텐츠를 확인해보고 구매하는것이 더 나을듯 싶다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090117227', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 6246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1815, 'last_played': 1466678333}
review:
Doujin-игры (иначе говоря японские инди) очень тяжело выбиваются в свет. Их прослойка тем не менее более обширна, чем может показаться. Doujin-файтинги занимают отдельную нишу среди всех Doujin'ов. Это могут быть как сырые проекты, которые так и не найдут продолжения и публику, так и здоровские проекты, которые при желании и старании разработчика станут ничуть не хуже более известных тайтлов.

Vanguard Princess по моему мнению - жемчужина среди Doujin файтингов. Не буду сравнивать её с другими отличными Doujin как Melty Blood, так как механики разные, плюс пост не об этом. Несмотря на то, что она сделана в далёком 2009-м в FIghter Maker 2D, конструкторе, в котором и делаются в основном Doujin-файтинги, иногда кажется, что игра переплюнула его возможности, настолько много факторов и механик присутствует в игре. 

Пожалуй разберу плюсы и минусы:
+Большое количество тактик и комбинаций связок персонажей, обеспечивающие бОльшую соревновательность.
+Большое количество игровых параметров и механик, что также сказывается на соревновательности.
+Несмотря на сложность, вхождение в игру менее болезненное, особенно если уже есть опыт в файтингах. Во многом это реализуется из-за наличия относительно лёгких персонажей (не буду говорить каких, сами выясните)
+Игра не строится на принципе "заучи ололо длиннющее комбо и вынеси им противника", это пожалуй главный плюс.
+Босс реально заставляет попотеть (да, я соглашусь, что он работает по принципу "я знаю, что вводит игрок, поэтому я сейчас его за это накажу", но лучше так, чем босс, который раз в 5 секунд бьёт вам в блок; босса вполне возможно победить), что сильно выпрямит руки.
+У игры уже есть турнирный опыт, никто не жаловался :)
+У разработчика действительно есть желание продвигать игру и вводить в неё новые функции, для создания которых он пересел на новый движок. (Steam-версия уже на новом)
+Анимешное графическое оформление на любителя (но даже мне, не особому поклоннику аниме, понравилось)
+Есть хорошая база данных в интернете и каналы про-игроков на Youtube с полезными видео.

Толковых минусов лично для себя я пока что не обнаружил, однако некоторым может не понравиться, что:
-Плохо работает с непопулярными контроллерами
-Звук не настраивается
-Нет Steam оверлея (в процессе)
-Нет нетплея (тоже в процессе, в старых версиях осуществлялся через MTSP)
-Опять же босс. Эх, казуалы :)
-Уж слишком лоликонская игра, да, этого не отнять (но лично мне всё равно)


Вердикт - брать 100%, цена просто отличная, но кстати может повыситься, когда введут новые штуки.
Больше поддержим разработчика - быстрее введут плюшки.

Ну как-то так.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061945298', 'num_games_owned': 453, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1396130549}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970690368', 'num_games_owned': 8561, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1394002076}
review:
Note: I only meant to buy a pigeon dating sim, but this game was in the bundle with it.

Started the game. Picked two fighters at random. Both are little girls. Actually, they're all little girls. Most are in disturbingly revealing clothing. The older-looking of my two characters is actually clutching a teddy bear as she fights. I also grabbed the free "Director's Cut" DLC which, as it turns out, does nothing but remove the censor-shadows from the original version that would have kept me from seeing these little girls' panties.

I only played for a single round, but I'm pretty sure I'm a registered sex offender now.

Left the game running for a while after that to mine for Steam cards to sell, while I went and took a long shower in a futile effort to feel clean again. At least creepy anime cards tend to have a surprisingly high value on the market... I don't like to think of why that is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068452370', 'num_games_owned': 340, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1394004216}
review:
I have yet to feel the urge to review a game here on Steam. However, this game was so unpolished that I didn't think it was worth the 4 bucks I spent on it. The game starts as expected with a small intro giving the characters a reason to fight. There are two basic modes to this game Story and Versus. There is also a Practice mode hidden within versus but in order to activate it the 2nd player must press the "do nothing" button (p). Although you can pause in versus and story mode you will not see a move list until you enter story mode, and only when you are choosing your characters. I played with every character and every assist character in versus before going into story mode. All the characters provide the stereotypical style mix of sorcery, martial arts, and gun play. None of this is outside of what I had expected. What I didn't expect to find is that the only method for changing your control scheme is outside of your game in the options tab of the window. There you will also find the stage select, number of rounds, and timer for versus. There are seven stages and you can have from 1 to 9 rounds. Now the timer can be set all the way up to 99 on a sliding bar, so even in practice mode there is no infinite round.

 The battles themselves present a unique idea. The two main girls fight agiainst one another, building up momentum to unleach super attacks. While those two girls fight they are each being followed by a girl who assists them with various abilities. These abilities are restriced to an energy bar that slowly builds up during the match. The assist characters may only be used if the main character is standing on the ground and actively in combat with the other. Which means you cannot be jumping or more than arms length from the other character. There is also no way of being able to tell what attack exactly the assist character will unleash until you have learned their various moves. Even still there is no way of directly controling them except sometimes it seems the movements of your main will affect how your assist will attack. I did find that sometimes having 4 characters on screen did make me lose track of my main character. This problem is made even worse when you find yourself in battle with assist character Hilda. Hilda doesn't move herself but summons two very large dolls to deal attacks for her. When I had made it to the final boss I had 5 - 7 girls on screen at one time. Needless to say I was suprised to see that I had one that fight.

 I would be remiss if I forgot to talk about the story mode. Everything is pretty standard. Start at the beginning and fight through girls until you reach the final boss. I was playing for speed so I played on easy with two rounds. Here you can see the greatest weakness of the game shine. The girls are severely unbalanced. Lilth the smallest fighter is by far the biggest challenge as she guards against most attacks and uses her grabs to interupt the rest. Even fighting her in the first stage was more of a challenge than it should of been. All the AI girls are quicker and spam the same moves during your battles. One of the others Kaede who is one of my favorites has 2 of her attacks all with the same input stream, so I never know which one I end up with. All the attack streams are very similar, which is nice. This game delivers on most of what I had expected from it, cheap thrills for fans of anime girls and combat games. It is a good example of a unique idea. However with so much wrong with the interface and AI that this game seems more like a beta than a finished product.

review: I've been playing this over the years and here's what I think. It's been increasingly getting better and better every year. With newer updates and characters that were added throughout the years. And for now this year, it's a steam compatible game! Not only that there's a director's cut version for those of you naughty people out there who are into anime erotica stuff. Come'on let's all face why 30/20/50 of the buyers are either anime lovers or into fighers or in this case into skimppy outfits. Either way this game is great to play for kickbacks with friends. It's really user friendly since there isn't 1 minute combo system to master. Also it's cheaper to pick it up now since it's on sale. unless you lucky dogs already have a key given during the groupee sale. My only complaint for the game was that there wasn't an official online mode, so you could play with friends all around. But in the end of the day, it's a win win right? I mean who wouldn't wanna kickback to a skimppy fighter once in awhile! xD

author: {'steamid': '76561198034127693', 'num_games_owned': 1307, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1393989663}
review:
This game is pretty fun for the small amount you pay. A handful of colorful girls and some interesting moves. Although it's breaking point is the poor set up for controls, menus, and no option to set your screen res. I have had mulitiple times where I could not move my character at all yet I was pressing the correct keys I set up. It is also a pain to end your current match because you have to press a bunch of buttons.

Overall if you want a cheap yet fun game that can amuse you from time to time I say get it. Other wise if you are looking for a serious and all around fighting game then look elsewhere.

If you like 2D fighting games with hard-hitting ladies this is for you!

author: {'steamid': '76561198039882189', 'num_games_owned': 189, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1394111213}
review:
Decepcionante.
jugue este juego cuando era freeware, y de donde no deberia haber salido, y me gusto mucho como tal para echar unos combates en plan rapido y divertido, quizas ocn las espectaivas bajas de un freeware las cumple, no tenia tutorial ni manera legible de encontrar que boton hace cada cosa, pero para ser uin juego gratis y echarte un apr de combates divertidos con un amigo te buscas un poco la vida, y te entretenia.
Pero, despues de haber pagado por el bundle en elq ue venia, y lo mucho que tardaron en dar una version del juego completo aunque fuese por descarga en la paguina, por el temor de los desarrolles en la pirateria ... han hecho una enorme mierda.
Debverian haberse preocupado menos por la pirateria, y mas por terminar de pulir un buen juego que tenian y venderlo como algo mas "serio", por que esas expectativas no las cumple:

-configuracion del juego: Esta en una barra de la ventana superior, en un recuadro de opciones, en lugar de estar integrado dentro del propio juegos, y las opciones no son muy amplias que digamos, al menos te admite un gamepad (Aunque para jugar con D-pad en lugar de stick, tendras que usar un programa externo)
-Interfaz: Simple, quizas demasiado, han puesto un fondo nuevo respecto a la version freeware, y sigue teniendo solo dos opciones, Historia y VS...
-No online: Si quieres jugar contra un amigo, lo normal en juegos de pelea, te lo traes a casa, como en los ´90
-Tutorial: Inexistente, aprende el sistema sobre la marcha
-Modo entrenamiento: Dificil de encontrar, como minimo, tienes que iniciar un combate versus, mirarte cuales son los controlas del Jugador 2, pausar y usar un par de botones a la vez para usar el modo entrenamiento (boton "x" + "a",  donde "a" me presupongo que es el ataque ligero, ya que no se indica en ningun lugar simple, y "x" todavia no se cual es) .... ¿Tan dificil era poner un modo entrenamiento en el menu de inicio? Ademas, si quieres saber la lista de comandos de tu personaje ... bueno, lo miras en el modo historia antes de elegirlo, por que no viene en otro sitio dentro del juego.

-Lo bueno: Traduccion completa al ingles, bugs corregidos, y un personaje de soporte mas.

... lo minimo, muy minimo para pasar de freeware a pago.

En resumen, era un gfran juego entre la liga alq ue estaba en sus inicios, destacaba sobre el resto, pero el escalon que se suponian que tendrian que haber subido se ha limitado a un simple lavado de cara.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027295173', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1656775004}
review:
This game has some of the most exquisite 2D art I have ever seen. Its plays very well and gives enough challenge and variate to warrant the already, very low price. Some say it was made by one man and is available as freeware. Well I'm here to say its all a pack of god damn lies. Google it kids.
Anyway, the game is really lacking when it comes to video options.
The game has one resolution and if you go full-screen it stretches from its original 4:3 into 16:9. Unless you are playing on a 4:3 monitor in which case aspect ratio is the least of you problems. Get ready to start dicking around with the old video card options.
Another thing that twisted my nipple was the fact that there is no score, no ranking, nothing to unlock. Each time you play the game is like the first time you boot it up. It feels detached and cold. I want my sexy underage schoolgirl fighting games to remember who I am and welcome me by name each time I play.

Overall I recommend this game to people who like everything that I like and have the exact same taste as me. Or a clone of me, because I'm pretty sure they would all like it too.

86 wigwams out of 100!

author: {'steamid': '76561198042270062', 'num_games_owned': 570, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1522355770}
review:
คะแนน 5/10

Vanguard Princess เป็นเกมแนวต่อสู้ของเหล่าสาวๆ (อีกแล้ว) โดยในเกมจะเป็นแบบ 2มิติ และใช้ภาพสไตล์อนิเมะ (การ์ตูนญี่ปุ่น) การต่อสู้จะเป็นแบบตัวต่อตัวเท่านั้น (แต่จะมีผู้ช่วยอีกฝ่ายละ 1คน) เป็นเนื้อเรื่องของเหล่าสาวๆ ที่ได้รับพลังพิเศษ และมีบางคนที่ต้องการใช้พลังพิเศษนี้เพื่อทำลายล้างโลก จึงมีอีกกลุ่มรวมตัวกันเพื่อต่อต้าน

ในเกมนี้จะเน้นการจับจังหวะเพื่อโจมตีมากกว่าการทำคอมโบ จะมีปุ่มที่ใช้โจมตีเพียง 3 ปุ่ม คือ โจมตีหนัก โจมตีปานกลาง และโจมตีเบา (ไม่มีแยกต่อยกับเตะ) และสองปุ่มพิเศษเป็นการป้องกัน และปุ่มเรียกให้ผู้ช่วยโจมตี

จุดเด่นของเกมนี้จะอยู่ที่กางเกงใน.. (55 เอาใหม่ๆ) ..จุดเด่นของเกมนี้จะอยู่ที่ผู้ช่วยของเราที่สามารถเลือกได้ 1 คน ผู้ช่วยแต่ละคนจะมีสกิลหลายรูปแบบเป็นของตัวเอง สามารถนำมาประกอบกับท่าโจมตีของตัวละครหลักได้ ทำให้มีการโจมตีที่หลากหลายมากขึ้น

ข้อเสียคือ บางครั้งฉากหลังกับตัวละครกลมกลืนกันเกิน เกมมีโหมดให้เลือกเล่นน้อย ไม่สนับสนันการเล่นแบบออนไลน์ ไม่มีออฟชั่นการปรับแต่งใดๆ ไม่รองรับกับหน้าจอกว้าง (ไม่รองรับ 16:9 จะบังคับให้เป็น 4:3 เท่านั้น)

โดยภาพรวม Vanguard Princess ยังเป็นเกมที่ค่อนข้างฉาบฉวย เหมือนเป็นเกมที่ยังไม่เสร็จ ระบบหลายอย่างยังไม่สมบูรณ์เมื่อเทียบกับเกมต่อสู้อื่นๆในตลาด ยกเว้นแค่ระบบต่อสู้ที่ดูจะสมบูรณ์ที่สุดแล้ว ถ้าเป็นคนชอบเกมสไตล์อนิเมะญี่ปุ่น ชอบดูแฟนเซอวิส และสามารถมองข้ามจุดด้อยไปได้ ก็ถือว่าเกมนี้ต่อสู้ที่สนุกใช้ได้ ในราคาที่ประหยัดอีกเกม

author: {'steamid': '76561197976129439', 'num_games_owned': 715, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1393966760}

author: {'steamid': '76561198017064420', 'num_games_owned': 446, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1393973185}
review:
I enjoy Vanguard Princess.  I'm a long time fighting game player, so it was quite easy to pick up the basics of this game. 

It's got a neat twist on the use of assists. Rather than just a single button press, you can use directions in addition to the press and the assists will do different things (depending on the amount of meter they have.)There's a button mapped just for parries and that can be a more advanced tactic than your standard figting game. I did not have any problems with the use of a fight stick. Everything worked right on the first try. I am not sure what the bug is that is causing other users to have issues with fightpads/sticks. 

I installed the Director's Cut, but I didn't see any of the "mature" content. It flies by so fast that you really have to be looking for it. (or just check the community hub, they've spent the time and taken screen shots). The tiny resolution is a bit of a pain, as you're going to have to guess on the proper aspect ratio when enlarging the screen.

Overall, I'm happy to have purchaed it, I look forward to seeing how different assists compliment the main characters. I see the promise of some obnoxious juggles. (juggles, not jiggles).   It looks to be a solid game and I hope people do not overlook it due to the anime style.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043799346', 'num_games_owned': 560, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1533615531}

author: {'steamid': '76561198093010030', 'num_games_owned': 388, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 685, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 685, 'last_played': 1436474642}
review:
This game is pretty well despite not having online mode.  I really like the characters and art style of the game, but that's pretty much really the few redeeming factors of this game.  The game is hard, even on easy mode. Since there isn't a tutorial option in the menu, (you only have two choices, Story or VS. take your pick) most of the time you'll be mashing buttons to know what to do.  Maybe I'm not that good at fighting games to understand why.  Also the final boss is an arse.  Don't expect much replay value from this game after you've done beating Story mode once or twice.

One thing I highly forgot to mention about this game is that controller support is HORRIBLE. Dont even bother using a controller playing this game because it will never work. Use the keyboard at all times, if you use the controller your fighter wont do whatever you input the controls to do.

Also Lilith is best girl. :3

author: {'steamid': '76561198007700014', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 266, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 235, 'last_played': 1445927124}
review: I got to admit that the art style is amazing. The combat is very simple, but very good. I've read people saying that they can't use a fightstick and it's a bit of a problem, but after looking around finding a solution I came across Xpadder which can make you use any controller and bind keys from the keyboard to it, and I am using a Madcatz fightstick pro and works perfectly with it   http:// adf.ly/e3qpw just in case anyone needs it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008934137', 'num_games_owned': 1955, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1393949715}
review:
평가 올리려고 게임 샀다 ㅡㅡ

다른건 둘째치고 퍼블리셔가 무단으로 게임을 들고와서 게임을 판매한다는 개소리는 좀 자중하자. 


그리고 현재의 네트워크 대전 미지원에 가려져서 모두가 간과하고 있는 사실이 있는데, 스팀에서 게임을 사면 게임의 업데이트도 자동으로 된다. 혹여 제작자가 잠수 풀고 네트워크 플레이 지원 가능하게 만들면, 스팀에서는 알아서 패치 해 준다는 말임. 

물론 지금 당장에 "왜 네트워크 지원도 안되는 무료버전이랑 똑같은 게임을 돈받고 파는가?" 하는 비난을 피할수는 없겠지만. 나도 거기엔 실로 유감.

다음으로 상점 페이지를 보면 "Steam 창작마당" 이라는 항목이 있다.

창작마당으로 게임 열심히 해 본 게이머들은 알겠지만, 요거 하나로도 게임이 무궁무진하게 변한다. 무료버전에선 상상도 못할 거대한 변화를 눈앞에 두고 있음.

개인적으로는 지속적인 버전의 확인을 하지 않아도 된다는 점, 창작마당을 지원 한다는점, 트레이딩 카드를 지원 한다는 점, 라딸이 가능하다는 점, 뱃지 보상이 씹덕한게 좋다는 점 만으로도 가치는 충분하지 않을까 생각함. 


과연 이런 차이점을 두고도 "공짜게임 돈받아먹고 파네 ㅉㅉ" 하고 욕만 할수 있겠는가 한다.

나도 원래 큰 할인 때 사려고 했는데, 비난만하고 앞으로의 가능성은 전혀 보지 않는 사람들이 많은거 같아서 지금 사서 글을 씀.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041436430', 'num_games_owned': 1440, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1393949023}

author: {'steamid': '76561198118862745', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1410431860}
review:
1인이 개발했다고 믿을 수 없는 퀄리티의 격투게임.
이전 무료로 웹배포가 이루어졌으나 북미버전으로 만들면서 스팀에 입점하게 되었다.
많은 사람들이 넷플이 안돼는 반쪽짜리라느니, 이전에 무료로 배포한 물건을 이 돈을 주고 구할 가치가 없다라고 이야기하는데...
그러면 다른 인디게임은 대체 왜 돈주고 하는가? 그 논리대로라면 수많은 인디게임이 DRM Free인 상태로 유포돼 돌아다니지 않은가?
자신이 만들고 싶은 것을 만들겠다고 전 세계에서 알아주는 일류 게임회사를 사표쓰고 나와, 혼자서 만든 상업 게임에 버금가는 퀄리티의 게임에 대해 응원과 찬사를 날려주지는 못할망정 인디의 도전정신을 짓밟는 소리를 하는 당신.
당신은 인디게임을 하면서 인디정신을 논할 가치가 없다.
제작자는 열정과 그 결과물을 제대로 평가받을 권리가 있다. 게임개발자는 땅파먹고 사는 존재가 아니기 때문에.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030541576', 'num_games_owned': 4118, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1418535762}
review:
フリーゲーム版は散々遊びましたが、このsteam版に関しては苦々しい思いしかありません
バンドルとしてキーがきましたので、レビューではなく他ユーザへの警鐘となればいいとおもいます

とりあえずコノゲームの開発の問題点として下記のURLにてまとめられてます
http://matome.naver.jp/odai/2138354046813104301

このゲームが正規なものであるものかが不明です。
正直発売されたことにも驚きがあります、いつ消されてもおかしくはないと思います。

内容自体も変化してないどころか劣化点がそこかしこに見受けられます
フリー版で使用できたセガサターンパッドなどのパッドが認識できないなど意味が分かりません
フリー版は外部ツールでネット対戦も問題なく可能なのに、こちらは一切できません

これにお金を払うのでしたら、本来の製作者であるスゲノトモアキさんにペイパルなどで送金したいぐらいです
残念ながらスゲノさんが活動を停止しているため、このsteam版に対しての対応・反応があるのかが現状不明です

スゲノさまの生存確認がされない限り、コノゲームはほぼ真っ黒なままでしょう。

author: {'steamid': '76561198065447079', 'num_games_owned': 2293, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 170, 'last_played': 1394023074}
review:
Pros:
-Kawaii animu girls, very well drawn sprites.
-Copious amounts of fanservice.
-You get to control a tag team of 2 girls vs another team of 2, so it's twice the fanservice.
-Did I mention there's steam trading cards? The game is almost free if you sell the cards on the market to weeabos like me.

Cons:
-NO ONLINE MULTIPLAYER. This is largely my only serious gripe about this game.
-Controls feel somewhat clunkier compared to other 2D fighters like Skullgirls. There is no D-pad support as far as I know.

TLDR; Get Skullgirls instead. If you already own Skullgirls (like me), go ahead and buy this glorious nippon game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055089474', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 234, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1393944993}
review:
Game is incredibly misleading. Advertises as a 2 on 2 fighting game, and steam claims "Local Co-op". This is all lies.
You cannot play alongside a friend, only play AGAINST a local player. The 'second member' of your fighting team is a support character who seems to do very little for you.

Character designs are generic, resolution is very small, controls are badly set up by default, interfaces are shoddy and irritating to navigate.
The only nice thing I can say, is the visuals/animations are pretty.

Overall, TERRIBLE game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999055738', 'num_games_owned': 1324, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1393945893}
review:
基本同人游戏水平，画面不错，人设满满的动画的感觉，但是全屏效果较差而且没办法像商店截图那样拉伸
游戏只有故事模式和vs模式，不仅没办法联机对战，连训练模式和基本设置都没办法调整，完成度太低，目前除了喜+1卖卡片合成萌系背景外没多大意义

author: {'steamid': '76561197991200082', 'num_games_owned': 1592, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1433103251}
review: Apparently, the Japanese version of this game is free, but I'd say that the version that's on Steam is worth the money. Vanguard Princess is a well-animated game that seems to have just enough depth to keep things interesting without overwhelming you with ridiculous combos. I wish the assist characters were on different planes, as things can get a bit too busy from a graphical perspective at times, but you'll adjust to this once you become more familiar with the characters.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047822662', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 718, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 309, 'last_played': 1408512913}

author: {'steamid': '76561198042041061', 'num_games_owned': 926, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1438344385}
review: This game is straight up garbage. Like, just on a technical level, it's missing so many features and does so many things wrong. First off, you can't use the d-pad. AT ALL. You're forced to use the analog stick. And anyone who plays 2D fighters can tell you that the analog stick is the WORST possible control method to use. Even worse than the 360 pad's subpar d-pad. There's no option to change resolution, there's no modes outside of Story and VS, it's just such a barebones, lazy game from a technical standpoint (it actually makes it all the worse that the character sprites are so well animated when the rest of the game is awful) that it's no wonder they're only charging five bucks for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024414757', 'num_games_owned': 332, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1416000487}

author: {'steamid': '76561198012521069', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1394376600}
review:
게임 자체는 꽤 휼륭한 퀄리티. 1.08 버전보다 효과가 더 들어간 덕에 격겜 쯔꾸르 게임 주제에 블블과의 연출을 비슷하게 표현할 정도....

아쉬운 것은 넷플은 아직 넷플기를 써야 한다는 것. Fighting is Magic과 같은 엔진이므로 MTSP 써주시면 됩니다. 그리고 사시려면 일단 무료공개된 1.0x 버전부터 해보시고 판단하시는게 좋을 듯.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020449229', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1394036778}
review: Итак, не знаю с чего начать. Поэтому начну с того, что эту игру я могу порекомендовать только анимушникам вроде меня, нормальные любители 2д файтингов идите играйте в guilty gear, или если все же хотите женского мордобоя, то в skullgirls. Думаю стоит начать с того, чего в игре меньше всего это минусы. В игре есть только один существенный минус, это- механика. Она жутко стандартная для 2д файтинга, особо останавливаться на ней я не буду, ибо все стандартно, а конкретно нужно придрачиваться,   даааа. Запомните пару тройку комбинаций для своей тни и готово, но сложность порой заставит ваши маленькие ручки попотеть. Есть система помощника, но подобное есть в тех же skullgirls, да и в arcana heart это было более круто реализовано. Теперь плюсы, а плюсы здесь мой маленький любитель аниму, это те самые героини, которые здесь сделаны очень даже хорошо. Я поделю их на 3 группы. 1) лоли их в игре полно, рай для лоликонщика и тесак не придерется. 2) стандартные, обычная грудь и юбка, но о юбках позже. 3) большегрудые, их мало, равно как и одежды на них. Вы спросите " а хуле ты тут про сиськи нам загоняешь йопта?" да все просто, это аниме файтинг который сделали японцы, вся суть аниме битв с девушками это когда - головы бьются, а сиськи трясутся. И в этом игра хороша, у пары персонажей отличные панцушоты, ибо под каждой юбкой есть по одной турбине самолета. Сюжет, серьезно? Ладно, можно прочесть пару диалогов, но все ограничивается " у меня меч толще, мне его дед из полена сделал!" ну вы поняли. Так же радует цена, советую поддержать разрабов, сделали нормальную игру за хорошие деньги и не выебываются. Для карточкодрочеров есть карточки, да и мастерская вроде как будет работать, а значит много интересных модов от сообщества.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988922281', 'num_games_owned': 3134, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 254, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 254, 'last_played': 1394049641}
review:
It is to be expected from a game developed with Fighter Maker to have lackluster options though at the very least a few more gamemodes would have been nice.. despite of that, it's quite obvious why anyone would want this game amirite..? ..because of the amazingly intricate and captivating storyline, huehuehue.

Even if you're not familiar with the original release from years back, you may recognize some of the characters if you have previously been into the M.U.G.E.N scene a lot. The most prominent character is probably the one most people would recognize; that of course being, Luna Himeki.. Pink hair, wields two guns and notorious for her interesting choice of undergarment.

If you're looking for a great 2D fighter game, there are much better games out there. Guilty Gear, Blazblue just to name a few (or if you like the female characters scene, Skullgirls). The fighting in this game is pretty decent really but in all honesty.. with the drawbacks of this game (few gamemodes, engine limits and no online play) the only thing going for it is the 'anime appeal' by which we all know implies to otaku culture. Whilst playing this game, I can't help but expect something 'bad' to happen to one of the characters at any given time.. but that may be a different problem I'm dealing with, oh well.

In short: good game but there's much better among the genre, take your pick.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001199803', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 4962, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2458, 'last_played': 1459919724}
review:
Don't forget to grab the free DLC after getting the game!

I recommend using joy2key to play with any joypads, the native joypad support isn't awesome.
http://joytokey.net/en/

No native online play. Use MTSP, for use with Fighter Maker 2nd games.
http://wiki.mizuumi.net/w/Vanguard_Princess/Netplay

You can enable practice mode by playing vs and pressing the no action key for player 2 and no action key for player 1, default e and p. Make sure to set the round time to 0=unlimited in option>game so the round doesn't end.

You can return to the main menu on the esc screen by holding down WeakNormalStrong, default a,s,d

author: {'steamid': '76561197990503643', 'num_games_owned': 1005, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 514, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 444, 'last_played': 1447127913}
review:
오래된 게임인만큼 OS플랫폼에 대한 호환성은 좋지 않다.
Windows 8에서 수행은 가능하나 전체화면 전환시
전환이 되지 않고 Window 모드상에서 화면이 1/4로 줄어들고 녹색으로 출력된다.
또한 플레이 도중 프레임 드롭(지연현상)이 발생한다.

지원하는 게임모드는 스토리 모드, VS모드 인데 스토리는 싱글 플레이만 가능하고,
VS모드는 한 입력장치를 공유하는 방식이다.

여태까지의 게임이 그렇지만, 그럭저럭 플레이할 만한 게임성이다.
다만, 실망한점은 스팀으로 옮겨오면서 무료 게임 배포시절과 전혀 변화없는 게임성때문에,
(*주) 스팀으로 옮겨오면서 멀티 플레이어 기능에 보강이 이루어질거라고 알고 있었음. 구매를 결정한 사유도 이때문이었음)
카드 농사용 게임으로 전락할 가능성이 높다.

판매전에 다른 상점에서 구입하지 않은이상
급하게 스팀에서 3.74달러를 주고 살필요는 없다.
꼭 사고 싶다면 정기 세일할때까지 기다릴 것

author: {'steamid': '76561197991540625', 'num_games_owned': 1300, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1393925370}
review:
I don't think a fighting game has made me so miserable before.  I've laughed at schlock like Karnov's Revenge and World Heroes, I've nearly dozed off with Divekick, but only Vanguard Princess has sucked out all of the joy from a 2D fighter and just pissed me off.

Starting at the title screen, there's only two options: Story Mode and Versus. The lack of a Training Mode is really disappointing, and while the character select screen shows the movelist of each character, not being able to tool around with combos or just figure out the characters before jumping into a match isn't cool. There's no online play, and even if there was, I wouldn't have much faith in a doujin title having good netcode anyway, so I suppose I can't be too offended. The main deal here is that the game is naturally in windowed mode and still shows the toolbar, which is where the actual options are located. There's barely anything to tweak besides the controls (not even sound), and that also leads to a major caveat of the game. While the buttons can be configured simply enough with a very Visual Basic-esque window, the movement options are greyed out if you are configuring a controller or arcade stick. This is because the movement is permanently mapped to an analog stick, so a DPad or even an arcade stick won't work. Both of these options are infinitely preferable to using the analog stick, and Vanguard Princess doesn't give them to you.

You select two characters in this game; a generic, uninspired main anime girl and a loli assist. Getting into a match, the game has three basic attack buttons, a deflect button and a button to spam your assist, who is always on screen following your character around. While the game looks anime as hell (and it sure is animated well), the game isn't very combo friendly like an anime fighter. Actual combat comes off as either mashing buttons and seeing what normals connect, or spamming specials mindlessly. While this might sound surprisingly reminiscent of classic fighting games from the early 90s, it feels far more braindead and like it requires little to no strategy. It's also hard to concentrate on since the screen is absolutely cluttered with characters, including the two main fighters, both assist characters, and lots of characters in the stage background that tend to blend in the action.

What's left is a basic, spammy, braindead 2D fighter that's a mess to look at and not very much fun at all, while also completely lacking in options and modes. I'm still just completely baffled that I can't use my arcade stick, but I don't suppose the game is worth it anyway.

Too bad weeaboos desperate for anything anime-themed on Steam will buy this garbage anyway, though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007738668', 'num_games_owned': 2286, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1573935836}
review: I'm really happy this game is on steam, and in english, and, best of all with the uncensored content! Anyone who likes anime and fighting games, this is a must have for what its worth! Tomoaki Sugeno is a fighting game god in his own right, for doing this whole game ALONE, selecting music and sound effects he could afford, voice acttresses out of his own pocket and still coming up with a game that is alot better then much of the crap the larger companies put out costing millions and millions to make. I wish other games like this would come to steam, personally I would pay anything for some of the Nitro+ games, specially Nitro Royale which is my favorite fighting game up there with any SNK or Arc System Works game. It doesnt have much in terms of detph, the roster is limited, but the music and sound are great, the controls are tight and responsive and I love how the animation is fluid and built around the game. The only set back is the resolution is limited since it was done on the Fighter Maker 2nd, and so when you play full screen will have to fiddle with the screen or just play windowed. You might be able to still get the japanese version free I think or the censored english version elsewhere, but its nice to have it on steam, in english and with the original content.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005435460', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1394351139}
review:
[u] BUYER BEWARE, AT THIS MOMENT THERE IS NO ONLINE-PLAY [/u]
Over the many years I played this game with buds, I never expected this Dōjin(Indie) game to release for western audiences.
While the super-cutesy artstyle may drive people away [i](Or attract, I mean dem pantsu sho-)[/i].
What lies here is a 2on2 indie fighting game gem, created by ex-capcom employee sprite artist: Tomoaki Sugeno (Suge9). Catchy music, great sprite art and one of the best displays of pixel animation I've seen, this is actually some pretty quality stuff. Once you actually play with another person who knows the game, it's very absurd, yet very fun and easy to learn. whether your on a  fightstick, keyboard, or controllers [b]none of the inputs are overwhelming[/b] and can be mastered with abit of practice.

While the game itself is simple, there is not much in terms of content as it is a doujin-soft that was orginally freeware. It's still nice to see doujin soft appear on the steam market.
There was a netcode patch for the freeware version, but if it gets patched into this version that would be great. (They did note that they will be updating this game, so there is hope)

This current version of the game seems to be slighty different from 1.08, and the port itself was made from the permission of Suge9 for the[b] 2011 Japan Earthquake for fundraising at anime expos.[/b] While its not the best, it was done with good intent and what needs to be there is there. As in what the revenue is going towards, we don't know possibly more work done on the game.

The cast consits of all kinds of fighting game playstyles from: Eri the rekka, Luna the stance switcher, to even a loli that is the grappler. All of which have glorified panty-flashes(lol).

[b]PIXELMOE(7.5)/10[/b], the price of the game makes sense, even with a local-only play it's still great cheap fighting fun. [b][u]Hell if your really cheap you can just download the free version. Google it, it will pop up instantly.[/u][/b] If you are playing with another person its 8.5/10 levels of fun. It's easily worth 4.99$.

If your looking for something different form the usual fighting game, and have some buddies over I reccomend picking this up for some controller-tossing laughs. Otherwise move on from this moeblob panties n tit's pixel 2D Fighter.

Controller inputs seemed to be bugged at the moment, however you can work around this with X-Padder. Also yes there is a practice mode.

review:
It's actualy a pretty good fighting game if you look past the fact some of the fighters might need to put on more clothes. 

For just $3, the combat and animation is pretty smooth.

The fighters might need a better combo system or maybe just more moves in their list. But it would be nice if when you pause it you can look at the characters moves just in case you forget how to do a move so you don't get suplexed by a loli with a teddy bear the next time you fight.

If anything, I'll give this game a 7/10.
But still pick this up and play it sense it's a cheap fighter that doesn't hurt your wallet too much.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007239292', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1393906545}
review:
Vanguard Princess was the best game I have bought in the last hour. I have found it to be both noisy and brightly colored. It will occasionally react to keyboard input, although it is crucially missing the "Just dispense the tradng cards already" button. Rumor has it that that will be in the next DLC.

In combat, you must choose the direction of attack and movement (presumably combined because moving in one direction and attacking in the other would weaken the dimensional infrastructure), and the type of attack (Weak, Normal, Strong). My personal favorite is "Weak" - because really, why bother with an attack unless it's a really weak one.

Character selection screen needs some work, as you can't get a really good feel for the interpersonal relationships between the primary fighter and her assistant or cosmetologist or whatever the second girl is supposed to be for. I mean sure, Kaede can use "Godspeed Bloodbath" (actual in-game move name, BTW), but is Hilda really down with that? She really strikes me more as a "heavy on the bloodbath part, ease off on the Godspeed", so you know, maybe some ideological differences down the road there.

I would recommend this to anyone who enjoys pressing the attack key quite often. Also if you feel that the current crop of games have too many pants-wearing characters. Because they don't have that in this game. Overall, a good design choice, as the money that could have been spent on pants went instead to some stellar voice acting talent. When they grunt with exertion or make a surprised exclamation, it's like you are actually there. More to the point, it's like real life because there are no apparent audio controls.

Finally as a service to those who were looking a "how anime is it"? breakdown: It is slightly more chibi than Skyrim, somewhere between Farming SImulator and Payday 2 in kawaii and moe, and more loli and  ecchi than DOTA.

Bottom line: If you DO like anime and DON'T like pants, you'll like this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020785598', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1409144323}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198017086725', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1393899683}
review:
This game does not work.  Period.  When they say full controller support, they are LYING.  The DPAD doesn't work, at all.  Yes, I'm using a real 360 pad.  Also, some of the controls for "Player 2" which are required to select your opponent evne if you're going single player, do not work.  At all.  I can't even select my opponent except whatever the default one is.  

Next issue:  You can't quit the game.  There is no exit option.  You have to task kill it or whatever.  That's pretty terrible.  

I'm gonna give this game another go later and see if I can figure out workarounds for these issues, but if they require any real hassle whatsoever, I would say that these are huge black marks on the game.  You shouldn't have to use other resources to make a game WORK.  

If you want a fighting game, go get Skullgirls or Mortal Kombat or something.  If you want ass and titties, go look at porn.  It's free.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047568402', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1393952958}
review:
The pros of this game are pretty obvious: beautiful 2D graphics, low price, and can be fun to play.  However, there are a few details that prevent this game from doing so:

No tutorial or training mode
No Fightstick support (a personal preference, though Joy2Key may fix that problem)
Not exactly easy to learn combos.
Also, no online play (which one would expect to be absent in a $5 game)

This game has the potential to be a masterpiece, but lacks the proper elements of such.  If you're looking to get into fighting games, go for something like Street Fighter or Skullgirls. They have tutorials and training modes, they're easier to learn, and they also look beautiful.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035939011', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1393948576}
review:
어떤 대상을 평가를 할때 그대상을 객관적으로 바라보기는 불가능하다고 생각하는쪽입니다.
게다가 그 대상을 평가하기위해 여러가지를 찾아본다면 더더욱 그대상을 평가할때 뒤에 배경이 보이기 마련입니다.

이게임은 전 캡콤 직원 '스게노 토모아키'가 퇴사 후 혼자서 3년 반동안 제작한 게임입니다.
하루16시간 가까이 작업을하며 투혼을 보여주었다고 합니다. 그럼에도 무료 배포를 선언을 하였던 게임입니다.
물론 스팀에서는 유료로 팔리고있지만 결코 비싸지 않은 가격이며, 이 한사람의 게임에 대한 열정을 생각한다면 
이 두배라도 아깝지 않은 가격이라고 생각합니다. 물론 이건 지극히 주관적인 생각입니다. 어떤 이에겐 단순한격투게임이며 4:3 화면의 구닥다리 게임일수도습니다.

 이제와서 밝히지만 전 대한민국의 게임 개발자입니다. 객관적으로 이게임을 평가할수없고, 할생각도 없으며 그냥 이사람의 열정에 감동했습니다.
이런 노력을 하는 사람이 존경스러우며, 존중받아 마땅하다는 생각이 듭니다. 게다가 이런사람들이 많아졌으면 합니다. 이런 노력을 한사람이 정당한 노력의 대가( 비록 자신이 돈벌 목적으로  만든게 아니지만)를 받지못하고 사라진다면, 전 이세상에 인디게임을 만드는 사람들이 과연 어느 곳을 향해야 하는지 질문을 던지고 싶습니다.

게임자체는 엄청난 퀄리티의 도트그래픽이 눈을 잡아 끌고있고 , 그 수준은 같은시기에 가정용으로 이식된 블레이블루보다 나은정도라는 평가를 듣고있습니다.
 격투게임으로서의 가치는 무난한 수준이며, 수준높은 공방보다는 캐릭터게임에 쪽에 좀더 쏠려있다고 보시면됩니다.(4버튼+서포트키)

author: {'steamid': '76561198055708379', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1394580558}
{'steamid': '76561198096352982', 'num_games_owned': 351, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 755, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 506, 'last_played': 1585815634}
review:
Todo el mundo sabe que este juego fue un juego freeware del 2009, por eso muchos ni se plantearan comprar esta version, pero hay bastantes novedades que lo hacen interesante:

-La version que ofrece steam actualmente es la 1.41, la ultima freeware fue la 1.08, esto quiere decir que han actualizado bastante el juego, los cambios más notorios son en la IA, la han mejorado muchisimo, antes eran bastantes faciles pero ahora son mucho más inteligentes y dificiles.
-La traduccion, aparte de traducir, ofrece una interfaz casi igual de primitiva, pero mejorada, la pantalla de titulo tiene una imagen de una protagonista y ahora el menu de pausa te pone un controlador con las funciones de los botones.
Por lo demas, siguen estando los menus de configuracion igual.
-ChibiKaede (assit) ahora es seleccionable tanto en el arcade como en el versus de manera facil.
-Algo un poco molesto a sido que el mando, no detecta el D-pad, solo el Stick analogico, esto no se si se podra cambiar pero bueno, usando Xpadder no es ningun problema.

Por el precio por el que esta ahora + la venta de cromos que estan a dia de hoy bastantes caros, es una buena compra, si, fue un freeware pero es un juego que el creador tardo 3 años en desarrollar el solo y le quedo un juego de bastante calidad, se nota muchisimo el esfuerzo que le puso a esto, apoyarle comprandolo no me parece tan mal, ademas esta que han puesto un steam workshop, esto hace que en un futuro los fans (si al final no hay oficial del juego) puedan crear un netcode y se pueda jugar online.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996768425', 'num_games_owned': 411, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1393900008}
review:
So right off the bat I have to point out one important thing: this was originally a freeware game that has apparently had a few bugfixes? and localization. Not much has changed from the original state besides the addition of English for the very ignorable plot.

Knowing that, it's much more ridiculous how bad a deal this is technically. Nothing has changed from the freeware state, which raises the question of why should you pay for it.

The game doesn't have selectable resolutions so good luck keeping aspect ratio as you pull the window larger. The original resolution is very tiny as a result of using an extremely old and dated engine, Fighter Maker 2k. On top of that, it doesn't recognize my arcade stick's directional inputs. I suspect it won't register the POV hat as directions, and there's no way to change it. I resorted to Joy2Key; good job, game I paid money for.

Once you get the game running how you want it, there's no training mode to mess around with. You've got "Story" (arcade mode) and versus modes and that's it. There's no sort of tutorial and the manual is a mess. The manual constantly refers to buttons as ABXY instead of something more easily parsed like ABCD, which took some getting used to just to read it.

After jumping into the arcade mode and skipping past most of the translated text because it was immediately noninteresting, I messed around in the actual game itself, and wasn't really impressed there. The attacks are a simple Light, Medium, and Heavy system with an extra button for your assist character, who you also pick at the character select screen. This was a neat idea, but I didn't like the way it felt because the assist character moves around at a sort of lag compared to your character. On top of that, the assist characters are little girls not that much shorter than the other girls you play, so on screen it gets kinda busy and hard to read the situation. The UI in general is underwhelming. The biggest flaw is in the super and assist meters. You require meter in your assist meter to do anything with the assist attacks, but the meter is so small at the bottom of the screen that you have to strain yourself to read it. 

It's very clear a lot of work went into animating the game, and the animation is very fluid as a result. Unfortunately the designs leave a lot to be desired, as most are generic anime shlock, with a more adult oriented costume theme (man that final boss was silly looking). The assist characters are all little girls, and the regular characters are plucked from anime stereotypes. Uninspiring and unrelatable, and also not very good for the image of women in video games.

Overall the technical issues on top of the poor UI design and bad choices for sprite design with the assist characters make the game more of a headache to bother with. I played through with one character and I was done. If you want titilation go watch porn. If you want an anime fighting game and don't care about netplay BlazBlue Calamity Trigger just got released on Steam and has actual UI design and works with controllers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026137490', 'num_games_owned': 406, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 588, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 309, 'last_played': 1593325011}
review:
Yeah, it's a game made on Fighter Maker 2nd.
Yeah, it has a cast full of women and lolis here and there.
Yeah, I know, you may not like animuh visuals.

But you know what? This Fighter is better than most licensed mainstream stuff (I'm looking at you, Super Street Fighter IV)
The mechanics and characters are really balanced enough, the gameplay is like Street Fighter 2, that means you have to relay more on footsies and reading your opponent than making long combos and that.

And there's a character for everyone. Someone balanced? You have Yui. Stance character? There's Luna. Zoner? You have Haruka and Ayane whether you like to move around a lot or not.

Give this Fighter a chance, I'm sure you'll like for what it really is besides Luna.

Of course, being a FM2nd game it's has some drawbacks and I'm pretty sure these can be fixed in future patches, but that's for eigoMANGA to take care of, I'm sure they know what they have to fix (like netplay, it's important for a fighter, and also aspect ratio and fullscreen, some people are getting bad stretching and intense flickering)

author: {'steamid': '76561198102400128', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1405363318}

author: {'steamid': '76561197990875968', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1426583468}
review:
Its very basic. Low resolution. Missing a lot of modes. Its just story and VS with controller support but not tuned for it.

Some of the fighters feel a little inbalanced but if you have a good partner, it can make up for the weaknesses. Unfortunately the game doesn't tell you what each does or if it is going to be a good companion fighter. Some of them are easier to use than others. Honestly its a nice touch that makes it more than just a 2D fighter, but it makes the fights a little more complicated than it needs to be. You can often forget your partner is there.

There are 3 difficulties but they don't feel very different from each other. The AI also will suddenly go on a nonstop spree in any of the modes which can be a problem if your fighter isn't one that can defend against cqc attacks as well. Overall the difficulty isn't very balanced. You'll likely spend time hitting yes to continue until the AI one of the times decides not to go into OP mode. 

At the end of the day, this'll just be a Trading Cards game. Take it for what it is. You get what you pay for. It won't beat BlazBlue or others like it. Don't expect perfection and you'll probably like it for awhile before you forget it and move on.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087543759', 'num_games_owned': 256, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1666131118}
review:
Pra quem entende de mangá e anime, esse jogo tem "ecchi" que é um termo japonês para erotismo, contrário do "hentai" que esta mais voltado para pornografia. A versão original desse jogo é gratuita; e esta versão é censurada, você tem que baixar uma DLC (que é gratuita) pra ter o conteúdo sem frescuras -- por que os norte americanos tem horror a calcinha.

No mais o jogo é bom: tem gráficos bonitos que exigem pouco (ou quase nada) do PC, e a música assim como os efeitos sonoros não deixam a desejar. Os controles são bons e intuitivos, e consegui usar meu joystick mesmo jogando através do Wine (Linux Mint).
Bom pra passar o tempo se você tem alguém com quem jogar em casa pois existem poucos modos de jogo, pois até o momento em que escrevo o jogo online ainda não está disponível.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986448970', 'num_games_owned': 8182, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 476, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1414466775}
review:

Aside from that, this is a fun anime style fighter to play if you can actually focus on the fight and not on the babes details. :P

author: {'steamid': '76561198080507447', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1396583261}
review:
So yeah... Hilde (The Final Boss) has a insanely broken AI and will completely curbstomp anyone new to fighting games or are just not good at them period. Hilde is Broken... and with this games super high learning curve she will have you seeing the "continue?" screen more times then you would want to.

For those of you wondering, yes i have the version off of amazon. and ive been trying ever since i bought this game last year to beat her with any of the games cast. To this day i have yet to beat Hilde, to this day ive never seen hilde with little over half her health left. She is that ♥♥♥♥ing broken!

From input reading BS to Screen wide attacks she does not play around and creates massive frustration. Hell i even went so far as to put the game into easy mode and she still obliterates you.

Try playing Defensively? Nope Hilde will break your guard hella quick and spam long range attacks as well as her support that recharges insanely fast and does a crap ton of damage.

Try to go aggresive? Hope you like seeing the game over screen. Hilde's AI abusives the ♥♥♥♥ out of perfect guard and beleive me when she gets a perfect guard off watch your hp drop by half.

She has way to many op choices to use against you, and i understand shes the final boss, she's suppose to be difficult, but her AI is up there with Arcana hearts 3 score attack final boss... But at least that boss is beatable if you continue 30+ times since she starts the fight with less and less health after that point...

Lets count the things wrong with this uber ♥♥♥♥♥...

1. Can perfect Gaurd with near god like reflex leading to you losing way to much health.

2. Ignores your Supports Attacks, anything under lvl 3 she seems to ignore it.

3. Her own Support recharges at a stupdily high rate allowing her to spam the unimaginable amount of attacks her 2 supports have.

4. Her supports can attack you while hitting Hilde, THIS IS THE BIGGEST PROBLEM. No matter how badly you have Hilde in a combo you can rest assured her double Supports will send you flying across the stage allowing Hilde to spam long range attacks that when blocked do stupid amounts of chip damage. God forbid she blocks a string of attacks cuz the Supports will combo you right back...

5. Her AI is way to damn difficult to deal with even on easy setting. Whats the point of making the boss super hard on EASY??? Im not very good at fighting games, i admit, but in any other fighting game, if i set the game to EASY i can at least get through it and win. Hilde Pretty much makes it impossible to beat this game as any of the characters. 

6. The sudden change in her AI from previous versions. Why was her AI made this hard? In earlier versions of the Game i was able ot beat her up to normal mode due to her AI being managable. On Easy Mode she went down fast, on normal she was somewhat difficult but beatable. So Why? Why was her AI suddenly buffed up to this level of broken? I just dont understand the reasons for this.

Hilde making the game impossible for me to beat is a complete deal breaker... 

My only hope of ever enjoying this game again is if the devs nerf her... cuz she needs one BADLY. until then... major deal breaker...

author: {'steamid': '76561198013391143', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 415, 'last_played': 1403846102}
review:
This game is 2 on 2 fighting game.
You will have selected main character and support character to fight other.
[10 main characters / 5 support characters]
This game has only two mode is Story and VS [local only, no online]
Gameplay is very exciting but you have to learn about character's move first.
Bad news is character's move list is only at character's select screen but no need to worry because you will remembered after try 2-3 rounds [maybe]
After all, most thing that made me love this game is 2D animation, gameplay, story and Japanese sound!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198004791161', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1395175570}
review:
무료 게임 버젼에서 돈을 내고 플레이 할 만큼의 가치는 없다.
그냥 무료 게임이었던 것을 라이센스 받아서 팔려고 올린 거 같다.
일부 밸런스 조정은 있었던 것 같긴 하지만, 그것이 이 게임의 유료화를 정당화 시키기엔 어렵다.
특히나 네트워크 게임의 부재는 심각하다.
나름대로 기대하고 있었던 부분이었으나, 어디에서도 네트워크 게임을 찾을 수 없었다.
요즘 대전게임의 꽃이라면 네트워크 모드일텐데, 전혀 그에 관련된 개발을 하지 않은 듯 했다.
아니, 정말로 뱅가드 프린세스의 첫 버젼부터 이어오던 심플한 모드 두 개 뿐이었다(시나리오 모드와 대전 모드).
그리고 서포트 캐릭터로 힐더를 예전 랜덤뽑기가 아닌, 확정적으로 고를 수 있다는 것 뿐이다.
하다못해, 연습 모드는 별개로 만들어 줄 수 있지 않았을까?
게임을 연습하려면, 여전히 대전 모드에 들어가서 1P와 2P의 연습 키를 눌러 활성화 시키는 방법밖에 없다.
물론, 연습모드가 된다 해서, 다른 게임들의 친절한  연습 모드를 기대할 수는 없다. 
게임 기동 시의 2D격투게임만들기 로고와 엔터브레인 로고가, eigoMANGA라는 판매자 로고와 일본대지진 응원 로고로 바뀌어 있고, 모든 언어가 영어로 바뀌었을 뿐, 이 게임은 무료 버젼에 비해 큰 메리트가 없다.
정말로 이 게임의 가치를 높히기 위해 어떠한 투자도 안 했다는 느낌이다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025230695', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1393931361}
review:
While I do enjoy the battlesystem of the game, it's not possible to use a arcade stick or the D-pad for some weird reason. The only way to play/move the characters is using the analog stick or the keyboard, and I dislike using either for a fighting game. Changing the buttons used for up/down and left/right is not possible.
I hope, that they'll fix this, because, to be honest, I have enjoyed playing the bit that I have played. I'm not going to give the game a negative recommendation because of this problem either, because it's a personal preference.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023837248', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1393879450}
review:
Do you ever log onto Steam one day, look at the new games list and think "Oh, I didn't expect to see that."?

THIS IS THAT GAME.

"This Year's Skullgirls" my ass, this is really bad. It's a fighter with only local coop, 640x480 resolution and limited controller support. The game is boring and repetitive, it the movesets are awful and...The DLC.

It's a nude patch.

[spoiler]I still recommend it though[/spoiler]
